placeInfo/address: 30 Sir Mohamed Macan Markar Mawatha, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
Having spent the last six months travelling in Sri Lanka, it’s time to wind down in preparation to head back home. I’ve seen all Colombo has to offer and indeed it’s a glorious city and the people are rightly proud of this. Initially I wanted to use The Colombo Swimming Club but was denied access as I’m not a member. How ironic that it was built by expatriates to relax in. Then a British national is refused.

I then went to Thurston College Pool but was denied there as there was water polo scheduled that afternoon. So rather than spend the afternoon traipsing around the city, I headed to Ramada hotel. Known for priding itself on excellence and the finest hospitality. What could go wrong?

Everything can go wrong in this hotel. Staff greet you professionally and are courteous, kind and engaging. I pay the 2,000 rupees fee for use of the pool. I then head to the cafe for a coffee and a fruit salad. I look for a table to sit at but the only one with free seats hasn’t been cleaned. Having no choice, I sit at that table and clear the table myself. My Americano is brought to me shortly.

I then head to the poolside and as luck would have it, I have it all to myself. The pool boy takes my ticket and hands me a towel that’s in very poor condition. Bleach marks are all over it. I have no locker key to store my valuables so I bring my bag next to the sun lounger. After swimming intermittently for almost an hour, I fancy some food.

I ask the pool boy how do I order some food and beverages? He goes to the hotel and informs me somebody will be along in five minutes. Twenty minutes later a staff member approaches me without a menu and asks what I would like? He then sends a server along in three minutes with a menu. I order a cappuccino, mango lassi and a chicken caesar  salad.

The drinks are brought along first and the server goes to put them on an empty lounger as apposed to the empty table? Who trains these staff? It’s mind boggling really. After instructing him politely where to place it, he sheepishly walks off. He has no badge on his shirt so I can’t address him unfortunately. He’s pleasant enough, just really shy.

The cappuccino is probably the worst one I’ve had in my entire six months of being here. The mango lassi fares much better. Then after 6/7 minutes the salad arrives. This was merely two chicken skewers, a lot of lettuce leaves, a boiled egg and a round piece of toast with a hole in it! I ate the chicken and tossed the bread to the birds who were squawking in a nearby tree!

Poolside you can hear easy listening music by means of a piano or an acoustic guitar. I recognise several tunes as they are western classics. One of them playing was Bryan Adam’s, Everything I do, I do it for you. Fitting then that today’s visit has been exactly the opposite. It feels more like Michael Jackson’s BAD!
title: Atrocious.

ownerResponse/text:

roomTip: There are better options, choose them! This hotel doesn’t know what hospitality means.
text:
Disappointing Experience at Ramada Colombo - Poor policy and services.

We were on international trip to Sri Lanka and stayed at Ramada Colombo from June 8th to June 9th. The reason to choose Ramada was it being an International brand. I was an in house guest, all room charges paid in full in advance. 

Me and my wife went out to the city with our son back in the room and while going out we had ordered food for him. The hotel staff asked my 11 year old son to pay for the food. He said parents are out, again after 10-15 minutes they called him multiple times on intercom to pay the food bill. 

On return, when I told them about this bad experience and requested to settle the bill at checkout—as is standard practice at most hotels, I was bluntly told “This is our policy.” It felt pushy and unprofessional, especially when one is trying to relax on vacation.

Few more things which I find negative about this hotel
- They are charging whooping 34% service charge + tax for this pathetic and unprofessional services
- When we checked into our room, there was an electrical failure. Two teams came one after the other to try and fix it, but after wasting quite a bit of our time, we were finally asked to move to another room.
- The staff overall were not welcoming — no smiles, no greetings, no basic warmth you expect from a hospitality business. This made the atmosphere uncomfortable and cold.  But, this is just at Ramada, not seen anywhere else all along our 7 day trip.
- Everytime you order something or eat at their restaurant they want payment then and there. This rigid and frankly unwelcoming approach reflects poor hospitality and a lack of trust in paying guests. It was an embarrassing and uncomfortable experience that left a bad impression

I expected better from a reputed hotel brand.
Not staying here again, and I wouldn’t recommend it to others expecting professional service and guest-friendly policies. There are definitely better options available in the city that understand true hospitality.
title: Disappointing Experience at Ramada Colombo - Poor policy and services!

text:
I am astonished by the positive reviews for this hotel. Our room was unclean, smelt badly of damp and it needed to be redecorated.

We arrived after 20hrs of travelling, quite exhausted. The reception area looked good and  we thought it seemed like a nice hotel until we reached our room

Our room on the 3rd floor was very dusty and it smelt badly of damp. Had we not been absolutely exhausted, we would have certainly complained, however we just wanted to sleep and knew we just had one day in Columbo. Over the next day I found the tv did not work, the iron was stuck on 1 temperature and the sheets were stained. I have taken a few pictures to share here but they do not recreat the smell of damp! 

In terms of service, there seem to be an abundance of staff here. Sadly though, they seem to like chatting with each other rather than serving guests. For example,  the bar was pretty much empty but I still had to remind the staff member that I had ordered drinks. 

The only positive thing I can say about this hotel is that the pool was good for swimming lengths.

 
Having stayed in quite a few Ramada's in the past, and enjoyed them, I realise I cannot rely on that in future. I just wonder how these other reviews are so glowing....
title: Not very clean and needs an overhaul

text:
It is with deep regret I’m sharing this unpleasant experience I had at your Gardenia restaurant.

We had dinner and the food was excellent but the service given was way below standard. 

There was an extra bill that we had never ordered. On top of that when we inquired whether we could have coffee after dinner, we were pushed around from one place to another. 
Finally when we asked whether we could have it at the same restaurant that we had dinner, the manager bluntly refused. 
His explanation was that a foreign group has just checked in and they need the entire restaurant to serve them. He even asked us to sit outside on a sweltering hot evening to have coffee. 
I found his attitude terribly unprofessional and not at all welcoming. 
He (Mr. Imtiyaz) really need to know that we local should also be treated equally and courteously. 
I must say another two people with him too were very rude to us. 

At this point the front office manager (Mr. Nipun) who acted swiftly asked us to follow him to the lobby and ordered us coffee from room service. He made it a point to sit with us and listen to our complaint patiently. 

I found entire staff at the front office extremely efficient including duty manager Chamith. 

I hope my complaint will get due attention and the management will seriously look into some kind of training and change the attitude of the F&B manager and their poor service in future.
title: Unpleasant incident had  at the Gardinia restaurant

text: We booked the High tea buffet on 10th April 2023 for the date of 27th April 2023. (Per person 3600lkr)  However on 23rd April 2023 they called and informed us that buffet will not be available and instead they can serve us a high tea platter for a lower price (4600lkr for 2 people). We were quite  unhappy with this change as it was sudden and because we were planning for a buffet, but since it was too late to book another place we went along with it.  We inquired about choice of beverages  and availability , they said only iced tea will be served without a choice. There was no flexibility seen by the staff when we asked for at least a choice of hot or cold beverages.  Despite being said that they will serve iced tea, we were served an ice coffee . When we inquired about the iced tea they mentioned before, they said they only serve iced coffee at high tea.  Apparently there was a miscommunication with the staff who contacted us. When it comes to the platter the pieces were extremely small , smaller than finger sized food. Savoury foods were not spicy at all and not much variation in the taste.  Lastly we were the served the lemon iced tea as promised. And it was the worst out of all, quite tasteless. And the staff was in a rush to clean the table before we even finished eating. Customer service was horrible. Highly disappointed in this hotel , it being one of the most reputed ones in colombo. Would never recommend anyone to ever visit this hotel.
title: Unsatisfactory Service

Dear Ramesh,

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience, we're truly sorry to hear that your stay fell short of expectations.

We appreciate you acknowledging the beauty of the property and the space, but it’s clear that several aspects didn't meet the standard we aim for. Cleanliness, pool maintenance, limited dining flexibility, and the absence of air conditioning are all areas where you had valid concerns. We’re especially sorry that you didn’t feel supported by the team, that’s something we take very seriously and are already addressing internally.

Our nature-based concept and seasonal operations aren’t for everyone, but your feedback helps us better serve all guests, regardless of where they’re from or what they’re used to. Thank you again, we’re learning from this.
placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
text:
For Anyone Considering a Stay

I would like to share my recent experience at Kapiti. The area operates on two seasons: the off-season and the main season. We visited in April, and it seemed quite empty during our stay.

The property itself has a lovely view and plenty of space. However, the cleanliness was not up to my expectations; I found lizard droppings in both the room and the bathroom.

The swimming pool was quite neglected, filled with algae, so we opted not to use it.

As for dining options, the hotel has limited offerings. The Alacarte menu is only available from 1 PM to 3:30 PM, and outside those hours, no meals are served. The only snacks available were french friese, cashews, roasted coconut, and a couple of others. There was no room service, so I had to retrieve everything myself, and the staff wasn't particularly helpful.

For dinner, our choices were limited to a basic rice and curry dish with only one seafood option, at a cost of 3,900 per adult. There wasn’t much flexibility in the menu.

Additionally, the room lacked air conditioning, making it quite uncomfortable at night.

Whenever I raised concerns, the response was that this establishment is designed for foreign guests and aimed at embracing a nature-oriented concept.

I would recommend exploring other accommodations if you're considering a stay at this hotel.
title: Horrible

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Nilu and family,

Thank you for your review. Glad you enjoyed your stay in our unique villas and cabanas. At the same time we read your discomfort about food and beverage service in your lines.

We had inquired from our F&B team and came to understand that they tried their very best to meet your special requests. I like to state that we are not normally offering room service on our 22 acre beach front property for obvious reasons.Out of curtesy and good will towards you, our staff tried to accommodate your requests to their best ability. At the time you had ordered your spaghetti, actually no spaghetti were available in our stores and also not with our supplier. As you can imagine, certain foreign food items are frequently out of stock in remote areas such as Kappalady beach, which is still a secluded fishing village and for which's beauty people especially come here.

Our menu and meals concept caters for the international market primarily. However we always try to accommodate special requests from our valued Sri Lankan guest as far as they are in our staff capacity. We have introduced fixed meal times in order to protect our kitchen and restaurant staff allowing them to get adequate breaks during their shifts. This we practice in adherence the Sri Lankan labor law. Kindly understand that we are constantly endeavour to balance between our guests special requests and our staffs welfare and rest times, whilst keeping cost at an adequate level.   

In this light kindly consider whether your overall rating about your stay is adequate. However, should you consider to stay again at Elements in the future, we would be delighted to offer you a free meal from our A la Carte menu you and your  entire family. 

With kind regards from Kappalady Beach, 

Marcel Bobay
Chairman, Elements Beach & Nature Resort

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Cindy,

First of all: Apologies for getting back so late to your review. We are sorry to hear that you didn't like your stay and the fact that there are bottles laying around and nobody of the staff was taking care of is not acceptable and does not meet the Elements standard at all. 

Food: If you could give a little more feedback of what you did not like it would help us a lot. Not enough variety? Too heavy? Bad taste? We are trying to serve fresh and tasty food. We grow most of the vegetable and fruit in our own garden, so it's sad to hear that the food was not good.

Resort dried and deserted: Rainy seasons are mainly April and November. The combination with strong wind during June and July may lead to how you describe it although I feel that "dried and deserted" could lead to a bit inaccurate impression. There are still hundreds of coconut palm trees on the premises but the grass may not be as green as during the winter month.

Hope that besides all you had some good kitesurfing sessions and enjoyed the rest of Sri Lanka!

Best regards
Laurent & Team Elements

roomTip: Book via booking.com then later get ur hidden charges refunded...
text:
Refund from Elements...

If you book via booking.com and elements incorrectly charge the 10 % service charge n 4% debit card fee. Here is the process for a refund:

Dont bother talking to resort about money becoz in reality u r just a bum tourist and ur card account may still be "open". Scan ur bills.

When you have have left the area/country send an email saying u have been:

"overcharged and that it was unwise to cause a fuss in such a currupt, lawless country. It would also be unwise to give them my card details again once my account has been closed, as they are clearly dishonest. In the circumstances please could you refund *** USD/€ directly"

Cant imagine why Samsmith, the manager didnt cooperate sooner (two opportunities).Booking.com are very influencial!

To be fair I enjoyed my stay at Elements, and food was great, but the financial dishonesty left its mark.

On a more general note. It is always better to book without giving card details if possible (especially in Asia). Kitegarden, kalpitiya (no hidden charges) took my booking, no card needed. A nice family business, however money transfer companies can take up to a week so initiate early.

Savings

10% elements service charge..
4%  elements card charge..
5% card uk bank charge..
Extra meal for 2 every day...
title: Great food but dishonest management...

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr. Lukas,

You are correct, Elements is not a kite camp, it is a boutique watersports resort. It seems that the tour operator should have recommended you a simple cheap kite camp where singles go and mingle. In winter Elements is focusing on Dolphin & Whale Watching, Kitesurfing, Stand Up Paddling in the nearby untouched lagoons, Beach Relaxation, Scuba Diving, Ayurveda and Yoga. As the only hotel in the Kappalady / Kalpitiya region we are located directly at the sea and the kite lagoon at the same time. 
You came very early in the winter-season, the wind direction was still from straight North - then the Kappaldy lagoon is not ideal as you correctly noticed. Throughout the entire year however the Kappalady lagoon has the much better and more consistent wind than Kalpitiya lagoon – especially since several large wind power plants have recently been erected in front of the Kalpitiya lagoon. All the Kite schools in Kalpitiya are there because the Kappalady lagoon was taken by the 2 first operators in Sri Lanka in the year 2008 already (Kite Kuda and Elements) 

Apologize that you have picked a harness which obviously had a weak point. The instructor should have noticed, but it probably slipped her attention. As you came very early in the season things like this can happen with a higher probability – however they obviously shouldn’t! Here we would like to mention that we have reimbursed you for all the days you were not able to kite out of pure curtesy ( even though you came on a prearranged / prepaid package)

You spoke about the rescue situation. Since the wind is in both seasons 95% side-onshore and there are absolutely no obstacles we very rarely have to rescue people. You required a number of rescues for which every kitecenter in the world would at some point charge. You lost your board for which you have not done a lost & damage insurance. So it is reasonable that an operator would charge the guest for a loss of equipment.  However we informed you that most probably your board would surface again – and a local fishermam brought it 2 days later to our kitecenter ;-)

So all in all we feel sorry that you obviously were looking for a cheap camp and ended up at Elements Resort. We will take this up with the tour operator and wish you more luck in choosing your camp the next time. With regards and best wishes,

The management
placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
text:
I was sent to Elements Resort by a professional travel agency from switzerland, called sudden rush, where i said, i would like to go to a nice kite-camp. I stayed there 17 days altogether. It cost me a lot of money, since for Sri Lanka, Elements Resort is really expensive. But what i got in return was only a big frustration. Here's my experience:

- First and most important: The resort is situated at the WRONG lagoon. Its situated at the kappalady lagoon, while there is another lagoon, called the kalpitya lagoon, 20km away. As a local guy told me at my very last day: "You were at the wrong lagoon. Specially in winter, the kalpitya lagoon is much better." In the 17 days, there was not one single day, when i could use kappalady lagoon, while they were kiting on the kalpitya lagoon every second or third day. Thats why almost every other kite-camp is located at the kalpitya lagoon.

- The kite-instructor arrived 2 days before me. She knew as little about the conditions as i knew. So we were waiting for the wind, while on the other lagoon, they were on the water.

- The material is in a bad condition. During the first lesson, we wanted to make sure, the quick release is working. I released it. The kite just flew away, because the harness was in such a bad condition that it couldnt hold the safety leash. On top, there were no shoes in my size. This may sound picky, but for the big money i payed, i really got little.

- Its not a camp, its a family resort. If you like that, its ok there, but i wanted to go kite surfing and be together with other kite surfers. On the rare occasions there was wind, i was alone in the sea! (You couldnt use the wind on the lagoon, because there it was too choppy.) Thats not what you imagine of a kite camp, isnt it?

- The rescue team was a catastrophe. Basically, it didnt exist. It was the kitchen team! They coudnt swim, thats why they first had to put live jackets, and they came with SUP-board! The other day, when i really needed them, because i lost my board and couldnt reach for it anymore, no one was paying attention. At the end, they wanted to charge 30$ for the rescue service (the one that wasnt there, when i needed it) and for the lost board they wanted to charge 300$ plus an additional service charge of 10%. For what service exactely? (Fortunately the board was found later and i just had to pay a reward for the guy who found it.)

- The guy running the resort, the so called manager, is a real rip-off artist. I rented a car, when i later found out, that he was charging 3 times as much as i would have payed at another place!

- Theres a neighbour to the resort that has an enormous sound machine. Every night, hes listening to music on a very high level. Altough your in perfect nature, it fells like youre beside a disco. (Apperantly, the owners already talked with the guy, but they cant do much.)

- To be fair, i have to say, that the food was good, and the people owning the place are really kind and helpful, but that doesnt change the fact, that its not a place for kite surfing.
title: Never again, specially NOT for kite-surfing

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr. Rainer,

Thank you for sharing your feedback about your recent stay with us. We truly appreciate your kind words regarding the beauty of our resort and the friendliness of our team.

We deeply regret to hear that your experience was impacted by external noise from nearby temple ceremonies. While we are fortunate to be surrounded by a culturally rich and vibrant community, we understand how such events can affect the peace and tranquility that many of our guests seek. Please accept our sincere apologies for the inconvenience this caused during your stay.

Unfortunately, as these ceremonies are part of the local traditions, they are beyond our control. However, your comments highlight an area where we can improve in setting expectations for our guests. Moving forward, we will ensure to provide more detailed information to guests regarding nearby events during their intended stay.

We genuinely value your feedback and hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future under quieter circumstances, so you can fully enjoy the serenity and beauty of our resort.

Warm regards,
Team Aarunya.

roomTip: Check with the hotel before you make the booking if there will be any ceremonies broadcasted from the surrounding temples during your stay.
text:
For this resort you need strong nerves or excellent noise cancelling headphones which you are prepared to use day and night. 

The resort is located beautifully in a marvellous landscape where you could listen to the sounds of nature only. 

However  , alas is is surrounded by temples where ceremonies can take place all day and are being broadcasted via loudspeaker with unbearable volume. ( including obituaries with people very sadly crying over loudspeaker ) 

The undoubtedly extremely friendly and kind staff cannot do anything to help. Perhaps it was just our misfortune- but three out of our four days there we were stuck in a very nerve wrecking situation having arrived in  need for peace and tranquility . Better check before you go there if any  ceremonies will be taking place during your stay
title: Beautiful resort, kind and friendly staff but nervewrecking noise all day

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Warm greetings from the sunny corridors of Aarunya!

We extend our sincerest apologies for any inconvenience experienced during your recent visit. Regrettably, a technical issue arose concerning your original booking, which, despite our best efforts, we were unable to fulfill. However, we swiftly arranged alternative accommodations of a similar standard and orchestrated a special dinner in acknowledgment of the inconvenience caused.

Upon receipt of your complaint, our dedicated team sprang into action, promptly involving local authorities to address the matter. In response, we bolstered security measures, stationing additional police guards and hotel security in the vicinity of your room to ensure your safety and peace of mind. Despite our earnest attempts to rectify the situation, we understand that you declined our offers, including alternative room arrangements and various amenities, for which we deeply regret.

In your statement, you indicated that staff members were implicated in the burglary. However, thorough police investigations, involving all on-duty staff present during the incident, found no evidence supporting this claim. Following the police inquiry, the hotel management issued a formal apology and extended a comprehensive offer of assistance to address the situation.

Please be assured that we are actively collaborating with law enforcement authorities, and updates regarding the ongoing investigation will be communicated to you as soon as they become available.

While this isolated incident is unprecedented in our history, we remain committed to the well-being and satisfaction of our guests. As a precautionary measure, we encourage all patrons to utilize the safety deposit boxes provided within each room to safeguard their valuables.

Thank you for your understanding and patience in this matter.

Best Regards,

Sumeda Yasaratne
General Manager
placeInfo/address: 100 Malgamandeniya Road Alawatugoda, Kandy, Kandy 20140 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Please do not stay here :(
text:
Our stay at Aarunya in Sri Lanka was a complete NIGHTMARE

Upon our arrival, we were allocated the wrong room, which already raised concerns about the hotel's organisation and attention to detail. Little did we know that this rooms CCTV was  conveniently 'broken'.

When we were out for dinner our room was broken into and our valuables stolen. The sliding doors to our room were smashed in, leaving us not only devastated but feeling violated and unsafe. 

On request, the police were called and statements were taken. What is perhaps even more shocking than the burglary itself is the complete lack of accountability and compassion from the hotel staff. Despite reporting the incident immediately and expressing our distress, we were offered no apology or refund from the management.

It is abundantly clear to us that Aarunya played a significant role in the burglary (hotel IPAD was left in room), whether through negligence or complicity. The fact that they have not taken any responsibility for their failures speaks volumes about their priorities and ethics.

Upon speaking with locals, it's become clear, there has been previous reports of burglary at Aarunya and allegations of misconduct. If we had known this, we obviously would not had stayed. 

In conclusion, I urge everyone to steer clear of Aaarunya in Sri Lanka. Not only does it fail to provide even the most basic security measures for its guests, but its callous disregard for our well-being is utterly disgusting.
title: Burglary and Betrayal

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Ms. Liuzzi,
 
We have received your review with mixed emotions. While fully expecting you to publish your thoughts, based on multiple threats and your overall mood, we certainly did not expect you to go to the extent that you have. We apologize once again, however note that we took all possible steps in our control to rectify these issues during your stay. 
While many of the issues faced by you during your stay were directly related to a bad power supply of the main grid, and were rectified immediately by the staff, some of the other areas highlighted in your review were not brought to our attention. Also not stated is that we tried multiple times to offer you a complementary upgrade into a most luxurious villas in the premises, to solve most of your complaints regarding the room that you have booked , which you declined. Instead we are quite surprised that you decided to post photos after you completed your full 6 nights at Aarunya, after demanding a full refund and settling for a complementary stay. What's also not mentioned in your review is that in spite of offering to assist your endless demands with transferring you to another hotel, you declined that offer as well. In spite of the staff doing everything within their power to ensure your stay was beyond exceptional, sadly it was clear beyond a certain point that there was nothing anyone could do to make your stay better, and your comments on the review do not acknowledge the efforts taken. We have nonetheless addressed the outstanding points highlighted by you, while maintaining that your comment on rates being higher than the Maldives is subjective. 
We thank you forthe kind feedback on the views, hopefully you took some pictures and would like to share it with us, as 99% of our online image and review content is guest generated, together with wonderful memories of their stays with us.  
 
We remain committed to offering the highest levels of service to all guests in the future, and we are sorry we did not meet your expectations this time.
placeInfo/address: 100 Malgamandeniya Road Alawatugoda, Kandy, Kandy 20140 Sri Lanka
text:
Nice views, however would like to share our experience (see pictures of our room). No Air conditioning working. No hot water. The AC of the gym was also broken. Running machine not working. Coffee machine broken. All iron handrails in the room are pealed off and are rusted. The toilet had a weird leakage and bad smell. Under our room there was a massive storage of construction stuff with was giving a bad smell. Lights in the terrace were broken. 

More than once we had food with a maintenance guy around us trying to fix things that would constantly break down. Staff are really untrained.

The manager left on his weekend off on our arrival and no one in the hotel was able to make a decision to make things better. We was fully unavailable.

The price was higher than going to the Maldives, we asked for a refund of 50% and it was given to us by the Manager when he finally got back. The price does not match the experience at all. 

The hotel is definitely not what it looks like in the professional pictures they have. 

The views are incredible and the Ayurvedic treatments are nice, but we left the hotel more stressed that when we arrived. 

We regret having visited that place, we wasted a week of our holidays that we won’t be able to get back 🥺
title: Nice views - Lack of Maintenance

text:
I wish to share an unpleasant stay my family had at Aarunya Nature Resort and Spa in Aalawathygoda Kandy on 5th,6th 7th March 2020.
 
At the time of check in we were requested to settle payment in full which we did and were subsequently taken to the two Sky Tents we had booked for two nights. The Sky Tents were exquisite and the view from them was extremely pictureous.
 
However the service being offered by the staff was extremely lukewarm and unfriendly except for just one single individual, Indu. 

When requesting a buggy for my pregnant daughter in law to be taken down a 45 degree slope to her Sky Tent, we were informed they were not authorized to do so by the “Management”. Also despite charging Triple rates for one of the Sky Tents, the coffee making facility was available only for double occupancy which remain that way up to the time of checkout. 
 
The set menus on offer were mediocre and the portions served inadequate. The complimentary nightly room turndown on offer was done only on one night and the GM did not meet us in person even though we were aware he was on the property on the day we booked in.

Its not a property we would visit again.
title: Disappointing

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Thank you for your review. I was away from the hotel last evening but was aware of the prevailing issues concerning your booking and stay while it was happening. 

As you are aware, we are a nature resort which you booked knowingly. Our energy conservation efforts were clearly explained to you during your room introduction including all available alternates to ensure your stay was comfortable. We are not in the habit of running electricity for hours to heat a jacuzzi not in use as it goes against our business principals. Unfortunately a 600 liter Jacuzzi does not heat up in minutes and we would have appreciated your understanding in this regards. The pouring of hot water into the Jacuzzi is not a standard of the hotel, rather the effort of the staff to fix a problem they felt needed fixing based on your demands. 

In regards to your requested refund, you have failed to mention that we offered to first upgrade you to our highest category villa. You refused. We then offered to relocate you to another villa that was awaiting arrival of another guest, you refused that too. You have also failed to mention that you gladly accepted the complementary dinner that was extended and not charged. We hope that you take the time to read the reviews of our past guests which clearly indicate that we go to great measures and practice extraordinary standards of service in ensuring our guests a pleasant stay. I am sorry to note that you felt different. For these reasons only a refund partial or otherwise was refused because it was clear you were only interested in getting your money back, rather than enjoying your night at Aarunya as per the free upgrade on offer or the opportunity of staying in an equal category villa.  

Best wishes, 

Alec van Cuylenburg 
General Manager

text:
Positive:
Friendly staff. Wonderful View

Negative:

Certainly not a resort, just a group of villas with no Spa nor a Gym. I am not sure how it can be called a resort, it is more of a group of villas... Only small lobby, and only few staff members (maybe 5) that were doing all the job; for example, the person who helped us with our luggage during check-in (who was by the way very polite and friendly) was the same one who made our omelet the next morning

Spa ! well if you can call a five adjacent small rooms that are open all day for animals and different type of insects to roam around a Spa, then yes it is a spa. The spa is basically few small rooms, has no lounge, no resting area,and no facilities. Moreover, This luxurious resort’s spa, has no full time staff at the spa, so you have to give them a notice before so they can call someone from outside to do the massage for you !

The Gym is basically a very (very) small room, has no proper lighting, and bunch of equipments were put there. The way to the gym is dirty and dark. They used the space around the gym entrance as a storage area, so you can imagine the type of insect/animals you’ll encounter trying to reach the gym. 

Electricity frequently cuts off

AC is not working properly

Apart from the view, i couldn’t find any justification for the price.... overestimated, and I won’t recommend it to anyone for sure
title: Villas... Not a Resort

The buffet had fewer varieties, especially seafood varieties, even though it was closer to the sea, and the chefs were pleasant and supportive, but needed to improve the cleanliness and table arrangements. The room arrangement was poor, and it wasn't stocked considering the occupancy. We have to repeatedly call to request and remind staff to provide the necessities, and they were providing excuses as well (As example,'' we give only 2 water bottles for a day for 3 people). Need a lot more staff training for most of the staff.

Overall disappointed by the gesture received from the 5-Star hotel.

roomTip: Very disappointed. Not recommend to use.
text:
We stayed at Le - Grand Hotel, Galle from May 11th to May 12th, 2025, on a Full Board, (Double) basis, and unfortunately, our experience was far from what we expected from a 5-star hotel.

🔹 Location & View:
The only highlight of our stay was the stunning view of the Galle Fort. The hotel’s location is excellent close to the Galle fort with beautiful scenery.

🔹 Room Issues:
The room allocated to us was not in good condition. The main door lock was faulty, and although a technician was sent to fix it after i made a request to rectify, it took about 45 minutes, disturbing our privacy and taking away from our short one day stay.
Additionally, the balcony door wouldn’t close properly and remained unfixed during our stay creating a serious security and comfort concern.

🔹 In-room Amenities:
Despite our booking being for 2 people on FB basis, the room was only arranged and stocked for one person, only one bottle of water, single sets of tea/coffee, shampoo, body wash and etc. I had to repeatedly call, request and remind staff to provide necessities what we required for 2 people.

To make matters worse, one of the towels provided was damaged, which was shocking and unacceptable from a hotel claiming to be 5-star. (Photo attached)

🔹 Dining Experience:
The dinner buffet had very limited variety and the food quality was poor. The breakfast buffet was even worse. Certain items like sausages and eggs were hidden and not freely offered unless specifically requested. We asked for two cheese omelets, but after waiting for nearly 30 minutes, we received only one, and it didn’t even have cheese.

🔹 Checkout Experience:
Our checkout was scheduled at 12 PM, but since lunch was only served from 1:30 PM, we requested a late checkout, which was denied. We were left waiting outside until lunch started.
Adding insult to injury, instead of a buffet lunch (which was part of the FB plan), we were given an à la carte menu, as the hotel claimed low occupancy. During this time, staff behavior was unwelcoming. they looked at us as if we were loitering, which made us feel very uncomfortable and disrespected.

🔹 Overall Summary:

- Poor room condition and maintenance
- Insufficient in room amenities for a double occupancy
- Damaged towel provided. This is totally unacceptable and disappointed (Photo attached)
- Low quality food and lack of verities in buffet offerings
- Poor service and unacceptable attitude by some staff when we were waiting for the lunch despite FB booking
- No flexibility with check-out (Even we booked FB basis)

Our stay at Le Grand Hotel, Galle was extremely disappointing and not worth the premium pricing and the 5-star rating. We would not recommend this hotel, especially if you’re expecting comfort, proper service, or value for money.
title: Extremely Disappointing Stay at Le - Grand Hotel, Galle, Sri Lanka– Not Worth the 5-Star Rating

roomTip: Do not stay, guests get money stolen even from the room and safe
text:
As other guests have stated I too also had MONEY STOLEN at the pool and restaurant, in the room by the hotel staff. 

I had a mixed experience at this hotel. The pool surrounds and gardens were lovely and well maintained, and the beach had a nice inlet for swimming. Dinner was enjoyable, and the seafood restaurant was a nice option. Check-in was easy, which was a plus. My bed sheets were stained everyday (photos attached) 

While there were some nice aspects, I wouldn’t stay here again given the issues with service and security.
title: MONEY STOLEN BY HOTEL STAFF

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Try to Book a room without meals and explore local restaurants for better dining options.
text: We stayed at Le Grand Galle for two nights but for the price it didn’t live up to expectations.It looks luxurious on social media but in reality it was a bit disappointing.I wish we had booked without meals as the food was a letdown.Seafood restaurant was recommended to us but the fish tasted old and wasn’t fresh.Breakfast had very few choices and wasn’t great either.After spending over two weeks in Sri Lanka,we knew what good local food should taste like and sadly this wasn’t it.Room service was also a bit off some items were missing compared to what was listed on the menu.One highlight was Sandeep our room attendant who did a fantastic job.If you do stay here,I’d suggest booking a room only.View and atmosphere are stunning probably the best in Galle apart from those near the fort.
title: Stunning Location but Disappointing Experience

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
The approach to the hotel is rather a let down, being down a fairly grungy side road. First impressions count and the check-in was just about okay. The view from reception across to Galle Fort is fantastic, but that really was the high point of our stay.

They then showed us to our room. The sunbed cushions on the patio were completely saturated and there were no sunbed towels in the room. 2 small bottles of complimentary water - just enough to make a pot of tea. They did replace the cushions, provided some sunbed towels and give us extra water, but it really shouldn’t be down to us to point out 2 basic issues with a room - where was the management oversight?

We stayed 3 nights and didn’t get a proper evening turn down service once. First night nothing, second night he caught us in the room so gave us some towels and water, third night they didn’t get as far as the bathroom. 

Staff seemed to be relatively disinterested in customer satisfaction- it was noticeable that nobody wore name badges, unlike just about every other hotel we visited in Sri Lanka. Nobody wished us a happy day, staff seemed to avoid eye contact and smiles were generally not visible- again very different to all the other hotels we stayed in.

The food at breakfast was poor - both in quality and in choice. Because of this we didn’t eat any other meals there, as Galle fort has an abundance of good restaurant options.

The last night we were just about to get into bed and water started pouring into the room from a ceiling light fitting. I called reception and they said they would get someone to come and deal with it. After half an hour waiting I called up to see what was happening- the receptionist had no idea, and didn’t seem to care. A basic failure of customer care and focus and a metaphor for the hotel as a whole.
title: Poor food and dire customer care

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
As an experienced guide for foreign guests, I deeply regret bringing my guest here. They had to wait over an hour just to check in and even after check in theirs key cards worked intermittently. Rooms were outdated and poorly maintained, making the high rates completely unjustifiable. Food was bland, perhaps acceptable to foreigners who think it’s authentic, but far from it. Front office team was clueless about our arrival and looked shocked when we checked in. Its simply like a training school!!To top it off, invoice was just a plain A4 sheet with columns, at least ‘paid’ seal and no hotel logo or official branding. 
I have only one question, Who the idiots gave this hotel 5 star ratings here?Even a rural tea shop has better technology than this!
title: Avoid this rural guest house if you want a comfortable, Hassle free stay!

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: I had an incredibly unsettling experience at Le Grand Galle. Someone with a key card tried to enter our room at 12:38 AM. When I reported this to the hotel, they claimed they couldn’t see anyone on their security cameras. However, when I requested a report on the key card access, they could not provide any answers. It was an alarming situation, and the hotel’s response was both inadequate and unhelpful. I would NOT recommend staying here based on the lack of security and accountability. There wasn’t any management on site at the time and then again at 7am. This is unacceptable!
title: Be Careful and double lock your doors!

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We booked two double rooms for a small family gateway and the vacation started out great. We encountered a minor hiccup with the hot water showers in both rooms and we informed the management and we expected the issue to be resolved. Right when we were about to leave, the manager of the hotel came to talk to us regarding our experience and offered her apologies for the problem we encountered. During her apology however, she asked us if we knew how to operate a tap and proceeded to explain the hot/ cold function of a shower. We were deeply offended by her comment and she treated us as if we didn’t know how to operate a shower. While we had a subpar experience at Le Grand, her snarky comments about this ruined the whole experience for us and left us leaving with a sour attitude towards the staff and the hotel. 

Rather than troubling the guests with something so minor, the management should talk to their staff and get the matter sorted. 

Further, the checkout time was 12pm but the lunch buffet starts at 1pm. This left us just sitting in the restaurant for an hour. If we were informed of this sooner, we could have allocated our time efficiently, considering my father was in a rush to return to Colombo for a meeting. 

While the view from the hotel is amazing, I can firmly say that we will not be returning to this hotel ever again. 

The food selection was not the best and it is not very vegetarian friendly. My daughter is a vegetarian and she did not have many selections. 

I first left a 4 star review but with the manager’s attitude and the delay of the lunch buffet, I felt the need to share our experience.
title: Terrible

roomTip: Do not book during festivals . There is a public hound used for carnivals not even 50 yards away .
text:
We booked Super Deluxe rooms and they gave us rooms right next to a public ground which has a Christmas New Year Carnival going on for the last few days . Loud blaring music which starts at 6 pm . Last night it kept blasting g into our ears till 1 am and again today same situation. We could not sleep till late last night and again today a sleepless night . 
Bedsheets dirty and short , poor cleaning and housekeeping . Food is below average . 
They should have informed us that though we are paying for a higher category the rooms will be noisy . Pathetic state of affairs . 
Book with caution .
title: Do not book this hotel

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don't eat at the 'Blue' restaurant.
text:
I’ll begin this review by saying that the hotel itself is beautiful. It’s extremely picturesque and the swimming pool and bar area is a wonderful spot to sink a few pina coladas and watch the sun disappear. The staff are also wonderfully friendly. However, sadly, my experience at Le Grand Galle did not meet my expectations of a hotel of this calibre and cost. There was a significant shortfall in service accompanied with significant cleanliness and food handling safety issues.  

After a two-night stay in November ‘24 I checked out of Le Grand Galle with my partner. Upon check-out, we shared some feedback with the staff regarding our stay - feedback we have subsequently sent in writing to the management team. 

Below are the issues we experienced throughout our stay: 
 ⁃ When we arrived, the hot water was not working in the room. We called a technician to attend. The water only then got hot after running the tap or shower for 8-10 minutes for the duration of our stay. At a luxury hotel hot water should work immediately. 
 ⁃ Power points were not working in the room. We called a technician to attend once again. He was able to get some of the points working, but not all. The USB port (the plug we needed the most) did not work at all during our stay. Again, at a luxury establishment, this should work or be checked before guests check-in.  
 ⁃ There was a leaking pipe underneath the bathroom sink, causing water to spill onto the floor
 ⁃ The back of the toilet and shower doors were filthy. They were covered in dirt and streaks. They looked like they had not been washed in some time. There was also some sort of white product smeared on one. We sent the pictures to the staff at the reception desk upon checkout but no immediate action was taken.   
 ⁃ Food. Wow. Just awful. We ate dinner at the ‘Blue’ seafood restaurant on our first evening. The appetisers we ordered were average at best. One of the mains ordered (Mahi Mahi) was served so overcooked it was almost like rubber. It also was served very differently to the menu description. The menu said it came with “ginger and cardamon sauce and noodles.” It was served with ‘Tomato Pronto’, pasta with garlic and oil. We asked the staff at the time what was in the dish because it was different to what we expected. They explained but no remedy to the inedible food or the change in dish was offered by staff or the head chef. 
 ⁃ At breakfast on the first morning, we spotted a staff member coughing quite violently into his hands and then immediately touching the buffet foods and serving utensils. A very clear lack of health and safety considerations.
 ⁃ The treadmills in the gymnasium did not work. Again, why these aren’t working in a hotel of this kind, was alarming. 

My partner and I shared the above as we departed, but received no remedy from staff members at the time, which again, given the price point of the hotel, we were disappointed with. 

We have subsequently contacted the hotel and fed back appropriately. However, after offering us an arbitrary $100 USD discount on our stay and, when we indicated this did not feel appropriate, has now gone silent and refused to respond to our correspondence. 

We stayed in some wonderful hotels while in Sri Lanka, but the sour taste left in our mouths by Le Grand Galle means we feel obligated to make sure no one else receives such a poor experience. It’s not a cheap hotel and when paying a premium price, I expect a premium experience. 

I’ve included some pictures for reference.
title: Enormously disappointing. Save your money.

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Very old facilities that need immediate renovation. We arrived late at night and as we walked in the room we could smell and feel the humidity. The AC takes hours to drop the temperature and you can imagine what that means in the humidity and heat of Sri Lanka and right in front of the sea. 

It’s not a god value for money and don’t be impressed by the photos.
title: Old and outdated

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
In our 4 night stay in a delux room, we enjoyed the beauty of surrounding nature and hotel very much. The architecture and design is spectacular and matches the views properly.
However, we had a pretty wierd experience in a hotel we never expected: NO! We simply asked for a to-go pack at the breakfast as we were leaving early for a safari tour, and the we recieved a flimsy small paper box. We asked for a second one( as it torn apart just in the restaurant) and the lady simply said NO and left our table.We believe that No scenery could change the impact of such attitude.
Breakfast buffet was simple and small comparing to other hotels in Sri lanka.Coffee was awful, tea was old, no pure fruit juice but some salty or sour mixtures not appropriate for a kid or even many grownups.  Also we had a dinner at the restuarant including a milanese schnitzel(emphasized to be without any spices as we ordered it for our child) and a green salad. The menu said the salad would contain avocado which was not. The chicken was seeved with a mashed potatos and a dressing that tasted just like other food in here: spicy. Our kid did eat a piece, and unfortunately it was just average and I did not like it either. Conclusion: no food here satisfies.
 Morover, We bought some fruit for our 4 year old kid the other night, and when we asked for a knife, there was just another NO! The reception guy informed us that we can ask the restuarant to peel it off for us, which they did, but the habit of rejecting requests seems to be a habit .
There are some nice staff in the hotel but many others seem disinterested in their job or they are not willing to help. The reception guys were helpful, the cleanliness is perfect, and the swimming pool is a true pleasure,But it is one of my least favorite places I have ever stayed in.
title: Very beautiful hotel with poor services

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Hotel décevant . Accueil froid et sans service ( il fallut demander un verre d'eau )
Parties communes sans aucun charme . Mauvaise cuisine .Personnel peu aimable . La vue sur le fort ne compense pas tout cela . De plus hotel cher pour ces prestations.
title: Déception!

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel cancelled on us a few days before our stay, which was very difficult given we were already in Sri Lanka. 

To make matters worse, they never even let me know. Booking.com had told me of the cancellation and when I called up the hotel to ask why they eventually told me it was due to a failed card payment. Which wouldn’t make sense as I had used the same card for my other 7 hotels whilst in Sri Lanka. I also checked with my bank and they had no failed payment attempts which makes me think the hotel is lying. When I asked to rebook the room apparently had already sold out with a few hours of cancellation - which I think suggests a double booking! 

I am sure hotel is lovely but unfortunately I’d strongly recommend booking at the many other very nice hotels in galle as they are too unreliable and caused me a lot of stress on my holiday.
title: Booking cancelled a few days before with no explanation - avoid

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel is based at an excellent location, offering stunning views of the Galle fort. The front office team efficiently checked us in, handling our room with ease. The overall ambiance of the hotel is impressive. 

However, a notable drawback of this otherwise beautiful property is the quality of its restaurant service and food. 
- We ordered food at the pool bar which took over 45 mins to arrive, and the quality of the food was average
- Restaurant staff doesn't seem to process any information, just nods their heads for anything
- Worst breakfast buffet I've been to in a while, mainly consisted of action tables (for eggs, waffles/pancakes) and these were made to order. When we placed an order, we were told it would be send to the table. It never came. When we went and inquired we were told "we are a busy". Even my coffee took more than 20 mins to arrive. The entire buffet service was very unorganised, with the staff running around like headless chicken.

Despite its iconic location, the hotel would benefit significantly from improved staff training in both the restaurant department.
title: Worst breakfast experience

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest

Greetings from Taj Bentota Resort & Spa

At the onset I would like to thank you for being a valued patron.

As a team, we always endeavor to leave our guests with fond memories when there are shortfalls. We shall do our best to address your concerns .

Warm regards,

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
We checked into Taj Bentota yesterday and were initially asked to wait as the room wasn’t ready — which we did patiently. About 30 minutes later, we were informed that the room was ready, though we were cautioned the floors had just been cleaned and would dry in five minutes. Since it was lunchtime, we decided to head to the restaurant first and returned to the room about 20 minutes later.

Within minutes of entering, my wife slipped in the bathroom due to a pool of water left on the floor, which had clearly not been dried properly. She sustained a painful sprain and a deep cut on her arm, requiring medical attention. The injury disrupted our plans for the remainder of our stay.

What made matters worse was the hotel’s lack of urgency or compassion. When she called guest services to report the incident, the executive was dismissive and abruptly ended the call. We had to escalate the matter ourselves, eventually speaking with the General Manager, Mr. Sibi Matthew. Instead of acknowledging the seriousness of the lapse, he attempted to offer inducements — which felt inappropriate — rather than expressing genuine concern or accountability.

We’ve always associated the Taj brand with high standards of care and hospitality, having stayed with them for over 25 years. Unfortunately, our experience at Taj Bentota fell well short. The poor housekeeping, lack of supervision, and unprofessional handling of a safety incident have cost us two out of three days of what should have been a relaxing holiday.

I would urge future guests to exercise serious caution. We expected better — especially from a brand like Taj.
title: Serious Safety Incident and Disappointing Staff Response at Taj Bentota

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest

Greetings from Taj Bentota Resort & Spa

At the onset I would like to thank you for being a valued patron.

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
We checked into the Taj Bentota today. A loyal Taj customer and a shareholder I was expecting a pleasant experience, as I usually have experienced.

As the room was not ready, we waited for over 45 minutes after which we were told that the room was ready but the bathroom was wet and would dry up in 5 minutes.

However since our toddler was hungry, we did not head to the room instead it to the restaurant. After a quick light meal that took about 20 minutes, we headed back to the room and my wife visited the toilet.

Instead of experiencing a dry floor, they was stagnant water on which my wife slipped and had a long cut on her arm. 

Guest services was dismissive about about this, no regret, and rather the lady abruptly disconnected the call.

We were offered a visit to the doctor and a first aid kit, however, the first aid kit did not have a disinfectant which is necessary for cleaning up such a wound or a cut.

After a while, the general manager, Siby Matthew came to meet us, wanting us to calm down, offering to make up for the horrendous experience. We were enticed with better service room, upgrades, blah blah blah.

It smacked of insincerity and a lack of ownership. This was absolutely criminally negligent to let a guest check in when the room is not in a position to accept visitors and to top it all the attitude of guest services to bang the phone and not having a well stocked first aid kit. This is nothing but criminally negligent behavior that the management of IHCL has to take notice of.

As a loyal Taj customer for over 25 years and Ash shareholder was stood by you through the troughs of Covid, you have already broken my trust and faith.

I would definitely not recommend this property to anyone even my worst enemy.
title: Absolutely inhuman and insensitive staff - DO NOT STAY HERE!

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
First Day at the Hotel (Out of a Total of 15 Days)
Upon arrival, we were able to check in early at 12 PM instead of the standard 3 PM, which was a pleasant surprise.

Rooms and Facilities
The room is very nice and recently renovated. It’s located on the ground floor, which is fine—this is what we paid for, including a garden view. Unfortunately, there's no direct access from the terrace to the garden or beach, which is a pity. The hotel itself looks good, though parts of the garden seem a bit neglected.

Beach and Pool
There’s a nice, clean beach in front of the hotel. However, there are no hotel sunbeds on the beach—only in the garden, and even there, not enough. The same goes for the pool area, where sun umbrellas are limited.

Dining – All Inclusive? Not Really.
We paid extra for the all-inclusive option, which was significantly more expensive than half or full board. Despite checking in at 12 PM, we didn’t receive our wristbands until 3 PM—which is quite unusual. Typically, it's the other way around.

Meals are only available buffet-style in the main restaurant for breakfast and lunch. It’s a shame, as the à la carte menu looks quite appealing. Dinner is possible at two other à la carte restaurants, but without options like king prawns or lobster, which is disappointing.

Surprisingly, there’s only one bar in the hotel, located at the reception. There’s no actual pool bar—only a waiter who brings drinks from the restaurant. After waiting 1.5 hours for a menu (and asking three times), we received it, but no one ever came back to take our order. I genuinely don’t understand how this system works. What the hotel calls a “pool bar” simply doesn’t exist.

The Shack, another venue, is only open for dinner, so it doesn’t offer any daytime seating either. During the day, there are no snacks available under the all-inclusive package. We normally skip lunch and prefer to grab a light snack later on, but don’t expect that here.

The drink selection is also extremely limited. Despite a huge number of cocktails listed on the menu—both alcoholic and non-alcoholic—only four non-alcoholic cocktails are included in the all-inclusive plan. Really? At a 5-star hotel? No milkshakes, no smoothies... This is worse than a €300-per-week hotel in Egypt. Why not just set a price limit per drink within the all-inclusive package? The current system makes no sense.

Final Thoughts
The hotel is in a stunning location with breathtaking surroundings. However, the all-inclusive experience is comparable to a 3-star hotel at best. The number of places where you can actually use the all-inclusive benefits is practically zero.

We came here to relax after a demanding work season and chose this hotel carefully, but unfortunately, it’s far below our expectations. Next time, we’ll definitely return to Anantara or Heritance.
title: All inclusive? NOP! Save your money and go to Heritance or Anantara.

After visiting many destinations our last destination was Taj Bentota. We thought we would relax three days by a five star beach resort and paid 5 star prices only to be disappointed. Unfortunately, this turned out to be a terrible hotel after some great hotels in Kandy, Negombo & Yala. The reviews were very misleading for the Taj. The hotel is old and musty. The rooms are basic and so are the bathrooms, reminded me of motels in the US. The hotel sits on a lovely spot with a great beach. The cleanliness and maintenance are terrible. Rooms are basic. If you visit this hotel as a three star, you will be happy but if you think you are going to a 5 star hotel please avoid this hotel completely. 
Of the hotels it had the worst service, worst cleanliness, worst food and worst rooms. It needs a complete overhaul to qualify as a luxury hotel. They pretty much have a monopoly as there are very few decent hotels in Bentota which is why they are full and continue to provide subpar facilities. I would avoid this area completely and may be think of going to Galle for the beach

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
As a loyal Taj customer, I had high expectations when booking this property. However, my stay was far from what I’ve come to expect from the Taj brand. For families with kids, this property severely underdelivers. Unlike smaller Taj properties in India, there’s no dedicated kids’ playroom or activities. I specifically chose Taj over Cinnamon (which boasts an excellent kids’ room and family-friendly facilities), and I regret that decision deeply.

---

Stay Review
After completing my stay, my disappointment only deepened. To fellow travelers, especially Indians familiar with the warm hospitality and meticulous service of Taj India properties: do not expect the same standard here.

The service quality was subpar at best. The staff lacked courtesy and attention to detail. An instance that stands out is an unpleasant encounter with in-room dining staff, who slammed the door upon leaving, all because I requested plates and cutlery. Such behavior is unacceptable and left a bitter impression.

Food and Beverage Experience
The F&B service was frustratingly slow and disorganized. A poolside pizza order took over 35 minutes, a delay that tarnished what should’ve been a relaxed experience. Despite explicitly asking for two glasses of milk in the morning, only one was delivered. As a parent, I was particularly dissatisfied with the khichdi prepared for my children – it was bland, completely unsalted, and lacked any effort to adjust to preferences, with the justification that kids eat it without salt.

---

Facilities and Maintenance
The property’s condition also leaves much to be desired. The washroom design is outdated and impractical, requiring guests to stand in a tiny bathtub to take a shower – far below the standards for a luxury stay. Lobby furniture is visibly worn out, with torn upholstery and a dated look that doesn't reflect the premium price tag of INR 25,000 per night.
title: A Disappointing Experience with Taj Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
We booked this hotel through Trailfinders as wanted somewhere nice at the end of the tour to relax. They have big fanfare when you arrive but then there was a complication with our booking and we had to wait over an hour for our rooms,  the reception staff were very formal and didn’t really explain what was happening. The rooms were very dated with flaky paintwork, dirt under the bed, sticky handles and a cracked sink in the bathroom. The staff moved us to some more recently ‘renovated’ rooms which were much better, although we still found the bathroom sink a bit dirty and cupboard handles in particular were sticky with greasy marks. The cleaner did wipe them but they were still bad and we used a tissue to open them. To be fair there just wasn’t enough cleaning staff and often our rooms weren’t cleaned till teatime because there was only two people doing them all.

Then on the second day, our room was flooded after it rained in the night. Again the reception staff were a bit abrupt and we waited a long time sitting around before someone came to help us. At this point I did contact TF. However, the manager did come at this point and apologised and moved us (again) to an upgraded room. 

At this point the rooms were fine with lovely views of the sea but the whole experience wasn’t pleasant and it unsettled the kids which is the only reason I didn’t move hotels altogether. Individual staff members were really friendly and helpful, particularly in the restaurant but we just didn’t find the standard of food and hygiene as high as other hotels we’d been to on same star rating. For example the canopy over the restaurant was flaking and mouldy. Again I think staffing was an issue as in the bar we waited a long time for food/drinks and were told that there was only two guys covering the whole hotel. It’s a very large hotel and in general it felt it lacked adequate staffing and investment.
title: Disappointing, very dated and under staffed.

placeInfo/address: Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you're sensitive to insects or reptiles, this resort may not suit you. Rooms are very open to nature
text:
I booked one night at 98 Acres Resort & Spa to celebrate my wife’s birthday, expecting a peaceful, premium experience. I paid over $400 in total (USD), including $327 for the room and 28,000 LKR for a special anniversary setup. Sadly, the stay was a major disappointment.

The first room had insects on the bed and a large gecko inside the wall. When I reported this, instead of relocating us promptly, two staff members showed up with a cloth and gecko spray. I insisted on changing rooms and was finally moved—but the second room also had a large gecko clearly visible as soon as we walked in. All of this happened after midnight, completely ruining our celebration.

The staff offered a $100 refund, which I accepted because I was exhausted and had no choice. However, for a hotel of this category and price, this is simply unacceptable.

The views are beautiful, yes. But if you're expecting real comfort, hygiene, and professional service, I recommend choosing another resort. 98 Acres is not worth the premium price, especially if you're planning something special.
title: Disappointing and stressful experience – far from luxury

placeInfo/address: Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
text:
98 Acres Resort is located in an idyllic setting amongst the lush mountainous region of Ella.  The view from our villa, and especially from reception, is spectacular.

When we checked into the hotel, there was a lovely Hindu welcome ceremony.

The villa itself was quite comfortable but I would not say that it was luxurious.  Even though 98 Acres Resort is set in a fairly remote region, our villa had no problem with hot water or the shower’s water pressure.  Breakfast was good with ample offerings.

However, despite all of the above, our stay at 98 Acres resort was ruined by the pushy, hard-sell, we were confronted with almost immediately upon check-in.  This pushy service actually began at check-in when they immediately requested to know whether my family of four as well as the other family of four we were travelling with wanted to book a Sri Lankan dinner for US$ 40 per person.  I had politely said we had not made up our mind yet and thought that was the end of it.

As our room was not yet ready, my family decided to have some lunch at the restaurant.  The other family who we were travelling with only opted to have drinks and sat separate and apart from us.  Immediately upon sitting down for lunch, one of the wait staff asked us whether we planned to have the Sri Lankan dinner at the restaurant that evening.  Again, I politely said that we did not know yet, and in any case, needed to discuss our dinner plans with our friends.  Again, I thought this would be the end of it.  However, during our lunch, I was asked 8 additional times whether my family intended to have the Sri Lanka dinner at the restaurant that evening.  Each time, I repeated that I needed to discuss such with my friends but they kept asking me the same question over and over again and again.  So much so that it ruined our lunch.

While we were enduring this continuous hard sell, our friends endured the same harassment while they were having drinks.  Our friends were asked at least four, and maybe five times, whether they intended to have the Sri Lankan dinner at the restaurant that evening.  In the end, we opted to go into Ella for dinner and had a lovely meal at Chill Cafe.

I figured that would be the end of the story.  However, the next morning at breakfast, the same story repeated itself and several of the wait staff badgered me repeatedly continously asking me whether my family planned to have the Sri Lankan dinner at the restaurant that evening.

The final nail in the coffin occurred at checkout.  The only charge that I had to settle was for a bottle of water that I had at breakfast the day before (the hotel costs had already been paid in full via booking.com).  I therefore assumed that it would be a very quick checkout.  However, they told me that a hand towel was missing from the room and this Kafkaesque episode went on for nearly ten minutes.  So much so, that it left a terrible taste in my mouth.  My friends were confronted by the same situation.

For a hotel that holds itself out to be a five-star property, the hotel completely lacked customer service.

There are plenty of other properties
In Ella and I would strongly recommend to go elsewhere!
title: Their hard sell ruined my stay

While we understand with the location,  geckos are normal but we had 5, we called house keeping and he manged to remove 3, we were awoken at 4:45 by a loud noise coming from the mini bar fridge. We ended having a restless night. 
The location is amazing with the views and nature, but I would not consider it for future stays or recommend it, in Elle I'm sure you could find better options especially considering the price....
title: Underwhelming

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Tracey,

Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback. I'm truly sorry to hear that your stay did not meet your expectations and that you encountered so many issues during your visit.

I sincerely apologize for the discomfort and inconvenience you experienced, from the lack of air conditioning and noise disturbances to the situation in the restaurant. Your experience is certainly not what we strive to provide our guests, and I deeply regret that we fell short in so many areas.

As an eco-friendly resort located in an area with generally comfortable weather, we have not installed air conditioning in our rooms. However, due to global warming, we recognize that the daytime temperatures can be warmer than expected. We are seriously considering installing air conditioning in all our rooms to enhance our guests' comfort.

We are also sorry to hear that you were disturbed by the music from the Ravana Pool Club, which is located on the other side of the mountain which is operating only during the daytime. 
We will definitely look into ways to reduce the noise in our rooms to ensure a more peaceful and relaxing stay.

Please know that your comments have been taken seriously, and we will be addressing each of these concerns with the appropriate teams to ensure improvements are made.

If there is anything further you would like to discuss, please do not hesitate to contact me directly at fom@resort98acres.com. I appreciate your feedback and hope that we can regain your trust in the future.

Best regards,  

Sachitha Amarasinghe
Front Office Manager
placeInfo/address: Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
roomTip: No airc-onditioning means you will sweat all night! Bugs everywhere, and VERY, VERY noisey!
text:
Seriously, don't waste your money. There are so many reasons, I will need to use dot points!
- there is no air conditioning and no fly-screens, only a fan. It gets HOT in Ella, so we were grossly uncomfortable the entire stay (it is in the hills, so bugs everywhere)
- the rooms are NOISEY! There is a HORRENDOUS club within a few minutes walk of the property, and you can hear the thud-thud of music all day and into the night. It is truly awful. When we arrived (after many emails requesting a quiet room), we were placed in a downstairs room with a group in the room above us. The rooms have timber floors so the scraping of furniture and walking was incessant. There were also builders directly under our balcony, using a circular saw, so all the dust came up in to our room. After MUCH discussion, we were finally allowed to move into a different area of the property. While you couldn't hear the horrible music from the club, it still wasn't near to being peaceful and relaxing. 
- the tv is in a small little area off to the side. The fan does not reach there and the sofa is very hard. A gecko lived in the ceiling, so we got pooped on twice! You cannot see the TV from the bed. 
- there is a very busy road going right through the property. There are people and tuk-tuks travelling along it at all hours.
- the majority of the rooms are all on top of each other - there are 4 rooms to a double storey building with wooden floors, so the noise is awful.
- but, one of the main reasons we would never step foot in this place again is the owner and his son and daughter-in-law. We went for dinner in the restaurant and the owner and family were also dining there. They waltzed in with their young daughter - maybe 4 years old, and two nanny's. While the owner, son and daughter-in-law sat down to eat, the nanny's and little girl were left without food or drink in the lounge area. The parents quite literally had their backs to her! The little girl created havoc in the restaurant and was being chased everywhere by the nanny - it was after 8pm, so the poor little girl should have been in bed. The parents ignored her, and every time she tried to go near them, they turned her around and called the nanny to come and get her! The entire dining room was disgusted! The mother was too busy trying to be gorgeous, and the father was on the phone half the time. 
- The owner obviously went for style (although there wasn't much) over substance, because the entire place was extremely impractical and uncomfortable. They obviously don't care about the experience of their guests, only the money they bring in.....thus building a loud, tacky club right next door!
title: NOT relaxing, NOT luxury, don't waste your money!
