ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to review us on TripAdvisor.

We have carefully noted your comments and sincerely apologize for any
shortcomings that led to us not exceeding your expectations.

At our resort, we continually strive to provide the best service and
facilities to our guests. Currently, we are undergoing construction to
upgrade the resort and create a better environment for our guests.
However, we have implemented measures to conduct construction
activities only from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM to minimize any disturbance to
our guests.

We are also scheduled to temporarily close the hotel to complete all
pending constructions. Additionally, we are planning to create a buggy
car pathway to the restaurant and other areas to assist guests with
walking difficulties.

Moreover, we have recently encountered challenges with the roadway
leading to our Premium Deluxe rooms, Spa, and Executive Suite rooms.
This roadway was commonly used by the public to reach the small Adam's
Peak as an alternative pathway to the actual one. Due to the ease of
access and free parking available at our main car park near the main
road, all tourist vehicles visiting the small Adam's Peak were
utilizing our facilities. Despite the high tourist arrival during this
season, we did not object to their use of our roadway. However, to
address this issue and ensure the safety of our in-house clients, as
well as to provide swift transportation service between our upper and
lower area rooms, we have already constructed a private roadway.

Regarding dining options, we offer a buffet for breakfast and
personalized service for lunch and dinner from a set menu. Our set
menu includes a comprehensive selection of choices, and we also offer
an à la carte menu.

We must respectfully deny your comment about our staff asking for tips
for services. This claim has been refuted by past guest comments on
the same platform over the last ten years.

We understand that you have raised certain concerns based on
assumptions that may not accurately reflect the reality of our
operations.

Nevertheless, we would like to extend a warm invitation for you to
visit us again. We are committed to ensuring a better experience for
you during your next stay.

Best regards,
Sachitha A
placeInfo/address: Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
text:
Do not book this hotel if you have mobility issues.  Do not book this hotel if you want peace and quiet.  

Do not book this hotel until you are certain they have fixed the roads and paths and have completed their noisy expansion project.  However, whether they will then have a large enough restaurant or pool will remain to be seen.   Currently you have to use what is effectively a public roadway with no lighting to get between many rooms and all the rest of the hotel facilities.  

We had such high hopes of this hotel.  We had friends who had stayed here previously and had said it was the best place they stayed during their Sri Lanka tour.

If the hotel is going to stay open while the property is a building site, they need to give discounts  AND warn guests.  It's greedy of the owners and makes for a very unpleasant stay for guests to have to dodge tuktuks and speeding motorbikes to go up and down a steep slope to reach the dining room, the pool, the reception area and anything else.  When you complain, all you get is a shrug.

The place is very noisy all day long.  Not just owing to the construction work.  Just over the brow of a low hill is the Ravanna Pool Club, a honeypot it seems for the large numbers of younger visitors to Ella who are willing to pay a day fee to use the pool area which has loud, booming disco music you can here from the decks of the rooms.  To enjoy the views or relax on your deck, you have to endure the vibrations.    Also, the property is far from private.  The awful, rutted road that runs through it is busy day and night because it's the access to those hiking Little Adams Peak and all those heading to and from the noisy pool area.  Just for clarity, do note that hotel guests do have the use of a separate small pool - but that involves a long walk and steps from many rooms.

There is no way to access the dining room, the pool area and their shared toilet facilities without using big, uneven stone steps.  Nor most rooms.  The buggies that offer lifts only take you along paths or roads.  If it rains, expect to get wet as you cannot get from door do door.

As this is a small hotel, meals are served to your table, there is no buffet at dinner, and just a few items at breakfast.  Allow plenty of time for your meals.  Owing to the fact that the majority of guests are from overseas, the dinner menu had mostly European choices and the breakfast was very 'western'.  As authentic Sri Lankan food is delicious, this is a shame.    

This is another hotel where tipping staff is the only way to get any service.  Owing to how our plans worked when we checked in, our luggage at the reception area as we had to go for a much delayed appointment, Having arrived to Ella on the always late train from Kandy, after checking in, we had to dash for a late booking elsewhere.  When we returned to reception we were told our luggage had been put in our room which sounded helpful.  However, it did mean we did not tip the porters/buggy drivers.  Despite phoning for buggy service to reach dinner as we did not wish to walk along the busy and unlit public roadway, no buggy arrived so after 25 minutes we had to walk.  When we wanted to check out, nobody came to help with the luggage.  When we walked up to the reception area to ask for help after the phone request failed, we were told we had not tipped the staff so they were not minded to help us.  Shocking!

Clearly many guests do not have our expectation as it seems the magical views enabled them to overlook so much else that was disappointing.
title: Do you homework before you book!

placeInfo/address: Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
text:
This property, like much of Ella, is, unfortunately, becoming a factory of tourism. It's over. Just avoid it at all costs. 

The hotel, after spending three nights in a pool villa, was completely underwhelming. Sure, a beautiful spot. But they seem far more interested in turning it into an Instagram Vegas spot than preserving what was, yes, WAS, once a pristine region.

Expect lots of construction. Expect non-stop parades of people walking through the hotel to walk up to Little Ella. Expect craziness and noise coming from an absurd Day resort next door (owned by the hotel) with giant Instagram swings, silly Zip lines, and a huge Vegas style pool with DJ's and bars. 

Expect nothing in the way of authenticity. This area is ruined and 98 Acres is as much responsible for it than anyone.

While I loved the rest of Sri Lanka and found it authentic and joyful, this area, and as a result the hotel, is truly sad. Avoid the entire area. Go elsewhere. Run. Unless you like Vegas or South Beach style party craziness.
title: A Resort Factory

placeInfo/address: Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
text:
I hate giving negative reviews BUT I do this for travellers who are imminently planning a visit to 98 Acres. It’s currently a building site! If you are planning to go to relax - then my advice is to look for somewhere else. BUT - this hotel has potential to be really lovely! The views are spectacular! The location superb for access to Ella without being in the centre of the hustle and bustle. 
Cement mixers and building noise aside we enjoyed a 3 night stop enjoying what the area had to offer. The accommodation was lovely, a shower with a view!  We enjoyed the food, service was acceptable (if a little slow). Honestly I came away sad… just because it has potential and I hope in time 98 Acres achieve their potential. My advice to the hotel is to close… finish your hotel and then invite people to stay. Don’t trick them into paying for a relaxed stay, because it is not what you are currently offering. Thank you however for refunding us for the nights we didn’t stay as we chose to move on a little sooner than originally intended. I really would go back to 98 Acres one day when the building work is done and climb up Little Adam’s Peak to watch the sun rise!
title: A view with so much Potential!!!

text:
the only thing we liked was the mountain view from our room and the washroom that was big. That's it.

Disliked · Well First is this place is way over priced. way too much. The value for the money i paid i could have stayed extra day in Shangri-La.
Second is there was way to much insects and bugs in the room. when we checked in it was nice and clean. But after the sun went down and got dark there was insects and bugs falling through the room. And there was a lizard that was bigger than the palm size. the bed had the mosquito net, we even put that net down and insects and bugs were still coming through and our toddler was really uncomfy and could not sleep at all and we couldn't either as we had to keep taking the insects out from the blanket and bed. It was really uncomfy stay and sleep.
Third was dinner, we went to dinner about 7.30pm and it was only us and 1 more guest table that was there at that time, so we ordered a hot dog and French fires for the little one so he can eat and we ordered few drinks as well, his food and the drinks took about 25minz to arrive even though there was no one in the restaurant. and once it came we ordered our food. Well lets just say we could have gone ate from out side and came back. it took more than 45minz to arrive and we ordered Beef fried rice and pork fried rice, once they bought it they were like so its 2 chicken fired rice, and we were like no we ordered this. and he is like are you sure? And we were like yes, and then he asked us if we can taste and see if its actually chicken or not. so we did and we said it is chicken but its okay as we not going to stay another 45minz for the food to come. very bad service and the food quality was not good at all also.
Forth was when we were checking out, because i made the booking through booking.com i selected the option to pay at property. and because of that i did the currency exchange and kept in local currency to pay. But the hotel insisted that I pay in USD and not local currency even though I did not have USD, so they took the local currency and exchange to the USD with the rate that hotel was giving and paid it.  This was really bad and this is why we will never stay here again.
title: Over Priced hotel

roomTip: Choose a different hotel for this amount of money (if you have enough money and don’t care go for it)
text: So first of all I want to give credit where credits is due. The view and the rooms are amazing and are well maintained. In addition most of the staff is very friendly and accommodating. However, we gave 1 star given that the value for money is a joke. We have stayed in luxury hotels around the world (comparable ones for a price tag of 200€+) and this one has been by far the worst. First, the pool area is way too small and is rather underwhelming - when you then think about the fact that they newly built the pool club you could say we can go there however even as a hotel guest you would have to pay (which is a joke given 200€+ rate for one night). When asking about this front desk was not really accommodating as I have the feeling that they don’t care. Also, there is no AC which is quite something for this price. Besides, you need to be aware that everyone who wants to go to little adams peak and to the pool club all go THROUGH the hotel (so lot of external people and loud tuk tuks). Personally, I think this is a way too touristy spot and you rather go here for a drink at the bar to enjoy the view instead of spending insanely (for Sri Lankan standards) amount of money. As I said I took the time to write detailed review and hope you find it hopeful by choosing a stay in Ella. Again the rooms and staff is nice but well not worth the money you pay for this (and the 4.6 rating on Google as of now I can only explain by external guests review who just come for the view). Wish you great stay in Ella (please see photo attached how 98 acres is advertised to external customers so you can imagine how busy it might get and that a lot of the privacy nature feeling gets lost)
title: Rooms are amazing but surely the resort is not at all worth the money you pay for (pictures online may be misleading)

placeInfo/address: Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
text:
Location is fantastic but that is where it stops
The hotel is 3* at best
Gave us wrong rooms and bed linen was dirty. Tried to insist on taking you around by golf buggies even when only 40 yards to the room and begging for tips
Sockets couldn't be used with adaptors, chain for blind dangerous in the middle of the door, bed away from the wall so couldn't get to the bed side light, bathroom windows left open, big enough to climb in plus bugs in room. Mossy net for a doublebed no good for King size, small bottle of water, no nice extras with turn down service which was at 18:30 when showering. Shampoo etc in lovely little pot jugs but hard to get any out and impossible to read which was which in the poor lighting Swimming pool was actually 2 dip pools joined together, 2ft and 4ft deep, (we were told shut at 17:30, was actually 18:30), not big enough to casually swim in, oh and was in the shade all day so water cold, not even luke warm
Food was ok in the evening but not as good as a lot of local food we'd had around Sri Lanka
Service at breakfast very poor. Had to ask multimes for a table to be set for 3 and had to go and ask for coffee/tea. Plates were all hot, not great for fruit and yogurt and was told quite rudely that they were the only plates. Juice was actually squash not fresh fruit juice. Put cheese with nuts on the same plate as the rest.
Had to pay for the better pool which was a bar pool which I presume noisy in July and August
Each thing maybe small but overall not up to 4* or 5*
title: Location 5* service, facilities 3*

placeInfo/address: Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
text:
A 4 star, but certainly not a 5 star luxury property. No evidence of a manager greeting guests or supervising staff. The hotels feels more suited to busloads of tourists rather than discerning travelers. Without doubt the views of their tea plantation and the surrounding hills are very nice, but the quality and details of the room left a lot to be desired.
Telephone was not working, the safe was not working, all finishing in the room was so poor, floorboards felt like plastic.
The room was spacious but sparsely and cheaply outfitted.
You have a desk but no desk light and no power outlets. There also are no effective reading lights by the bed, only small bulbs covered by a shade.The safe is old and ever so tiny- couldn't fit a camera.
Shampoo and shower gel are on the opposite side of the room from the shower- there is no shelf near the shower so you have to run back and forth while showering. Bathroom is very bare. And to top it all off - sounds trivial but it isn't - especially for the price you pay here and for the image 98 acres wants to project - the toilet paper is so thin, I don't think it is more than a leaf thick 1 leaf. Come on 98 acres!
What was a real distraction for us and what will definitely not make us come back here is the noise that travels over from the party pool, which the same owning company as 98 acres, built just around the corner from the resort. It's a party pool, where people from anywhere can buy packages to use the pool, the bar and some VIP balcony. This place gets so loud with disco beats and people raving away that it drove us mad. A constant boom boom boom is too much. 98 acres should make their guests aware of this. Some may have no problem with this noise, but others like us came here for the peace and quiet and the landscape. Don't expect much except lots of opportunities to party into the night (for a fee - also for 98 acres guests). This is certainly not an exclusive, quiet resort..... Also, it seems that they keep building new houses - as it is the swimming pool here is very small and with even more rooms coming up, there will be no choice, but to pay for pool packages over at the party pool. Someone sees only money in front of his eyes and forgets that his biggest asset here should be nature not noise!
title: Misleading - not a luxury property

placeInfo/address: Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
text: For Sri Lankans it says Rooms Not Available for several Months. Checked for several months but results is same. This is Discrimination. Why you want to waste our time and energy ? Simply could have said ONLY Foreigners can Book online.
title: Rooms Availability

placeInfo/address: 257 KKS Road, Kokuvil, Jaffna, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Not recommended
text:
Disappointing Stay – Overpriced for What You Get

I stayed at Fox Hotel in one of their Heritage Rooms for 3 nights, and unfortunately, I found the experience to be overpriced and underwhelming. The room, despite being marketed as a premium option, had no windows and was surrounded by four plain concrete walls. While the room was kept clean, the ambiance didn’t reflect the high price tag at all.

We booked the half-board package, but the food was very basic and repetitive. There was little variety in the dinner menu – mostly dosai, kottu roti, and similar local dishes. Prawns were occasionally on the menu but would often run out quickly, even before we arrived for dinner. The meals felt cheap and uninspired.

The staff were very friendly and helpful, which was one of the few highlights of our stay.

Another downside is the location – the hotel is about 20 minutes outside of Jaffna city, and you'll need a taxi every time you want to go in. Surprisingly, they don't offer free pickup from the train station, which I found disappointing given the hotel's pricing and positioning.

Overall, I don’t think this hotel offers good value for money. There are many other options in Jaffna that are better and more reasonably priced. I strongly recommend doing thorough research before booking.
title: Disappointing

ownerResponse/text:
Hi Chanka, 
Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your stay with us. 
We are really sorry that we were unable to fulfill your requirements during this stay, however, as we discussed at the hotel, we are very grateful to know that you will stay with us again on your next visit to Jaffna. We assure you that we have taken measures to ensure that each and every guest will receive personalized service. 
Looking forward to your next visit! 
The Management of Fox Resorts
placeInfo/address: 257 KKS Road, Kokuvil, Jaffna, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: I personally adore the rooms in clusters and not in the main building with front office
text:
We booked 4 rooms for the 8th Jan and 5 rooms for 5th Jan on a family tour (room number 05, 06, 07, 08 and 20)
Rooms are decent size and OK. But had an issue with hot water in each and every room. Have to keep the mixer tap open for 10 / 15 minutes and still water was cold though the mixer tap arm kept extreme end of the warmer side.....

Especially during the dinner on the 8th January, the restaurant was in an utter mess.... Staff was not properly trained to serve a sit-down meal. Simply a three course dinner took two and half hour. 
For the same family main course was served at two different times. Out of four, first three were served at once and the other one was served about 20 minutes later by the time the other three finished.
I noticed that most of staff were so serviceable towards foreigners and local crowd was little left behind.....

NEVER COME BACK TO THIS HOTEL AGAIN........
title: Service is a nightmare

placeInfo/address: 257 KKS Road, Kokuvil, Jaffna, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed at the hotel based on the positive reviews on Trip Advisor. We had a mixed experience, the hotel certainly did not live up to the reviews we had read here. There are some positives, the food is great and the garden area is lovely, the bunker area is also very interesting. We booked a room in the main house but it was dark with extremely noisy AC and mosquitoes (no net over the bed) and so we moved to one of the newer rooms in the gardens when the manager could not fix the AC. The newer rooms are not very old, however they have not aged well and the bathroom particularly is in need of some repair and replacement. With regards to Covid, on day 1 staff were all wearing masks but by day 2 staff rarely were which we thought was odd, particularly as parts of Jaffna were quarantined during our stay.  All in all it was not a bad stay, hotel choices in the area are very limited and this hotel generally was cleaner than a couple of other hotels we looked at whilst we were in the area.
title: Average

ownerResponse/text:

The Management of Fox Resorts
placeInfo/address: 257 KKS Road, Kokuvil, Jaffna, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka

For new year holidays I booked three rooms  for two days,but we stay only one day, rooms are not so clean! Outside areas around the  room more worse, Bathrooms always water leaking problems wash basins drain and Shower cubicle drains always getting stuck!!!

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you very much for your kind comments on the location and my team's dedication to service.

Regarding the added taxes. I appreciate your concern. In Sri Lanka, hotels charge a 10% service charge which is distributed equally to all staff. There is also a value added tax of 18% levied by the government together with a 1% tax from the tourist board. This is how hotels in Sri Lanka in the formal sector operate. No doubt there are some informal establishments that may not comply fully with the law. 

If you had raised this question during your stay, I am sure the team would have explained it, potentially avoiding the need for a two-star review, which reflects poorly on the service team. 

I would be happy to clarify anything further if you would be good enough to inbox me. 

Thank you for visiting Cape Weligama and Sri Lanka.
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Restaurant prices after tax are expensive
text:
Cape Weligama had some fantastic views and good pools. The staff were polite and gave excellent service.
The face price of items on the restaurant menu were just about acceptable for such a hotel. However the 31% added for tax and service charge seems unreasonable and we never found out how much of the 31% was imposed tax (which we had nowhere else) and service charge. 
Access to the beech and sea was not ideal
title: Over 30% uplift on restaurant covering tax and service charge

ownerResponse/text:
I'm sorry that you were disappointed with your stay. The resort was renovated and reopened early December. It's possible that for the first couple of weeks, a freshly painted smell may have lingered - we've not had any similar feedback. 

We've now switched the WhatsApp system to a dedicated service center and response times are quick. My apologies that it wasn't implemented during your stay. 

Cape Weligama has just 39 villas and suites spread over 12 tropical acres. Whilst the local area it’s quite “happening”, the resort itself is more about serenity and a lovely location.

The speed of service in the restaurant was also admittedly slow for the first couple of weeks but that was resolved. 

Regarding the airport transfer, for sure Uber will be cheaper -- a hotel vehicle and the chauffeur for the two-hour journey would generally be more expensive than Uber as the level of service and amenities would be different. Once again, my apologies that we disappointed you.
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
I spent two night at Cape Weligama and sadly I didn’t enjoy my stay there.
I have to say the staff are lovely and very polite and helpful, but that’s the only real positive thing I can say.

The room I had booked had a damp and musky smell and felt incredibly dated. It was right next to the main road and there was loud music pumping so I asked to move rooms which they did. They moved me to a lovely room with a pool and while it was very nice, again there was just a strange smell in it.

While the resort is pretty, there doesn’t seem to be any ambience or atmosphere at all. 

They asked for my number on arrival so they can communicate by WhatsApp, they got my number wrong and when this was corrected, they still didn’t WhatsApp me. One night what I was waiting for a buggy, it didn’t show up and I was waiting for 15 minutes.

WiFi at the resort isn’t great outside of your room. It doesn’t work at the main pool.

The gym is good but again, just an odd smell there.

The service for all meals was incredibly slow, expect to wait at least 25-40 minutes and the food just isn’t worth the price. It’s very expensive and the quality isn’t worth what you get.

As I said, the staff are lovely, but when I come back to Sri Lanka I definitely won’t be staying here again.

They also quoted me $265 for a taxi to the airport when I was leaving and you can literally get one on uber for under $80.
title: Not worth the stay

ownerResponse/text:
Greetings from Resplendent Ceylon!

Please accept our apologies for the delayed response. 

Thank you for your feedback on your stay with us. We truly appreciate your valuable insights and feedback as we are constantly striving to improve our special blend of hospitality. 

We very sorry we could not deliver your experience to the best of our abilities. We are personally looking into each of your constructive comments and they are being actioned for immediate improvement. 

We hope you could forgive us and give us the opportunity to welcome you again in the future and we will ensure you have a flawless stay that we are known to deliver.
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text: We had high expectations since this was our third stop along the Resplendent Ceylon loop around Sri Lanka, after amazing stays at Ceylon Tea Trails and Wild Coast Tented Lodge.  However, this place didn't measure up to those properties for numerous reasons.  Unlike those hotels' incomparably elegant style and thoughtful amenities, this comes off as a generic luxury hotel with large but average-looking rooms (no art on the walls, no stylish touches).  Our room was at the edge of the sprawling property (room 52, avoid) and had a strange and unpleasant smell, which staff tried to cover by spraying with a room deodorising spray, with only fleeting success.  There were several problems with the plumbing, including a toilet that wouldn't flush properly and broken steam shower.  The night of our arrival we waited 15 minutes to be seated at the restaurant, even though they do not take bookings; we also waited over an hour for our food to arrive.  The family pool had no swim toys to offer besides a ripped, half-deflated football.  The moon pool (which we only discovered the last day of our stay) was wonderful, but children are not welcome there.  The location and views are amazing, and these flaws might be forgivable in a mid-priced hotel, but the astronomical price of our stay combined with the hotel's deficiencies in comparison to the other Resplendent Ceylon properties, plus the fact that Welligama itself has a ton of other more convenient options, makes this hotel feel like a bad bargain all around.
title: Astronomical price for average rooms and poor amenities

placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Think twice before you go to Cape Weligama.
text: The most arrogant management is at at Cape Weligama, specially the Sales Director (I think his name is Chaminda) and his colleague.  In simple words hospitality was below Zero. I was on a business trip under the invitation of one of my valuable clint to cover an evening hosting. Out of no where this Sales director appears in the middle of the meals and insisted that he wanted some coverage done for his personal usage, which is not part of my briefing form my client. In few mints time again in the middle of me having my dinner, he pulled me out and wanted me to show him the coverage I did so far, and started lecturing me about my duty  by asking me to come to a corner. That director and his colleague didn't know any one who is at his property is guest and to be polite if he wants something done, instead they was so arrogant, annoying had guts to disturbed the gusts dinner in the middle of it too . Hence I decided to check out from Cape Weligama immediately and and which I did at 11/30 PM mid night. Horrible experience, and hence I will not recommend this property to any one or either I will step in to this ever again.
title: Arrogant Management!!

ownerResponse/text:
I am really sorry that you experienced shortcomings. Let me try and explain even at this stage - we regret we did not have an opportunity to engage with you during your stay as you wanted privacy.

Pool lights ordered in August from the United States have still not been delivered due to the global supply chain issues. We have now been assured of delivery next week. Your pool has five mosaic tiles fallen off - due to high occupancy we have been unable to empty the pool to repair. Pool cleaning is done daily yes but in between leaves etc can fall in. There was an unprecedented nationwide power outage when you were with us and the generator does take about 30 seconds to switch over. Your welcome cocktail was ordered from the Cape Club to be sent to your room, however you arrived at the Ocean Terrace and ordered a fresh set of cocktails which was billed and later reversed. The gym was being deep cleaned by housekeeping when we turn the air-conditioning off. Sunbeds we had allocated 2 on your terrace and more by the pool. Note paper and pens had been removed as part of our Covid safety measures and will be re-introduced shortly.

Irrespective of the above, I am very disappointed that we could not provide you with a memorable stay at Cape Weligama. I invite you to contact me directly @malikjfernando if you might give us another chance - I will personally oversee all arrangements. warm wishes, Malik
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
We booked the Villa with semi-private pool. Our pool has no lights (we cannot use the pool in the evening - it was too dangerous because of the sharp corners of the steps). Some ceramic tiles were missed inside the pool (some of them were lying at the bottom of the pool). Pool was dirty with leafs, small twigs, dead insects (the cleaning was made once).
One day we accidentally saw an employee who was throwing chlorine into the pool without any warning us that the pool should not be used after that. He did not do any pH and chlorine test before and after putting the chemicals in the pool! 
It's hard to imagine what kind of eye and skin irritation we could get by using the pool immediately after.
Just 3 sun beds for 3 villa (one was broken, the rest two were occupied by other guests). Very dirty four-poster beach bed near our pool (when we asked to clean the mattress, the hotel staff just removed the bed).
Some lights on terrace were broken. Two lamps in the villa were broken.
Horrible yellow spots on toilet seat!
Electricity shutdowns were almost every day (and there is no flashlight in the room).
Nice cabinet in the villa but no note papers and a pen.
No umbrella in the villa.
One soap and 2 bathrobes for 3 guests.
Our welcome drinks were included in our dinner bill on the first evening (it was removed after our request).
Cleaning was in different time every day.
No towels in the main pool (twice).
Gym was not ready on the morning (a/c was not turned on, was very hot inside).

The hotel has poor value for money!
title: Expensive hotel with unequal service

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Arun,

Thank you for your feedback. I'm glad that you found our staff attentive and service oriented and the views spectacular. The management are usually equally helpful but having reviewed the incident logs during your stay, I can understand how their patience may have worn thin.

On arrival you complained that your room was not immediately next to the other room that your family had booked - as we were completely sold out, we could not do any better and you acknowledged that you were aware that the rooms would not be adjacent.

The “wholly inadequate” junior suite sized at 130m2 or 1400ft2, that you claim looked out onto a wall, looks out onto a large terrace and garden and beyond that the pool and the ocean. We understood that you wrote the room off as you wanted to move to the room next to the rest of your family but it was occupied.

You insisted on a discount and threatened to leave if we could not provide one. We were not in a position to offer you your discount and reluctantly accepted you leaving although we would not be able to resell the rooms at such short notice. We were glad that you chose to stay.

We accept full responsibility for the power failure the next day due to unscheduled maintenance by the electricity board at a time when our backup generator was undergoing a major repair. This was entirely unexpected and clearly very inconvenient for which I apologise profusely.

The golf buggies did require about 5 mins notice as we were running a full house.

The main restaurant Ocean Terrace has a wide menu and our chefs are keen to prepare special dishes off the menu. We also have the Surf Bar which is popular for lunch and Tableau; the chef’s table, at dinner. Three options for just 39 villas and suites have not been previously found inadequate.

I wouldn't normally go to such detail in responding but since your stated intention was to alert fellow travellers, I thought I should address all your points so as not to mislead.

Warm wishes, Malik
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Please INSIST on an Ocean view Room
text:
At the outset, let me just say that I travel a great deal and have had the good fortune of staying in some wonderful properties around the world.
I do not generally do reviews but I felt my fellow travelers need to know about our experience at Cape Weligama. 

My family and I spent 4 truly miserable days at this Over-rated and Over-priced Relais & Chateaux property in December 2019.

For starters, the rooms were wholly inadequate. One of them actually looked out onto a Wall (instead of the Blue Ocean!). It was really so bad that we wanted to move and so advised the "management". Unfortunately, being the period between Christmas and New Year, nothing was available, so we were just stuck there.
Among the many problems we faced:
1. The Electricity went off for a whole afternoon. This, by itself, was not all that bad but then then the water systems gave up. The toilets were unusable etc etc. Most Unpleasant.
Nor was anyone able to suggest alternative arrangements or even give us an idea of when normalcy would be restored.
2. The wait for golf carts was endless. It appears they have just one or, may be two, for what is a very large property. Given the rates they charge and the value they deliver, surely they can afford a couple more and help their guests utilize their time effectively.
3, There is only one restaurant on the property, and no decent eating out options close by. By the end of our stay each of us knew the menu by heart (as an aside, the views from the restaurant are spectacular).
4. The staff was most attentive and service-oriented, as is true of Sri Lankans generally. However, there was a certain degree of arrogance in the management, which really was quite unnecessary and totally out of place in the Service industry.
So, fellow travelers, Go if you Must but please keep your Expectations at Sea Level.
Arun
title: An Awful Experience

ownerResponse/text: We did expect a negative review as you threatened. placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
This is a resort hotel set in a beautiful location with spacious rooms and good facilities, much like many others throughout SE Asia. However it’s price tag and Relais and Chateaux association set an expectation that the hotel management simply could not deliver on. Poor communication between head office and the resort lead to us being allocated the wrong rooms, rooms not being available when we arrived, rooms being set-up wrongly, no pre-arranged activities etc. Whilst in resort rubbish was burnt next to the pool one morning and food and service were mediocre. All of these points are petty inconveniences that are completely excusable if the hotel did not have an overinflated opinion of what value for money it was truly delivering. 

To be fair the management did try and make amends but it was all a bit clumsy and again not up to its billing. I’m sure this will be met with a typically defensive response but I think the time would be better spent on executing what they are selling.
title: Oversold and underdelivered

ownerResponse/text: Hi Roger, I'm afraid I cannot agree with your comments on the restaurants. We were not in a position to offer the discounts you repeatedly asked for, thus despite our best efforts to please you, I suppose this review was inevitable.
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
The Resort is lovely and the rooms are also Fantastic. we stayed for 4 days And can honestly state that the restaurant has major problems .
 Staff can not speak English well enough and on every service got the meals mixed up, the menu is very limited and of a choice of 6 main dishes 2 where unavailable.
The grill is a complete rip off my wife's lamb was terrible on complaining the chefs ran !!the last night we were served up cold food and on complaining waited 45 mins finally got up as I was fed up waiting and then they had the cheek to charge us for the meal on our final bill !!!
title: Rooms Lovely Restaurant A Disaster !!

ownerResponse/text: My apologies that we did not meet your expectations. The washrooms are adjacent to the restaurant. Cape Weligama is indeed on a hilly clifftop location with paved, lit paths. This does mean one has to walk down to the beach. Guests generally use east beach where our activity & dive centre is located. West beach is accessed via a cliff staircase. The village road is behind a section of the resort; I'm sorry that you found it a nuisance. Most of our guests travel to discover foreign cultures so the fact that our staff are Sri Lankan is usually welcomed. We would also appreciate it if you would contact us about your unpaid bills.
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: do not go down in the flood area
text: The only 5 star hotel where there are no toilets in either the restaurant or bar buildings .the site is very hilly with very poor paths and at night the lighting is dangerous the management have know but for the last two years the owner does not want to spend any more on this . The beach is unavilable due to access problems. The rooms built in the flood area also back on to tin huts and main road expect barking dogs ,traffic noise and loud music at a lll times. Whilst the staff speak english this does not mean they understand our language or our culture . I would not recommed this place

ownerResponse/text: My apologies for your sub-par experience at the restaurant. We will look into all the matters you raise. Being a resort, our vehicles are usually pre-booked for transfers and are not always on standby like a city hotel. Thanks for your feedback.
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text: My partner and I decided to go for dinner at Cape Weligama for his birthday. The location was beautiful with the infinity pool and the layout. Some staff were welcoming however we were highly dissapointed by the end of it. First of all it is a member of relais et chateaux which obviously meant to us that they would serve good wine, but that was not the case. The first red wine tasted like it was left open for ages. Then the service was so poor we had to wait for ages to get the food. The duck was nice but the srilankan kotthu was awful. Me being a local, felt like I could get better from the street restaurants for 1/3 of the price. Then the mocktail ordered for almost 1000 rupees was awful too with no taste. When we had finished our dinner it took them ages to clean our table. When we ordered a liqiour at the end of our meal it took another century to arrive. Then we asked for the bill and it again took forever until we kept reminding them to bring it.Finally the bill arrived and we saw that they had charged 12500 rupees for a white wine bottle that we never ordered. The overall bill came to around 24000 rupees and I left the place still hungry as I could not eat what i was served. Once the bill was rectified they took our credit card and had to go all the way to the reception (which is not close by)as the card machine at the restaurant was broken. Once paid we went to the reception to ask for a vehicle to bring us back to our other hotel and they had no cars available. They were kind enough to offer their staff vehicle, however for the standard that's given to this place, we would have expected them to have their own cars for guest service. Knowing that this place has a high number of oversees guests you would think that some of the staff would speak a good level of English. However, we were surprised to hear them struggle to speak and understand us. As stunning as the location is, more attention should be dedicated to the restaurant management and services. There was one attentive staff member who was the only one who kept coming to refill our water glasses!
title: Overrated

ownerResponse/text: I’m sorry that you were disappointed. You had booked on Half Board basis which does not include alcoholic beverages. The registration form you signed acknowledges this. Despite this when you complained on check out, we refunded the $135 charge. Hence your reference to a lack of acknowledgement is odd, even though the hotel was not at fault. The buggy was available but the part of the resort you wanted to go to was having the buggy path repaired so the butler escorted you on foot. Despite the 1-star rating, I hope you enjoyed your stay.
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text: During checking out, I was presented with an erroneous bill charging for drinks that were explicitly included in my hotel package. The internal hotel transportation system was unsatisfactory. Despite reserving a hotel buggy early in the day (9am) I was informed that during my reserved time (3pm) I was unable to benefit from said service. ownerResponse/text: So sorry about the delay in reservations responding to your email, the info has now been sent and we look forward to arrange a memorable wedding day for you in the most stunning location in Sri Lanka!
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
I emailed this hotel to enquire about getting married there this November. Someone responded very quickly to say yes it is possible and management would get back to me. 4 days later and still heard nothing I emailed again, to be told the same again. It's been nearly 2 weeks now and I have still heard nothing. 
I think this is shocking service! Very disappointed

ownerResponse/text: I'm sorry that we didn't meet your expectations although I'm glad to note you were impressed with the property. The Master Rooms are around the Cove pool which is at beach level whereas the Residences are at the upper part of the resort. The Master Rooms are generously sized at 130m2 and 150m2 and similarly well appointed. The main swimming pools are manned until 1830 when it goes dark so yes at 1900 you would be on your own! We closed the dinner at 1130 after checking for last orders. Your other service observations have already been reviewed and will be addressed, so that hopefully we will make your shortlist in the near future. Thanks for your feedback.
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
Our stay at Cape Weligama was to be the highlight of our family vacation in Sri Lanka however we were sadly disappointed. The hotel is very nice, our stay did not meet with our expectations based on their website, reviews, and price paid in comparison with other hotels we stayed at. 
Our first misgiving was when we saw our "master rooms", sure
they were huge and lovely but with a location like this and a website full of the most majestic ocean views (and $500 per room/night!) we had taken for granted that all of the 39 rooms in the 12 acre resort designed by Asia's most celebrated designer would have ocean views whilst "capturing the spirit of Cape Weligama"! Well, none of ours did and I didn't complain as I rechecked their website, nowhere does it say that these rooms are ocean view. (I've seen now that we are not alone and many 
reviewers who have stayed in the master rooms have had the same misgiving and disappointment. We also stayed at The Villa Bentota where one of our rooms was the executive suite and their website clearly mentioned that this room "does not offer sea or garden views".)
We did not let this dampen our spirit and my son, who is a Foodie from NewYork and my daughter, Swiss hospitality Grad, booked the Seafood Special buffet for that evening. I believe they had seen photos on Instagram and were excited, knowing that as a Relais & Chateaux, a high standard could be expected. Again we were disappointed, service was poor to start with and pretty soon non existent! Did not even ask us if we would like desserts, we got up to order these and decided to have these sent to the room because the atmosphere was now dead and the mosquitos were biting! Yes, it was local new year festival,
but at any top rate hotel in the world, any day you're open to guests, you're working! The Seafood itself was of good quality and plenty but somehow not served elegantly. Also in a rush to clear the cold buffet which we had less than half hour to pursue, could have easily kept on for a further 15 minutes,
but didn't bother. We felt like second class customers although
we had paid full price! 

The butler tried hard to please but I didn't quite understand their concept. Our butler told us he was in charge of 8 rooms, he's personally bringing in room service orders, including breakfast, driving the golf cart sometimes, doing some concierge work, running errands, and when you call for something at reception, they don't help you, they will your butler call you back. All in all, we did not feel that the service we received was in any way special or dedicated. I requested jugs of iced tea as I do not have canned aerated soft drinks or alcohol which are free in the minibar, only to see that this was on my bill at check out!
Our rooms were next to the main pool, decided to go swim the half moon pool and take some photos. Great views lovely photos, we got some excellent memoir shots. The pool however was just being closed, I don't remember the time but it was not yet dark at all! Neither does this moon pool appear to be 60m in length! We went to the cove pool to swim, I was the only one doing laps in the "integrated 20m lap" pool. You need to travel through the whole pool to get to this part! And by now there is no staff attending the pool here as it's 7pm! With 14 pools in the resort perhaps a dedicated pool for swimmers who would like to do laps that is convenient from the master rooms, perhaps with breathtaking view might make up for rooms being no ocean view? 
Checkout was also handled smoothly, however again we felt not the type of send off you would expect from a Relais & Chateaux. No Manager was present, it was like a checkout at any standard five star hotel.
Well our six person family, very traveled and stayed in many "superior" resorts on six continents, we're not overly impressed in any way by this hotel or its management. We are very, very impressed by the property so their is a lot of room for improvement if they so wish to do so. Another reviewer mentioned Trisara as an optimum choice, I'd like to add Phulay Bay, a Ritz Carlton reserve where we've stayed.
title: Not up to Expectations!

ownerResponse/text: My sincere apologies for the issues you faced. Back in Jan when you stayed with us, we did face various snags, having been opened just two months. No excuse I know, but we have come a long way since then. The transfer does sound like a shambles and likely was outsourced as some of our vehicles hadn't arrived. I will check on this and contact you again. If you do return to Sri Lanka I'd like to invite you to Cape Weligama for a meal and personally show you how we have resolved the issues you faced. My apologies once more.
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
I'm not sure if I went into this trip with high expectations based on all the amazing reviews, but I'm either a picky traveler or this hotel is just truly not up to par. My husband stayed here in January for 6 nights as part of our baby moon and we were both disappointed by the hotel. The food is absolutely horrible- it's boring, it's bland, it's repetitive and it's not tasty AT ALL. I would say my biggest issue was the horrible food- fruit was delicious though. 

The room is nice, but it's missing something aesthetically. Our phone had issues and didn't work for most of our stay, so it was annoying when we wanted to reach our butler or we had issues in the villa. The car transfer was just SO sad. It's about 500 usd and you aren't even greeted with cold towels and a bottle of water, forget that the car was a piece of junk. We have been to Sri Lanka in the past and stayed at both Aman properties and the car has a sandwich for the long drive, a cold bottle of water, and cold towels. It was just so much more professional and you truly get what you're paying for, as opposed to Cape Weligama where the private transfer was a joke. 

The adult only pool had a child swimming in it, lots of staff cleaning and fixing all over, the villas don't really have an 'ocean view', we had a wifi issues, the beach isn't easy to access, so don't go here if you want a beach hotel. Lots of hiccups along the way and compared to our trip where we stayed in Aman, Cape Weligama doesn't even come close to that experience or the standards of the hotel. I definitely wouldn't return.
title: Completely letdown and disappointed by this hotel

ownerResponse/text: My apologies for the phone and AC being off at check in..will have our checklists rechecked! The hot water temperature is controlled to be at a practical level and not scalding. I do hope you managed to experience the rest of the resort and partake of the meals, drinks and activities included in the rate.
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Closer to the water and not up near the reception area
text:
Fancy "6 star" joint half an hour south of Galle.  Given the expense it wasn't really up to scratch, note that: the phones weren’t working when we checked in, the room AC hadn’t been turned on, the gym AC was also off when we were shown it, there was a child in the "child-free" moon-pool and you could fill the bath with only the hot tap and still jump straight in without it being too hot. The top rooms are advertised as 2 story 2 bedroom apartments, but there are really 2 separate villas with separate external entries (you cant go from the downstairs to the upstairs private pool unless you go outside and enter a separate stairwell).  On the good side, you can jump into your private pool from the upstairs bedroom through the window in your bedroom!  The shower is also a steam room and the pool has perfect temperature.

There is a great view of the cape and a lovely surf break that continues for what looks like about a km (probably from an outer reef which then tumbles slowly into the beach).
title: Not up to scratch

ownerResponse/text:
Ayubowan Nik,

Thank you for sharing your experience at Prego. We regret that your evening fell short of expectations and apologise for the frustrations you encountered.

Please be assured that all dishes at Prego are prepared fresh to order, and we take great pride in maintaining authentic Italian standards. Your comments on service, ambience, and billing have been noted, and we are already working with the team to improve coordination and guest communication.

We value your feedback and hope you will allow us the opportunity to provide the true Prego experience on a future visit.

Hotel Manager
Amari Colombo
placeInfo/address: 254 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a deeply disappointing experience at Prego and unfortunately cannot recommend this restaurant.

The red wine was served ice cold. We had to wait 20 minutes for it to reach a drinkable temperature. As a result, we only ordered one glass — otherwise, they could have easily sold two. A basic understanding of wine service was clearly missing.
The live saxophone player was unbearably loud, more fitting for a nightclub than a restaurant. We asked the staff to lower the volume so we could have a conversation, but they completely ignored the request.
The pizza was obviously frozen and pre-made. When we raised our concerns, the chef came out and demonstrated how he "normally" makes pizza — what he prepared then was clearly fresh, and completely different from what we had been served. Yet they refused to admit that our original pizzas were not freshly made.
The service was inattentive and disorganized, with absolutely no regard for customer satisfaction. The staff lacked coordination, and the management seemed absent or ineffective.
The venue itself is in poor condition, not what you'd expect from a place positioning itself as a fine dining Italian restaurant.
To make things worse, we were charged for three pizzas, despite being told the first two would be taken off the bill. It took them 15 minutes and involvement from six different staff members to correct the invoice.
An awful evening from start to finish. Mismanaged, overpriced, and unprofessional. Highly not recommended.
title: What a crazy disappointment

After wanting  to speak to the manager they said they will get us a cot now it's 10:50pm still waiting for a cot. Food ordered at the bar on the roof top gets an hour and half  to come to the table. I visited this hotel on a tour and was excited since it was a new hotel so expected to be impressed but instead I was bitterly disappointed. Firstly we were excited to get into the pool after a long day on the road only to find the pool area was tiny and there were only 4 sun beds. The pool water far too hot and not refreshing at all. Upon looking at the drinks menu my friends wanted a couple of cocktails. There were 30 on the menu but were told they could choose from only 3 and they had only 8 bottle of liquor behind the bar! 

We tried to get the movies to work and were unsuccessful. Then we decided to get room service but the menu would not load on the TV and there was no hard copy. Asked for one to be brought to the room but it wa only the beverage menu. By the time it arrived it was 10.30 and they didn’t tell us room service stopped at 10! 
Next day our rooms were made up but no towels left. Also no conditioner. Was later told the shampoo is also a conditioner which is not suitable for a lot of people and there was nothing to explain this on the labeling. 

Breakfast was very average. Fruit was terrible quality and was not refreshed so what there was ran out. 

Next day tried to get the movie channels again and the tv would not connect the the internet. 
All in all a disappointing experience. They have a lot of work to do to bring this new hotel up to scratch,
title: Disappointing new hotel

roomTip: Avoid this hotel
text:
Before writing this review, please note I very rarely ever write a 1 star review. However this hotel surely was the worse hotel we stayed in Sri Lanka and probably in most of the countries we have stayed in. Most of the other positive reviews make me weary reading from people who have not written other reviews elsewhere. 

Me and my Mum stayed in this resort recently for 2 nights, as part of a 2 week tour of Sri Lanka. We used it as a base when in Sigiriya and to walk up the rock / fortress. We arrived at the hotel - no proper welcome like we had at all the other hotels. Which is fine for us. Rooms very tired and definitely in need of a refurbishment. Breakfast and dinner variety was decent. 

On the day of the walk, my elderly Mother (63) who is very polite and never gets angry or upset, kindly asked the restaurant to fill our insulated water bottle with water. We both made a New Year’s resolution to stop using plastic bottles even when away. Bearing in mind the hotel provide water bottles in the room! The restaurant manager refused and kept saying no, in a very rude angry manner. Told her to buy water instead as they won’t fill it up. She was really shocked, he then said he will only fill one bottle not both… this is the normal jug water not no fancy Evian water! If locals and customers in the restaurant can drink it - did not see the issue. Surely it’s cheaper than us using the bottles in the room! My mum went back to the lobby in tears. 

I came down, saw her upset and was so shocked to hear what happened, never in my life have we been refused free water especially in the hotel. Other hotels in Sri Lanka would go out their way even put in ice to stay cold!! The hotel we are currently in walk around offering water. I spoke to reception who kindly filled the other bottle but no apology nothing. No one cared or was bothered. 

Ruined our mood and excitement for visiting such an amazing place. Even when we checked out no one asked anything, apologised, nothing. Very confusing when Sri Lankans seem like amazing smiling hard working people but not in this hotel! 

The next morning at breakfast, there is a guy who makes masala tea, for some strange reason he even shouted at me ‘just wait’ when I kindly asked for masala tea. Then carried on serving the European couple next to our table who asked for tea after we did. If the staff work on tips then tell us we will happily tip if it means getting respect and service. Really poor service. 

Again upset us on the day of check out. Would definitely not recommend this hotel or stay again. The hotel have no respect. You see the staff rarely smile or say hello like other hotels in Sri Lanka. Some staff were nice but never have we experienced such poor service. Our tour guide agreed not acceptable as he was there.

Pool was nice and had such an amazing view. They should however ban people blaring loud music from their speaker. A group of locals had the music so loud playing their own music staff said nothing. The couple next to us left the pool angry and said they wouldn’t recommend this hotel.
title: The worst hotel we stayed in Sri Lanka

roomTip: Find somewhere else to stay in Sigiriya.
text: My two adult daughters and I stayed here for two nights as a base to climb the rock and explore the area.  On our first night, after a long drive from Jaffna, we had no hot water and no towels.  Our first request for towels resulted in us being given pool towels.  A second request was required before we got proper towels. Bathroom was not clean.  The room safe didn't work, though this was rectified.  Someone came to confirm we had no hot water, but did nothing about it.  The room was not made up as requested, though this was subsequently fixed.  We did the best we could and after complaints to senior management our whole block had hot water the second night.  Staff looked overworked.  Buffet was ordinary.  The wifi worked.  Management were given an opportunity to make a better impression on us, but didn't even try.  Great location with Sigirya rock towering behind the pool but we would not stay here again.  Perhaps the majority of tourists put up with what we experienced but I do not regard  the lack of the basics as a good sign.  The tour company we were with are not sending any more people here unless they lift their game.  There are a number of other hotels in the area.
title: Poor and unable to see it

text: After travelling for 12 hours we arrived at the hotel at 9 PM and all we wanted was to take a hot shower and go to bed as we had to get up early and carry on with our travel. However, we found there was no hot water . I contacted the reception who sent a member of staff. He stood there with the shower and basin running for more than five minutes but no use. Instead of moving us to another room, he then went and got a handy man . The handy man could not make the water hot either. I went to talk to the reception lady and she said the hotel was full and could not move us and offered us free drinks which I refused. I asked to see the manager who finally came and said he could move us! there were other free rooms. By then it was 10:30 and my partner was asleep in the room so I refused!. On top of that the hotel looks extremely tired and run down. We have paid far less for much better hotels in our trip. I would not recommend this hotel.

Hotel Sigiriya
placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don't book here.
text:
An OK location, but an absolutely appalling experience. Would not recommend anyone to stay here.

The air con in the room while working, kept spitting out water onto the floor.

The bicycles we rented were poorly maintained. Holes in the seat, broken gear shifter and the chain fell off while riding. I ended up with grease all over me fixing it and they still decided to charge me for the bike and the laundry.

The laundry we had done, they had decided to classify my t-shirts as full shirts even though they are clearly t-shirts.

The woman at the front desk gave the impression she had no interest in being here at all (this was across two days!), most of the staff were rude and abrupt.

The manager at the front desk had several charges on our bill that they could not produce receipts for. And rather than being polite and helpful they were rude and arrogant towards us. When asked for feedback at checkout we mentioned about the bike to which she shrugged her shoulders and said " normal". 

The only upside is the view (which can only be seen from one specific spot) and the buffet which was decent.

Don't bother booking this place, not worth the money or experience
title: Waste of money and time. An absolute disappointing place to stay. Poor customer service.

placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Although the location is excellent, it leaves something to be desired in several aspects:
- 1 - cleaning: the upholstery in the lobby was dirty and dingy; the floor is always dirty with a dusty appearance; the towels in the bathroom of the room as soon as we checked in were dirty; while we were waiting for our lunch to arrive, a rat passed through the restaurant and got under the buffet table, which prevented us from having dinner and breakfast at the hotel; The restaurant's cutlery and glasses were not of an acceptable standard of cleanliness, always with some dirt or marks.
- 2 - bathroom had a floor that always looked greasy.
- 3 - the minibar didn't work
- 4 - the reception staff seemed very confused and unprofessional on check in. They ended up being nice later, but the first impression was the one that lasted.

This hotel is definitely not recommended for guests looking for cleanliness and quality. It may have a good location, but it is far from being a 4/5 star!
title: Bad Experience - not recommended!

placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Não fique nesse hotel!
text: O hotel possui uma vista maravilhosa da piscina com a Lion's Rock, mas é tudo! Cheguei as 13:00h no hotel e me disseram que o quarto ficaria pronto as 14:00, então fui almoçar. Retornei as 14:30 e o quarto não estava pronto. Fui ao Spa (péssimo, relato depois a experiência) e retornei as 15:30 e me disseram na recepção que "todos estavam em uma reunião" e que eu tinha que aguardar. Informei que eu estava desde as 13:00hrs aguardando meu quarto e que não iria mais aguardar, só depois disso alguém apareceu e  fui ao meu quarto. Na reserva pedi um quarto calmo e tranquilo: me deram um quarto ao lado do banheiro público do hotel, na frente do bar e da entrada de carros para a recepção. Fui reclamar e fui atendida pela Thilini que disse que eu tinha obtido um upgrade de quarto, se esse era o upgrade imagino o que seria o quarto que eu reservei!  Porém, fui conferir no site do hotel e aquele era o quarto que eu tinha reservado, portanto, ela mentiu! No jantar, nenhum garçom se aproximou de mim perguntando se eu queria beber alguma coisa ou se precisava de algo, ninguém para explicar como o buffet, incluído na diária, funcionava. No final do jantar,  uma moça se aproximou de mim e perguntou como tinha sido o jantar e eu respondi que tinha sido péssimo e expliquei a situação. Logo depois o responsável pelo restaurante (assim se apresentou) veio perguntar o que havia acontecido, expliquei novamente e disse que os garçons só se ocuparam das mesas com grupos e não das demais e ele pediu desculpas, mas ninguém veio a mesa depois disso. O Spa é todo aberto, com muitos mosquitos e barulho, além do mais estavam fazendo uma reforma no spa e quando estava na massagem relaxante  barulho de obra, de conversa , impossível relaxar! Tive que reclamar 2x para o barulho parar. Se o spa estava em obras, não deveriam oferecer os serviços, que aliás são bem caros para os padrões  do Sri Lanka. Como se não bastasse, era um homem que faria a massagem e em nenhum momento fui avisada disso!  Na manhã seguinte pedi um tuk tuk na recepção e me disseram que era para eu ir até a rua e tentar pegar um que passasse. Um hotel desse padrão não pode chamar um tuk tuk para um hóspede??? Em outro momento, a Thilini veio me perguntar se tudo estava bem e eu repeti a péssima experiência no Spa, no jantar e o péssimo quarto e informei que na manhã seguinte iria para outro hotel. Ela me propôs ficar mais dias no hotel, insistindo muito nisso, e que me trocaria de quarto. Eu disse que em hipótese alguma permaneceria no hotel, pois todo o serviço era péssimo. Essa moça parece ser alguém que tem a responsabilidade de verificar junto aos hóspedes se tudo está indo bem, se  estão precisando de algo, porém se mostrou extremamente despreparada para resolver os problemas que eu relatei, pois nenhuma solução foi dada, só me dizia " fique mais dias e te darei um quarto melhor", ou seja, não entendeu que o problema não era só o quarto. Em nenhum momento pediu desculpas pelo ocorrido e ainda se mostrou antipática e descontente com minhas reclamações. Parece que é preparada apenas para ouvir elogios. Péssima profissional!  Em resumo: não recomendo esse hotel em hipótese alguma! Esse foi o pior hotel que fiquei nos meus 22 dias de viagem pelo Sri Lanka! Se quiser apreciar a paisagem da piscina, vá lá só para tomar um drink.  Outras opções muito melhores na região. Saí de lá e passei mais 5 dias no Cinnamom Habarana: o paraíso!!! Fujam do Hotel Sigiriya!
title: O meu pior hotel do Sri Lanka

Hotel Sigiriya
placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed here 5 nights. Can't believe some of the reviews. Thought this would be my favourite hotel during a 30 day trip in Sri Lanka. Instead it was the worst. The photos are deceptive and don't represent how unhygienic this property is. Have never stayed at a dirtier hotel. What makes it worse is they know. One can clearly see how filthy it is. Not the staff's fault but the upper management of the hotel. Who is there to train staff and inspect their work.  

The shelf above the AC and across from the ceiling fan had not been cleaned in years. Dust was everywhere as well as what looked like mice droppings. All which blows into the air when the AC and ceiling fan are on. Having it go into the lungs as I breathe. After witnessing my room and then the restaurant, I chose not to eat lunch or dinner here. Imagining what the kitchen must look like if they don't care what the guest can see for themselves elsewhere. Afraid of food poisoning. Wouldn't even use the spa thinking the massage tables must be unclean. A hotel's top priority should be to ensure the guests' health. Something every guest should be concerned about if they stay here.

There was a gentleman at the front desk who was a bit dishonest and tried to provide a lower category room from what was booked. When asked about this was told, "maybe tomorrow because we're all sold out..." When I asked further, all of a sudden two room options miraculously became available. Also asked about getting change to pay a Tuk Tuk driver for a small bill. "No change possible." Ask further, and all of a sudden change appears. This type of dishonesty caused distrust and found it unprofessional. Caused distrust of the hotel. Checking in is the first impression a guest has of a hotel and it was a bit of a failure. It took about 45 minutes to settle the room issue. Once I got in, the lack of cleanliness was a horror and housekeeping came in to do a "deep" clean. Which took an hour. A quality hotel would have at the very least sent a note from the GM or a token of apology afterwards. Nothing at all. Not even, "here's one peanut for all the trouble we caused you."

You walk into breakfast and there's no one to greet you and take you to your table. You then have to find a clean table where there are almost none. With no silverware. plates, or napkins. No espresso, americano, or cappuccino- the machine is in the bar! Why is it in the bar when those are mostly breakfast beverages? When you see how dirty everything is, you lose your appetite and wish breakfast wasn't included.

This hotel has a lot of potential but sadly no one cares. Certainly management does not. LOLC Holdings PLC should be ashamed to have this property in its portfolio. My deepest regret is choosing this hotel when I had so many others available. Feel like I was lied to and fooled by what they show on their Instagram and Website. What a huge mistake. 

Positive things are the women working at the reception who were very kind when asked for help. As well as a very good restaurant nearby called Saffron Place Lake View Restaurant. Was my favourite of all. Ate there a few times.
title: What You See Isn't What You Get

text: Unfortunately, I had a frustrating experience with the reservation.  Arriving at the hotel I was told the hotel was fully booked despite having a reservation.  The reason given was that I had booked that day through booking.com.   That fact was true, however, I did receive an email stating that my check-in time was approved by the hotel.  Either a careless mistake was made at the hotel or booking.com is communicating something beyond their right to do so.  I also believe the hotel could have communicated the issue well before my arrival which was more than 3 hours after the reservation.  The staff was apologetic and offered help in finding another hotel.  Hopefully management will review procedures with online bookings to prevent other guests from being disappointed.

text: I made a reservation on Booking.com and I was asked to pay the full amount and I did that. On arrival the hotel staff informed me that this was a mistake and this offer is not valid. It was a mistake from booking.com. We have to charge an additional for our stay. I asked okay, what's the issue? the front office staff said that the original amount was 33,000.00 LKR and we got Only 17,000 something amount but for this we have to deduct 25% from 33,0000 and then you have to pay the balance which was 7000 something. and then it will come around 24,000 LKR then i showed him the deducted amount from my account which was exactly 24,317.64 LKR so i have paid already the same amount. then they said no we got only 17,000.00 so you have to pay us 24,750.00 - 17000 = 7750.00 LKR additional. then again i asked why should i pay you extra as i have already paid 24,317.00 LKR. please check with booking.com. after like 5 minutes of wasting our time he came again with a another sub story "NO Sir, the original amount is 33,000 LKR you paid us through booking.com 24,200.00 LKR price is 33,000 LKR you have to pay us 8,800.00 LKR additional. otherwise you we cannot accept you as a guest we have to leave the hotel and ask for a refund knowing that it was an offer from booking.com which is NON-Refundable. we were totally disappointed and with this lies and stories they have wasted more than 1 hour of without doing our check-in procedures. finally, after a so much of lies we paid 8,800.00 LKR additionally at the hotel and stayed.
title: Overcharged for my stay at Hotel Sigiriya - Booking Reference Number 17679111926505332785

We were not happy with the way the management treated us, especially when we asked for special food because of our diet. They didn't help us, and they didn't offer us any other choices. During our stay at the hotel, our driver was unable to obtain his complimentary dinner as he was charged for the meal. We inquired about the situation with the manager, but the conversation became contentious when she argued that it was our choice to not eat. Eventually, another waiter informed us that we could reheat food from the previous day. It was an unfortunate experience that does not reflect the beautiful and stunning hotel in Sri Lanka.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sir,
 We write with reference to your comment made with regards to your recent stay at Hotel Sigiriya. 
As you know when the above complain was made to us we immediately contacted the local authorities. During the investigation you were requested to provide any sort of document to prove the amount of money you brought to Sri Lanka to spend your vacation which you were unable to provide.
The complain was made stating that you lost your money whilst you were at the ayurvedic Treatment. Furthermore, you did confirm that the therapist was with you full time except the time you went to take the shower. The CCTV footage was checked along with you by the Police  and there was no evidence to prove that the money was stolen in the resort during your stay.
This was your second night in Sri Lanka and you came after staying overnight in another resort in Negombo. And the during your stay at Sigiriya you went on certain excursions too. And you confirmed the money was carried by you all the time during these trips. Therefore we cannot exactly say that you lost your money in the resort. However, this is an on going investigation by the Local Authorities and we are unable to come to a conclusion. 

On a different note our resort has been in the business for more than 40 Years and we are a well reputed company and this sort of incidents have not occurred in the past. And Safety and well being of the guest is 100% rest assured.

Regards,

placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
This was our last stop on an amazing holiday to Sri Lanka. 
Unfortunately the posed pictures do not reflect what the rooms were like in reality. 
All our 3 rooms on the 2nd floor facing the ocean were dirty and had mould on the floor and robes in the cupboards. 
Also the rooms were not made in a consistent standard. 
Our room for example (317) had no robes, laundry bag, coffee for plunger and phone directory on the phone. Also there were no welcome biscuits in our room that the other 2 rooms had. 
An old invoice from the previous guest was also left on the mini bar fridge. 
The buffet food was excellent on the last night which was great. The staff also very friendly. 
I would not recommend this hotel and am sure there are better in the area.
title: Not clean and poor upkeep

placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
Situated on a pristine stretch of the beach in Negombo, the location and design of this hotel are lovely. We had a ground  floor room overlooking a well-kept lawn and the beach. The room was spacious, well furnished, and comfortable. Unfortunately, it was let down by cleanliness and poor maintenance such as silicon badly applied around the bath, a big patch of mould in the shower, and a dreadful paint job.
Reception staff were helpful and friendly . There were so many staff in the dining area they were literally tripping over each other and the guests. Often, they stood in groups talking and were inattentive and rude. The food quality was patchy. Especially considering the exorbitant cost. If you stay, be prepared to eat outside the hotel at some of the great cafes and restaurants nearby.
title: Beautiful location, sadly let down by staff and management.

placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Hundreds o of crows in the garden and at the pool. Beach sellers do you disturb you non-stop while you try to enjoy your sunbed.
text: Very disappointing experience. The hotel runs after its own 5-star standards. Although we asked for a quiet room and away from smoking guests, after a 45 minute wait we were allocated a dreadful room which on the one hand was directly above the children's pool and the hotel's smoking area and from the other side we could hear the traffic noise from the adjacent road and the noisy guests who all had to walk past our room towards the lift. After 2 days we were allocated a new room (upgrade), but there we were disturbed at 1am by 10 employees from the kitchen who made themselves comfortable on the benches in front of the room and ate dinner there. To top it all off, Room Service called us at 10.00 am the next morning because the cleaning boy decided that he didn't want to wait any longer to clean the room, despite the ‘Do-not-Disturb sign on the door’. At the pool and in the complex you are also constantly besieged by beach vendors and crows. The management seems to care little about all this, the main thing is that the rooms are overpriced. The staff are rather helpless and think that all this is more or less normal.
title: Rather desastrous, under managed very nice traditional hotel.

placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
We reserved a Deluxe room at Jetwing Blue for 10 days but ended up staying only 5 days, primarily because we had already paid in advance.

Unfortunately, the room did not meet the standards we expected from a five-star hotel. It was not clean, and there was a dead cockroach in one corner of the room. During our stay, there was a wedding at the hotel, but the setting was disappointing. Apart from the natural beauty, the backdrop included a garbage bin and ropes, which did not create a proper atmosphere for a wedding.

The food was another letdown. Items like roti, dosa, and others were served cold, and they did not have adequate facilities to keep the food warm.

On the positive side, the hotel does have a well-maintained pool, and the staff were friendly and helpful. For instance, they helped us unlock the baggage quickly when we misplaced a key.

Ultimately, we decided to check out early and moved to the Sentido Heritance hotel, which is just one kilometer away. The experience there was vastly superior — 100 times better, in fact — and it was also more affordable.
title: Bad experience at Jetwing Blue Hotel
