placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text: We selected the Jetwing Blue Annex (Hotel Blue Breeze) to provide our clients with a reliable and high-quality experience, but were deeply disappointed. On November 28th, 2024, the very first day of our organized tour, despite prepaying for breakfast, the hotel charged our clients again, putting us in an embarrassing situation and compromising our professionalism. Our clients, confident in us, insisted they didn't owe anything, and the reception failed to verify the information properly. Our clients then called us for explanations, and while we tried to explain to the reception that the breakfast had been paid for, feeling humiliated, our clients paid out of their own pockets. Such an incident has inevitably cast a shadow over the entire tour, compromising the trust we had built with our clients. We expected much more from such a renowned Hotel chain. As a new travel agency, following the advice of a close family member, we always chose, at least for one stop, the Jetwing hotel for our clients, even for the most economical tours, precisely because we believed in the quality of the service offered. For example, in the coming year, we already have two trips planned where our clients will be staying at Jetwing hotels for several days. But, this experience has forced us to reconsider this choice and to consider other options for our future trips
title: Bad start for the tour

placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
Good beach side location with nearby shops. Hotel is along the main beach road in Negombo.

Nice beach views, and pool area. Food was also good. Room was spacious, with clean sheets and pillows.

Poor rating as we expected better for the price.
- Booked an ocean view room, but got one with views blocked by trees.
- got woken up by a loud wedding event right outside the room at 8am on a weekend morning.
- only one tiny unventilated lift near the lobby
- not handicap friendly as still need to ascend/descend stairs along the corridor on the way to the room
- no room slippers provided, especially for visiting the balcony area.
- no toothbrushes provided
- towels were stained and dirty. Checked that laundry was done in house, which means staff were okay with circulating stained towels.
- shower gel containers were too small. Had to keep calling housekeeping to get it refilled.
- shaving/beauty mirror was unhinged
- front desk service was subpar.
title: Good beach side location with nearby shops. Hotel is along the main beach road in Negombo.Nice beach views, and pool area.

ownerResponse/text:
The notion that the hotel is prone to burglaries is absurd and totally unsupported by the facts.

This review relates to an incident in April 2023.  The incident referred to in this review occurred more than 1 year ago.

The guests have already written about this incident in a review.   

Trip Advisor reviews should be about stays within the past 1 year and there should only be 1 review about a stay.

That said, here are the facts.

In the hotel's 9 years of operation, the hotel has had over 10,000 guests.  In all that time and with all those guests, there have been 3 possible thefts.

Guests only reported 1 of those alleged thefts to the police; that was the incident in April, 2023 that the authors of this review are writing about.

The other 2 alleged incident occurred some years before.

In both those other alleged incidents, the guests refused to make a report.

In 1 of those incidents, the hotel consulted with with the travel agency that brought the guests to the hotel.   The travel agency found that there had been a similar incident in the past involving the driver hired by the travel agency who brought the guests to the hotel. 

The other incident involved some property seemingly lost/taken in the same villa where the guests stayed.  The guests in that case has also left their villa unlocked.

Since the incident in April 2023, a number of measures were taken to improve security including the installation of new security systems.  

We can well understand the anger and disappointment caused when a theft/loss occurs.

The guests who stayed in April 2023 said that they consulted with someone who told them that the hotel had been previously burgled.  They accepted this mistruth at face value.  They also apparently accepted the person's account of who was responsible.  They seem not to have considered whether that person may have had an axe to grind.

The Manager and Assistant Manager both worked tirelessly to get the police to do a thorough investigation of the incident.  As a result of their efforts, the incident was investigated by the tourist police, the local police, and the national police based in Colombo.  

That investigation included dusting for fingerprints, taking fingerprints, and seeking to trace the items lost.  

The efforts to trace the lost/taken items yielded swift results.  The national police matched some of the belongings lost/taken with some items found discarded in a field in another district of Sri Lanka.  Those items were returned to the guests.

The guests who last stayed in April 2023 are correct that the theft of their belongings from their villa was likely perpetrated by someone formerly associated with the hotel.  The theft was perpetrated by someone who knew the area, knew how the hotel and security systems were constructed, and who was able to arrange for the the wires of the CCTV on the adjoining property to be cut.   A reorganization of the staff and new security systems minimize the chances of a reoccurrence.

The guests who last stayed at the hotel in April 2023 are not correct, though, that the property is any way prone to burglaries.  There has been 1 confirmed burglary in 9 years of a villa that was unlocked (that was the theft that the guest is writing about).  There have been other possible thefts in those 9 years.  1 of those thefts was debunked with the loss of property occurring off site.

The guests who last stayed at the hotel in April 2023 are similarly not correct about who they blame for the incident.

By reflecting on who told them that there were previous burglaries and who led them to suspect 1  staff member in particular, they may better understand how they have been misled.
placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka

The police were called and they believed it was an inside job, that is to say the staff were involved.  Strangely that is also the opinion of the owner.  It appears as though the Assistant Manager may well have been the organiser of the heist.

text:
I have stayed at Waterland a total of 17 nights over 5 visits.
After our last visit I advised the ownerdirectly that the private pools have badly designed steps, especially for the aged or people unsteady on their feet.

The design of the steps does not allow foreasy access and especially easy exiting from the pool. I suggested that either a small railing be installed or maybe a large pot be placed in a position to make it easier for the aged or those unsteady on their feet.

The attached photo shows that neither of these suggestions have been implemented in the last 12 months.  This maybe because the owner has forgotten, or is just not interested in patrons safety, or it maybe it's because I am now classed as a persona non grata (a person who is no longer favored or welcome).
title: Private pools dangerous for the aged or those unsteady on their feet

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for choosing Waterland and for sharing your experiences.

We're sorry you had a disappointing experience.

Our understanding is that you had a reservation on 13 and 14 July 2023 for a villa for 4 people.  The reservation and the reservation confirmation specifically notes the maximum number of people for that villa.

The reservation policies also note that no parties are allowed and that IDs may be required for all guests.

As you note, you invited outside visitors.  This was in violation for a gathering in violation of the maximum number of guest policies.

Our understanding is that when the staff asked for the IDs of those outside visitors, you refused to provide those IDs.

We further understanding that having a 100% no party policy and a no outside guest policy can be disappointing if you want to host a group of visitors in your villa.  

We fully understand that limiting access can cause disappointment to people wanting to host groups in their villa.  Limiting access to the villas to guests only keeps Waterland secure and security is a top priority for all guests.

Asking for IDs of outside visitors protects our guests.  When Waterland opened 7 years ago, we had a guest who had a visitor.  The guest brought an outside visitor.  The guest refused to give the ID of the guest.  It turned out that the outside visitor was a prostitute and mistreated the guest. We immediately implemented a no visitor policy in the villas to prevent a recurrence of such incidents.

The vast majority of the guests who come to Waterland come because they want a tranquil, quiet environment to relax.  Gatherings of people exceeding the maximum occupancy disturb other guests.  When you stayed, for instance, all the villas were occupied and others reported a disturbance.

Regarding the location, Waterland is indeed in a non-touristic part of Negombo that is a 7 minute drive from the touristic part of Negombo.  The area is bucolic.  Bordered by a river, a canal, and a coconut plantation, the area is gorgeous. It's good of you to not that for those who want to be within walking distance of bars, restaurants, and shops, Waterland is not a good choice. 

Thank you for noting the music.  One of the churches on the other side of the river does indeed play music on some days in the morning.  Churches, mosques, and Buddhist temples are integral facets of Sri Lankan society and they do indeed sometimes play music as part of their religious practices.

Regarding power, we're sorry that you were disturbed by power cuts.  Unfortunately, Sri Lanka struggles enormously to provide consistent 24-hour power.  In part, that is because of insufficient infrastructure.  To deal with this issue and to be environmentally sustainable, Waterland has installed solar panels and solar batteries across the property.  Indeed, the roof space of all our villas is now blanketed by solar panels and we have 4 separate locations with solar batteries. We're sorry that you experienced periods during the when there was a delay in the back-up systems providing power.  That is a rare occurrence, but it does happen.  After your visit, we asked an electrician to come and look into what caused the delay.  He changed some settings and wiring and hopefully that will minimize the chances of long periods without power.

We understand that the experiences you had combined to cause disappointment.  We're sorry about that.

Regarding the breakfast, we keep our menu small in order to ensure that what we serve is fresh, expertly prepared, and of consistently high quality.  The general feedback that we receive from guests is that the meals are outstanding.  We're sorry that you found the selection too limiting.

Your experience underscores that Waterland is not for everyone and that we need to do a better job of communicating to guests that maximum occupancies of villas are strictly enforced and that outside visitors are welcome to come join guests in the restaurant, but are not permitted in the villas.

Again, we're sorry about any disappointment caused by the policies designed to limit access and to keep guests safe.
placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text: Management/staff did not allow to have my family as visitors for a short time during daytime even though I paid for an entire villa with plenty of space. I also suggested they could have lunch and drinks during their stay. Management treated the whole incident very bad with a lack of trust. Big noise/terrible music from church nearby very early in the morning for a long time. No power generator and power cuts many times during the night so the A/C don't work and makes the rooms very hot to sleep in. Poor breakfast with poor set menu. Isolated location.
title: Disappointing

ownerResponse/text:
This review is a duplicate review (refers to the same stay as the review written on 27 March 2023).

We're sorry that the guest had a disappointing experience.

As noted in their review, the guest was disappointed from check-in.

Our understanding is that the guest's disappointment began when they discovered that Waterland was not within walking distance of shops and restaurants.

Our understanding is that the guest was further disappointed during the check-in process.

The guest booked the Elephant Villa/Studio Villa by the river.  That vila is a 2-person villa.  The guest came with 3 people (2 adults and 1 child).  The guest contended that this was an error in the booking system.  This is not an error in the booking system.  The Elephant Villa is designed for 2 people and the maximum occupancy is 2 people.  The maximum occupancy (2 people) is noted on the booking system and is also in the booking confirmation sent to guests.

Waterland has other villas for more people.  We have a villa for up to 4 people and we have a villa for up to 6 people.

Waterland charges different rates based on occupancy.  For 1 person there is a different charge, for 2 people there is a different charge, for 3 people there is a different charge, ...  The extra cost per person covers the extra costs of laundry and food.  An extra person charge is standard practice if a guest shows up with more people than are in their reservation.

The front desk staff carry routinely helps guests with their luggage and there is a luggage trolley in the reception area for this purpose.

Waterland routinely checks the quality of linens and has a schedule for doing so.  We buy the highest quality linens from our main hotel supplier in Sri Lanka and replace the linens if they are frayed or stained.

Sri Lanka is a tropical country and there are indeed many insects.  We can well understand how insects can be off-putting for guests who are not accustomed to the tropics.  Waterland takes many steps to minimize the incursion of insects into the villas.  Those steps include door guards under the doors and screens on all windows that open.

The review is a good reminder that Waterland is not a good choice for those who want to be within walking distance of shops and restaurants and that it is important to pay attention to the maximum occupancy noted in the booking engines and in the booking confirmations.
placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text:
Disappointing experience at Waterland in Negambo, Sri Lanka. I stayed at Elephant Villa for two nights with full board package was far from satisfactory.

Firstly, the booking system seems to be problematic and inconvenient as it asked me to book two villas instead of one for your family ( 2 Adults and a 5 Years Old Child ). Secondly, the front desk staff's behavior at check-in was unprofessional and rude, as they started demanding more money for the child and didn't even bother to assist you with your luggage.

Furthermore, it appears that the hotel's management and staff lack the ability to offer good customer service as they treat guests like a ransom demand without offering any actual value.

The set menu food portions were limited, and the staff demanded money for all additional basic things which are usually offered for free in other hotels.

The hotel's occupancy rate was also low, and the bathing towels, pool towels, and bed sheets were stained and dated, indicating poor management.

To add to my discomfort, the villa door was not working correctly, and the villa was infested with poisonous spiders, bugs, and lizards, which is unacceptable and poses a risk to the safety of guests.

These issues have made my stay uncomfortable and inconvenient, and I have no intention of booking this hotel again or recommending it to other travelers.

I hope that the hotel management takes my feedback seriously and takes necessary measures to improve their services and facilities for the benefit of their guests.
title: Disappointing experience at Waterland in Negambo, Sri Lanka

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for staying at Waterland and for writing so extensively about your experiences and so thoughtfully about your experiences.

We are sorry that you had a disappointing stay.

We're sorry that you were disappointed by the location.  Waterland's setting in a remote and tranquil location away from the built-up touristic part of Negombo is part of its appeal for most travelers.  As you note, for guests who want to be within walking distance of shops and restaurants, Waterland is not a good choice.

We are sorry that you had a disappointing check-in experience.  Waterland has front staff on duty 24 hours to check in guests. The front desk staff send guests a request to send us their check-in time so we can make the necessary arrangements.  Dinner service ends at 8:30pm.  Guests who check-in late miss the opportunity to order dinner and have dinner at Waterland.  

Waterland has a management structure.  There are front desk staff, there is a front desk manager, there is an assistant manager, and there is a manager.  All the management staff are empowered to make decisions.  In case there is an issue, it is escalated to the next person in the chain: front desk manager, assistant manager, and manager.  This well-structured approach to management recognizes that the best decision-makers as they are the closest people to the issues.  We recognize that some guests like only speaking with an owner and that this structured approach to management is disappointing to them.

It seems that after your late arrival, were unhappy with the check-in process, were unhappy with the fact that you would need to pay extra for extra services, were unhappy that issues were handled by members of the management staff and not by the owner, and were unhappy that the hotel was not within walking distance of shops and other restaurants.  We understand how these issues can taint the guest experience.

Thank you for pointing out that lizards, spiders, bugs, and mosquitoes may make the stay uncomfortable for some guests.  All the interior spaces in the villas have glass, mosquito screen, and felt strips under the doors to minimize the incursion of insects into the villas.  That said, Sri Lanka is a tropical climate and these things can be of concern as you noted.

Regarding maintenance, the billiard table is an antique billiard table from a tea estate.  That is its charm.

Regarding maintenance, the pools are serviced twice per day - in the morning and evening - and have pool filter systems that run additionally.  Naturally, during the day and night, leaves fall into the pool.  There is a pool net next to the pool to enable guests to remove stray items and we note in the check-in materials that guests may call for pool service any time.

Regarding portion sizes, we do indeed charge for extra portions.  We're sorry that you were disappointed by that.  We have not heard any concerns about portion sizes in the past.  For those who fast during Ramadan, we can well understand that normal portion sizes may seem insufficient.

Waterland is the highest rated 5-star hotel in Negombo and has been the highest rated 5-star in Negombo for the past 5 years.  Waterland earns these accolades and the loyalty of so many repeat guests and so many travel agencies because of its beautiful tranquil setting, its convenient location 17 kilometers from the airport, the spaciousness of its villas, the luxury of having a private plunge pool, its strong management structures, the excellence of its meals, its cleanliness, its mission to provide guests a magical guest experience, and the dedication and skill of its staff.  We are sorry that you had a disappointing check-in experience at Waterland and a disappointing stay.
placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text:
I stayed in Waterland for two nights in Elephant Villa with Full Board package. As per me, Waterland in Negambo, Sri Lanka, seems to have several drawbacks that can impact the overall experience of guests.

The location of the resort, situated at a remote place at the bank of river Maha Oya, might be attractive for those looking for a tranquil atmosphere, but the fact that the nearest market is about 5 kilometers away can be a disadvantage, as guests have no other options for food and beverages but the resort. Furthermore, the lack of English proficiency among the staff can lead to communication barriers, which may hinder guests from fully enjoying their stay.

While checking in, the staff member at reception argued with me in poor English, which was very unprofessional. He mentioned multiple times that it's my fault that I was late for check-in. The staff refused my request to connect me with the owner to discuss the issue. As hospitality professionals, the staff should always strive to provide excellent customer service, including clear communication and a willingness to resolve any issues or concerns that guests may have. 

Another downside of the resort is that the staff asks for additional dollars for almost everything, which can be frustrating for guests and affect the overall experience negatively. This may also suggest that the resort is trying to cut corners or that the staff is not being paid adequately.

Moreover, the resort's location by the river and the jungle means that guests have to contend with various insects and animals, such as lizards, spiders, bugs, and mosquitoes, which can make the stay uncomfortable for some guests. The fact that the pool is not maintained decently and that the poolside table is worn out adds to the overall impression of poor maintenance.

Additionally, the hotel's area not being safe and not recommended for couples and kids can be a major concern for guests who are seeking a relaxing and secure vacation.

The issue of the birds and cat not being fed adequately is also concerning, as this could affect the health and well-being of the animals. Additionally, the portions of food offered are not sufficient, and guests are charged extra for additional portions, which is disappointing.

Overall, based on the information provided, Waterland in Negambo, Sri Lanka does not seem to offer a satisfactory experience for guests due to several drawbacks, including the remote location, language barriers, additional charges, inadequate maintenance, and issues with animal welfare and food portions.
title: Unsafe and for for couples and family

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for sharing your experiences.

We understand that you had difficulty reaching Waterland.  We're sorry that you had trouble finding the place.  Such difficulty can be frustrating and can tarnish one's experiences.

Waterland is not in the main touristic part of Negombo.  The final stretch to Waterland on a small country road certainly has one wondering where one is going.   Part of the joy of the journey is how unexpected it is to suddenly cross the bridge and come upon Waterland.  That joy is no doubt lost if one gets lost.

To help guide guests to Waterland, we have directions on our webpage, inform guests that Waterland is on Google Maps, and place directional signs throughout the area. 

How disappointing that your sleep was interrupted by the music from a religious service.  Sri Lanka is a religious society.  Churches, mosques, and temples often broadcast their services.  As you note, these services start early.   The music you that disturbed you undoubtedly came from the church across the river.  The amplified church services do not occur every day, but do occur several times per week.

We installed significantly thicker glass than the building codes require in order to minimize such sounds.  This helps dampen the sounds, but does not eliminate it.

Waterland's location gives travelers a chance to experience life on the river.  Local favor is a previous element of traveling,  but can also have its inconveniences.  We're sorry that the inconveniences were so pronounced for you.

Your disappointment highlights that Waterland is not a great choice for those who prefer the convenience of a large hotel that is more insulated from nature, the elements, and the surrounding community.
placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text:
Overpriced and difficult to reach.
I was waken up at 5:00am for the prayer and I could not sleep anymore because of high volume speakers diffusing loud music till 6 am and later.
Just unbearable unless you like waking up at sunset!
title: Not what I expected

ownerResponse/text:
We're very sorry to hear that you had a disappointing stay.

Waterland has hosted over 8,000 guests in the 5 years since we built the place.  During those 5 years, we have only had 2 other instances in which a guest gave the property such a poor review on Trip Advisor.  1 of those 2 guests had not stayed at Waterland and was simply disgruntled that they were charged for a room  after not showing up.

Your review was so disconcerting that I called a meeting of all the staff to identify what went wrong and how we could work to ensure that the issues you raised are addressed.

Here is what emerged in that staff meeting.

1. There seems to have been a misunderstanding about your request to have breakfast in the room.   Food in the tropics serve as magnets for bugs and even just a few crumbs can attract bugs.  We never serve meals inside the villas. 

2. Breakfast consists of multiple courses.  It is augmented by tea/coffee, juice, and water.  When we served breakfast on the private decks, we discovered that the food was no longer as warm as it should be by the time it was carried to the decks and that we could not offer the attentive service that is so important to us.  Accordingly, 3 years ago we decided as a matter of policy 3 to serve breakfast only in the restaurant or on the restaurant patio.  While this may seem inflexible to you, it is a decision based on experience.

3. We offer our guests the option to have their lunch (generally a 1-course meal) on their private decks.  If it is raining, dining on the private decks is not an option.

4. My understanding is that you were given the option of having lunch indoors in the restaurant, but that you elected to have lunch outside.   Generally, Waterland does not have many flies, but there are several times each year when the flies can be a menace all along the west coast.  It's unfortunate that flies disturbed you during the lunch and prevented you from being able to enjoy the excellent food.

5. We're sorry to hear that you were disturbed by mosquitos.  There are generally relatively few mosquitos at Waterland.  We have taken great care to eliminate potential nesting places for mosquitos in the garden and we constructed the villas to minimize the intrusion of bugs into the villas.  There are mosquito screens in the bathrooms and generally the only way mosquitos can enter the villas is if a door has been left open.  As an added precaution against mosquitoes, 4 of the 5 villas including the one you stayed in have mosquito nets around the bed.  My understanding from the staff is that you did not use the mosquito net.  We're sorry that you encountered mosquitoes.

6. Regarding a possible roof leak, we have not received any complaints from other guests of a roof leak in that villa and when we looked for a roof leak, we did not find one.  We will continue to monitor the situation, though.  Roof leaks can be elusive.  We have a repair person on staff and will ensure that any roof leak that is detected is immediately addressed.

A holiday should be a joyful experience and clearly your experience was disappointing.  We're sorry about that.
placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text:
Checked in for a one night stay. When we checked in we asked if breakfast could be served to the room and they agreed. Following day morning refused and we had to go back without breakfast.
The roof was leaking and our bed was wet so did not have a good sleep.
We were asked to have meals out in the varenda during lunch with flies landing on our food.during night bitten by mosquitos. Even though the food was good we did not get the chance to enjoy it.
Staff was not flexible at all. For this price would have expected more. 
Wouldn’t recommend to anyone or would not come back here.
title: Poor service,leaking roof. Disappointing

ownerResponse/text:
Thanks for staying at Waterland and for sharing your experiences.  We understand how some disappointing aspects can tarnish the whole of one's experience.

As a small establishment with only 5 villas, we cannot offer meals around the clock in the way that a 5-star hotel can.  We list our mealtimes on our webpage and in our listings with online travel agencies such as booking.com.

Thanks for sharing your concerns about the limited vegetarians options.  Over the summer, we appointed a new head chef and revamped the menu.  The new menu includes a much larger assortment of vegetarian options.

One day a week, we served a Sri Lankan breakfast so that guests can get a taste of Sri Lankan food.  The egg hoppers were not made the day before.  

There seems to have been some misunderstanding regarding seating.  Guests are most welcome to sit at another table and the staff are pleased to change the table settings.  

Regarding the airport transfer, my understanding from the front desk staff is that you were asked to let them know what time you wanted the transport to the airport, but that they did not hear back from you.  Again, this seems to have been a communication issue.  We know how aggravating such experiences can be and are empathetic.

On the day of your visit, our spa therapist was off.  In such situations, we offer our guests free transport to/from another spa.  Again, we can understand how this can cause disappointment, especially if the circumstances are not explained to you.

We're sorry that you had difficulty finding the air-conditioning control.  We have a protocol for showing guests their villas.  That protocol is abbreviated when guests arrive at night as we know that guests want to go to bed as soon as possible.

To facilitate communication with the front desk, we now have mobile phones which we check out to the guests when they arrive.  

We're sorry that your experience at Waterland was a disappointing one.
placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text:
We were excited to round off our Sri Lanka trip with a stay in Waterland, which is billed as a five-star hotel. However, the experience disappointed on a range of levels:

1) The food situation is exceptionally poor. Lunch is served from 12-2pm and dinner from 7-8:30. Since check in is at 2 you better make sure you're well fed, because this hotel is far from town, with no eateries nearby, and they won't even get you a sandwich or a bag of crisps in those intervening five hours. We were shown the menu at check in and it was very limited - chicken, beef, fish or prawns with a side of potatoes and grilled vegetables. There was one vegetarian option which was, hilariously, grilled vegetables with a side of potatoes and grilled vegetables. Sri Lanka is arguably one of the best places in the world for vegetarian food, and we have eaten like kings our whole trip, so this was disappointing to say the least. We checked in at 2:30 and found ourselves getting straight back in a tuk tuk into Negombo to go and get some food at one of the luxury hotels on the beach because there was none at the resort. Since we're veggie we also didn't want to eat dinner at the hotel. We didn't even get back till 10pm since we felt Waterland didn't provide the amenities we wanted - nice food and a luxury spa - and we had to go elsewhere for these.

2) Breakfast was terrible. We went and sat in the dining room and the waiter, who wasn't friendly at all, just began putting food out in front of us. We weren't given a menu or even told what we would be eating. When I asked what they were going to feed us he said egg hoppers. Since you could see into the kitchen I saw them getting egg hoppers out of the fridge and dumping them on plates. They weren't even fresh, had clearly been cooked the night before, were served stone cold (weren't even re-heated) and that was the only option at breakfast. There were also the standard accompaniments of fruit and juice. The coffee didn't arrive until after the food. I also asked if we could sit outside and eat breakfast by the river but I was told I couldn't because they couldn't be bothered to set up another table! The outside tables are two meters away from the inside ones and there's no door. 

3) The hotel website and the brochure in the room offer airport transfers. I attempted to book this TWICE, once via email the day before we checked in and another time verbally when we checked in. Both times I told them when the flight was and both times I was told that the transfer had been booked for me. Then on the day of departure I went to the front desk and the guy there just looked at me blankly and said it hadn't been booked. I showed him the confirmation email I had received and he shrugged and looked confused. He didn't apologise or offer to book transport, just shrugged. Eventually a manager turned up and organised a taxi for us, but not before a lot of stress from us since we thought we might miss our flight! I'm not sure how they expect people to book this if not via email or verbally? The staff didn't care at all. 

4) No spa. Despite it being advertised on the booking site and the website, when we arrived we were told with a shrug 'no spa'. It sounds like it hasn't been operational for a while but the reasons were unclear. Instead we were offered a grubby, used price list for a cheap spa called Jasmin Villas and told that it was 3km away and they could arrange transport but it closes early. We ended up going to one of the other resorts on the beach to get a massage. 

5) Like most of Sri Lanka, there is a power cut in the evening, which is fine, but this messes with the air con, which switched itself off and started flashing a red light. The guy who checked us in didn't show us where the air con controller was so we spent 20 minutes in a very hot muggy room trying to find it (it's hidden on the wall inside the bed just FYI).

6) They have removed all telephones from the rooms! The brochure said that if we had any issues to just call 808, but they didn't even have a phone installed - the wire was still sticking out of the wall (lovely!) but no phone. 

7) A litany of other issues: the water containers in the room hadn't been refilled so we were really thirsty by the morning; they don't serve alcohol at all, which is fine but I'd rather have known that before booking; no hairdryer (but a hairdryer holder). 

Basically, you get a private plunge pool, which is of course nice. But this doesn't even come close to a five-star experience for us. We stayed in some spectacular hotels in Sri Lanka but this wasn't one. 

I've noted some responses from management to previous negative reviews suggesting that the reasons those people had a poor experience is because they were not willing to spend money and because the hotel is not aimed at backpackers or people on a budget, so I'd like to make it clear that we would happily have spent whatever money it took to have an enjoyable and relaxing final evening to round off a wonderful trip, but this was not possible at Waterland, which was among the worst hotels we stayed at on this beautiful island.
title: Very disappointing, not a five-star experience

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for sharing your concerns.

We did not receive a booking cancelation from the online travel agency.

We checked with the online travel agency and they told us they have no record of a cancelation from you from several months ago.

If you canceled several months ago, you should have received a copy of your booking cancelation from Agoda.  If you have the confirmation of the cancelation from Agoda from several months ago, please send it to both Agoda and to us.  We will then work with the online travel agency so that they offer you a refund.

Regarding the charges, local taxes are automatically charged by the online travel agencies Agoda and Booking.com to the bookings.  When you make your booking, these taxes are indicated.  If you look at your booking confirmation from Agoda, you should see those taxes in the full booking confirmation.

In terms of communications, when you did not show up, we reported that to the online travel agency.

We are sorry that you experienced these unhappy surprises and can well understand your frustration and unhappiness.
placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text:
I was charged for a booking I made at this hotel, despite cancelling it on the Agoda app a few months prior to my booking date. I received no communication from the hotel or Agoda that there had been an issue cancelling my booking. There was also no attempts made to contact me when I did not show up to the hotel as they must have expected me to. I was disappointed to find and unexpected charge on my credit card which I had to investigate the cause of. To put the icing on the cake, the charge to my card was more than the per night price quoted by Agoda - I was charged local taxes - why should I be charged these if I never set foot in Sri Lanka.

I would recommend paying in cash if you are staying here and would not recommend providing credit card details
title: Charged for cancelled booking

Then I request from Front office before check-in to change it to a triple room, rather than paying so much money for a 11 year old kid. They refuse it & told me cant change the room to triple. title: Disappointing Stay...

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text: The Manager of the Hotel do not know how to talk with guests. We got the room two hours late @5.00 pM. Dirty Bathrooms, not maintained rooms.  I do not recommend this hotel. Com mod is not cleaned and waste water is not draining.
title: Too Bad Facilities

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text: This was one of our most expensive nights in our 11 days in SR. By far the most disappointing. The hotel is very poorly maintained, old furniture, noisy AC... not according to a "luxury resort".... The staff is under trained and under motivated, by far well below our SL experience of very friendly staff. The restaurant was among the worse in our trip: overcrowded, small, mediocre food.Big regret.
title: Poorly maintained and serviced

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
There was a offer on cards when i booked the hotel, i have booked 3 rooms, soon after i reached to the rooms i found water leak from the air con and the water is travelling towards the bed. Once i informed a technician came to repair the a/c he was there for half an hour then he said the issue was fixed. But again it's started to leak, this time the property manager also came to the room - very nice gentleman, it took them another 45 minutes but could not rectify the issue, then only they agreed for a room change!! The bathroom is very small - when you sit on the commode your legs will be touching the shower cubical - very annoying. But main amenities are available in the bathroom.
Food - if i want to tell the truth there were no verity for dinner & breakfast, what we thought is they have covering the cost because of the discount given, restaurant service is average! sharp 12 noon we got a call from the reception, that they informed us our check out time is 12 noon!! 
The staffs are super friendly (including reception, housekeeping, maintenance) but whats the point if the rooms & foods are not up to the quality??
For me it's overpriced - This place should make some improvement on food & service!!
title: Did not Expect!

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text: Arrived to initial good impressions from the reception and staff. Checked into room 105 ground floor by the bar. The safe didn’t work and we felt uncomfortable putting all our documents etc in there even after it was repaired with some gaffa tape. The room was tired full of flys and the outside door which was practically at the bar didn’t  seal. We had an early start so asked if we could move to a quieter room and one with a fully operational safe. We were told they were full and no rooms available. We thought this was a bit off so phoned our tour operator about changing hotel. After a few calls we were offered another room 101 much quieter and despite what the number may suggest it was a much better room all round. The management also offered us a free upgrade to a superior double the following night 239. This was a slightly more spacious room on first floor. On further use the hot water went to a trickle and Luke warm, the air conditioning leaked water on the floor, and again a tired room. (Better choice of tea bags though!!) The evening buffet meal was average and we decided  the following night and lunchtime to eat out. Both far better and only 5 mins from hotel . Breakfast was appalling flys everywhere, not had that in anywhere else we have eaten in Sri Lanka. I wasn’t actually sure if I was drinking coffee it was indescribable. Some of the buffet items were cold when they were clearly meant to be hot. We didn’t complain again after our initial gripe as we were leaving the morning of breakfast and seemed pointless.  Having stayed at one of the other sister hotels it was like chalk and cheese!!!
title: Our 5th hotel on this trip sadly the worst one!!

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
We stoped @ Kithala for an early dinner after driving 5/6 hours from Colombo. 
Resturant staff seems friendly, but they ( probably Kitchen) got all our orders wrong. 
Do not eat Orange Panna Cotta, it’s tasted like made from rubber,
title: Was there only for dinner and it was the worst experience

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
We’ve a group booking here for 2 nights in 24-25Dec.  Closed to check-in date, hotel informed us that we have to join a mandatory X’mas party at US$65 per head.

We plan to come here for birding, and explained that we’re not interested. However, hotel said we couldn’t opt out of this party and must pay the US$65 per head fee.

Feel like a scam!!

Our group leader was forced to make last-minute rearrangement to look for alternative hotel during high season. Sigh!!
title: Mandatory X’mas party with fee; cannot opt out

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid at at all cost
text:
1st Incident - Major
We had a Deluxe room and a Suite booked. Myself and my wife wend to the deluxe and asked our parents to go to the suit. After some time we just went to our parents room and surprisingly got to know that it is also a deluxe room. Frankly our parents were not aware of the difference. After informing the front desk, they were very offensive and said there is a guest already in the suit and CAN NOT REFUND as well. After calling to the top management they apologised and changed the room. However their excuse was very childish. They said it was a trainee person handled the situation and she did not have any clue what to do. 

2nd Incident - Minor
Even though we had a full board booking, management refused to give a single additional water bottle. Charged Rs.200 for a water bottle while maximum retail price still marked as 50 (at least they could have removed the label or re-brand it)

3rd Incident -Major
According to the hotel policy check-out time was 12.00 noon. Which was clearly written in instructions. On the last day at 11.45am front office called and mentioned that checkout time is 11.00 am and they had already given us one additional hour. I went to the front office with documents and showed them it is 12 not 11. I was ready to check out exactly at 12 and did so. I asked why they lie. Then the answer was hilarious. They admitted that they lied and say the check out time is 11 so that people may go out at least at 12.. hahaaaa. Since instructions are written in English I think they do this to locals thinking that they might not to read the instructions.

Cleanliness
Bathrooms were not clean. bathroom fitting in the shower were heavily corroded. 

Water quality
Water was very salty. Can't have a bath.

Wifi
No wifi in rooms.

One good thing
Pool area was beautiful facing a paddy field.   

Shame on you Kithala Resort. Will never go again..
title: Not professional at all - the worst hotel experience

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Two days ago we have visited Kithala Resort with expecting 3 star level luxury. Food served are quite decent. However we felt that Hotel could improve with below areas.

1. Corridors have bad smell due to bad washroom vent management.
2. Showers does not have enough water pressure.
3. Shower cubicle doesn't drain accordingly, due bad water leveling.
4. Towels kept in rooms containing a fungal smell.
5. No extra water bottles provided
6. Extremely poor Wi-Fi connection. 
7. Overall hotel cleanliness can be ranked 6 out 10.
8. Failed to maintain standard maintained by other Theme Resorts. (Like Aliya) 

Strongly recommend hotel to improve above facts to out stand from other hotels around Tissamaharama.
title: Kithala Better Be Improve

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text: They will give u only 500 ml water bottle for fullbord stay not enough per person. Room service and cleanliness is terrible. Useless stay.. not good. Food wasn’t good . Shower water is terrible.. bad.
title: Bad service

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Greetings From Kithala Resort...!!!

We would like to begin by thanking you for not only choosing to stay with us but for further taking the time to review your experiences at the property on this site. 

We are glad that you were somewhat satisfied with some of the services and facilities but we are very concerned about the areas that failed to meet with your discerning taste. We do apologize for the meals and other areas of dissatisfaction. And especially we sincerely hope you will accept our humble apologies and rest assured that chef has been informed on all these matters and he has taken them very seriously and will take the right steps to rectify them. 
Generally we have the senior staff and management of the hotel meeting with all of the guests and when a concern is raised we do whatever is possible to make the guests stay more comfortable because it's too late to do anything once the clients have left the property. In this case none of the team remember you raising any concerns during your time in the hotel.
 
Hope you will give us the opportunity to welcome you again in the near future and let us regain your confidence in our service and facilities.  

Ayubowan !!!

Ananda Wickramasinghe
Manager
placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed in this hotel for one night in August and it was enough.
The first impression at our arrival was very good, the hall was very nice and they welcomed us with a kind of ritual, the swimming pool looked beautiful because is placed in a nice landscape: but that was all! 
The room was dirty and definitely lack of maintenance in the bathroom: the hairdryer was falling of, the shower is not well sealed so we ended up with a pond in the bathroom and last but not least there is a terrible smell.
Moreover the dinner and breakfast were very poor:
1. the place where is served is very narrow so if there are just few people queuing, it seems crowded 
2. the food is not good and with a poor choice 
3. the staff  inadequate and inefficient 
 
It has a potential but it needs a new management that bring it from the bottom to the top.
The location is convenient for the safari to the Yala park.
title: Poor

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Greetings From Kithala Resort ...!!!

We thank you for your feedback following your recent stay with us. We apologize that highlighted areas, didn’t meet your expectations. We are constantly reviewing our standards and always endeavor to improve our product and service offerings. Your constructive feedback is therefore deeply valued by us and will certainly be looked into as areas where. We could better our quality standards. 

While thanking you for taking time to write to us, we certainly hope to have the privilege of welcoming you back at our hotel, for a another comfortable stay with us. 

Ayubowan..!!!

Ananda Wickramasinghe
Manager
placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
We have brought this hotel during our Sri Lanka tour because close to the day after Safari trip. 
I have absolutely no clue what the other visitors saw when giving 4 stars, but for sure not a standard good resort in Sri Lanka, because this place it's largely below any expectations. 

1) Food / dinner: bad food, low quality.
Arrived at 20:15 we have been asked to rush for the dinner as the buffet restaurant was closing at 21:30. 
The food was the standard Sri Lanka mix of specialities, with extra Spanish Paela and Italian Lasagne: no comment on those. Everything was clearly not clocked for the dinner, but largely before, maybe from lunch or the day before. The meat was very dry and hard, even the chicken was hard to chew, same for the smelly fish: never found such lo quality level of food in Sri Lanka, neither in the local side road shops "only for locals".

2) Room : dirty, very dirty. 
Only thing we didn't found in the room were dead big animals. 
We found on the bed sheets clear dirty signs, probably made by dirty feet or hands. Several hair on the bed. On the floor several dead insects, included on the side bed carpets. Some alive mosquito, and spider. 
Shower full of limestime and mold. 
On the shelves clear stains of previous guest sweet tea or soda.
Bed mattress very old and too soft: was time to change it several years ago.

3) Staff: not welcoming , not kind, with no clue what's "taking care of the customer " nor "customer satisfaction ".
When highlighting the issues with the mosquito they just mentioned that we should have already in the room the electric repellent. We have been forced to insist to have some spray spread around in the room, and the guy was doing that like we asked him to go on top of Everest. Quite impolite finally we managed to convince him to help us. But he was clearly unhappy to leave his mobile phone and come to us.

Conclusion: we'll never come back, we suggest to not visit , we'll ask our travel agency reimbursements and to bring other tourists to this place.
title: Absolutely not acceptable: better to avoid.

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Thank goodness we were only here for one night! 
And, that we arrived late and were then on safari very early!

The welcome from the staff was fabulous. The reception is lovely. Staff couldn’t do enough for us. Then it all went downhill. 

Deluxe room was what we booked. Substandard room was what we got. 

Very sad room. Ripped wallpaper. Dirty, sticky surfaces in the bedroom. Stained furniture. Dirty pillows. Dirty shower screen, dirty toilet, mismatched toilet seat. 

My advice.....If this hotel is on your itinerary (as it was with ours via Haley’s Travel), ask for a replacement.
title: 2* for lovely staff

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text: Booked 2 rooms through Expedia. Air conditioner is dripping water and room no 237 stinks.  When complained the Manager waived off some charges on the resultant bill. It was confirmed that  there is some structural problem with the drains.  I visited this hotel about 5 times during last 10 years but now it has gone to the dogs.
title: Upper floor rooms stinks!

placeInfo/address: 200 Union Place, Colombo 00200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid this hotel. Yea having a suite is very nice but Colombo now has other options and they are new with good service.
text: We were there for 10 days and yes the hotel was booked full. We had booked two room well in advance but we were given rooms on different floors. To add to this in a 33 floor building there were two working elevators and they weren’t on the same system so everyone called both elevators. Waiting for 10 to 15 mins for an elevator was the norm. The WiFi didn’t work and despite multiple service calls, it was never fixed. The staff didn’t care and all complaints fell on deaf ears. This was was fifth stay at this property and definitely my LAST. They need a serious management update and train the staff what the hospitality business is about.
title: Poor Service and outdated property

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mehmetdubai
 
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback regarding your recent stay at Hilton Colombo Residences. We sincerely apologize for the disappointment you experienced during your visit.

We understand your concerns about the condition of the rooms and the hotel itself. We appreciate your feedback and assure you that we take these matters seriously. 

Regarding the issue with dinner on Christmas Eve, we apologize for the inconvenience caused by the fully booked situation. We understand how important it is to have a pleasant dining experience, especially on such a special occasion. We apologize for not proactively informing you about the availability of tables and for any inconvenience this may have caused. We will review our processes to ensure better communication in the future.

We greatly value your feedback as it helps us identify areas for improvement. We are committed to providing exceptional service and ensuring that our guests have a memorable stay. We appreciate your kind words about the warm hospitality of the Sri Lankan people.

We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future and provide you with an improved experience.
 
Kind regards
 
Karim Schadlou
General Manager
placeInfo/address: 200 Union Place, Colombo 00200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Try to find new hotels in colombo as hiltons are not new and renovated.
text:
I think hilton global  forgot their property in colombo.
Another opinion is they may prapare it for their new project which would be the hilton museum.
But for museum you need something valuable.
it was  one the worst hilton experiences for us as we were together 3 family members total 15.
Rooms and hotel itself need a heavy renovation .
Another issue is we could not found a table to have dinner on christmas eve as they said its already fully booked and we went another hotel for dinner.
Nobody ask us before !
The only good thing is srilankan warm prople.
title: Worst hilton experience ever

placeInfo/address: 200 Union Place, Colombo 00200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: At check in ask for modern rooms or they push old rooms on you and they are horrible.
text:
Absolutely horrible stay. Firstly the security staff there is very rude. They immediately told us that we can’t have parking although we have a reservation with the hotel. We had to argue with them for 10 mins to get a parking spot which is a fantastic way to welcome a guest.No one picked up our bags  from the next point and we were given a very very old room. The sheets were yellow towels had stains the furniture was very dated. We wanted to have the balcony opened which we requested. This was followed by an interrogation like conversation which was very rude from their part and took them a good while to open the balcony as well. The hotel staff needs to learn how to speak to clients.  They are quite rude and acted as if we were staying at the hotel for free. 

I would like to highlight the good things as well. The washrooms were quite well maintained and the front desk staff member on the day of me checking out was very helpful.
title: Old hotel, rude staff, disgrace to the Hilton name

placeInfo/address: 200 Union Place, Colombo 00200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If your clostrophobic and need fresh Air to calm down don't go here windows are seald shut.
text: The windows seald shut to stop fresh sea Air,my speaker was taken from me at check in and a hotel speaker provided 6 hours latter just before bed.the $145 dollar per night that was $charged@$171 with taxes on site was charged at $223. With another set of taxes for the Sri Lankan government I was told breakfast wasn't brought up so we missed it we had 2 kids and couldn't get them ready in time other than that I would never visit Hilton hotels again.
title: Worst stay value for money

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: 200 Union Place, Colombo 00200 Sri Lanka
text: This is our second time stayin at the Hilton residences. As usual the apartment was very clean and comfortable. I would like to mention few staff members who made our stay memorable. Dasantha- on porter duty, Sampath Alwis - mended the washing machine, Umesh-room clean and who kindly brought in a microwave oven when i needed to warm some milk for my grand daughter, Shanaka-in room dining who recomended the dishes for dinner I was hosting, and Pradeep who  also helped me to decide on the menu for the day. All in all a brilliant stay. I wish all the staff I  mentioned and others who made our stay welcome a very good future at Hilton Residences. from Mr. Methsiri & Mrs. Chandrika Wijeratna from London UK
title: brilliant memorable stay. recommend it to my family and friends

placeInfo/address: 200 Union Place, Colombo 00200 Sri Lanka
text:
Worst hotel experience of our entire trip. They made no mention of the on going construction work before check in , and certainly didn’t want to worry us with the noise to follow .

Complaints were generally reacted to as if I was lying or with false promises to fix the situation , free beer was even offered … and ever tuned up .  

Staff here show a constant and superficial desire to see if you’re happy , and their assumption is that you are , because when you’re not , they’ve got Nothing to offer as a solution .

Friday night we’re off to bed early as we have an early flight … at 7 pm the pub”Level” turns on what ever Bass focused garbage it has for a sound system and drowns every nearby hotel room in a nonstop wave of bass noise .

The Hilton staff stated it wasn’t their problem , and even when faced with local law and the numbers to call they did nothing , no cares of any kind . Just a deep seated desire that I shut up and stop making  a fuss 

To add to this the air con was Also noisy and old . 

So if your idea of fun is sleepless nights at a hotel well past it’s glory days then this is the place for you  .  Tomorrow morning they get to face a family that’s not slept and has to get up at 4 am…..
title: Run runaway fast

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: 200 Union Place, Colombo 00200 Sri Lanka
text:
It was not the first time we stayed at Hilton Colombo Residences. My family and I stayed at this Hotel/Apartments for two full months in Feb and March 2022. And again in Dec 2022, this time with a very bad experience. Money (cash n Euros) was taken by someone from our apartment, someone from the Hilton Residences who have access to rooms for different purposes. 
We reported that to the security team and then the general manager got involved too. The Security manager was not friendly to us, or to my local Sri Lankan Company representatives who came to support me on that day to report the incident. We felt we were the ones being blamed, not taken seriously, his tone of voice and manners were rude to us. The General Manager got involved a day later, and he was definitely showing a much better care and respect to us as a Customer. I thank him for that. I believe they investigated the incident a bit internally , however we were told there was no proof we had that money and no proof that somebody took it. Felt absolutely unprotected and questioned. 
We canceled the rest of our stay, and moved to another place in Colombo.
title: Money taken from our room.

placeInfo/address: 200 Union Place, Colombo 00200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: as I've been told by a few friends since, there are a lot more other options for short stays in Colombo where they have got their act together.
text:
my family and I stayed at the Hilton residencies for a couple of days in September 2022. 

we booked our stay on the official website. There is a glitch on the website where it quotes you the wrong cost until you come to the very last page where you have to make the payment. I called to enquire about this discrepancy but the staff had no idea what I was talking about. they were super apologetic, which I appreciated but no one took accountability. having paid more than we had initially planned because we were misled on the website, we ended up staying anyway.
There is a QR code that brings up an online menu where the prices are inconsistent with what they charge you when you order room service. again, the staff were apologetic about this but again there was no one to take ownership and really talk to the problem. 
Will not be staying again and I genuinely feel for the workers here.
title: triple check the prices that they quote!!

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: 200 Union Place, Colombo 00200 Sri Lanka
text:
Along the years we stayed in several Hiltons but this place really ruins the reputation of the chain! Our apartment was at the fourteen floor. As soon as we stepped out of the elevator (where the tags indicating the facilities present in each floor have fallen off leaving just glue), we had the feeling of being in a prison rather than in a hotel. Please see the photos, those speak more than the words.... The apartment had an "old" look but it seemed ok...until we entered the kitchen...DIRTY!! and in a bad shape! Really disgusting,this is not what you would expect from this hotel.
At least the beds were clean and comfortable,  but one the showers was not working, the knob fell off when I tried to operated it. The pool was ok.  To make things worst, they have a ball room for weddings. When we stayed there there was a wedding with loud music until 5am!!! If they want to organize weddings and the music gets to a certain part of the hotel they should not let guests staying there during that time, we did not sleep at all...just the night before our long flight home. And finally, we booked a taxi for the airport with the hotel, and it arrived 20 min late. Do yourself a favor and stay away from this place.
title: It ruins the Hilton reputation, Dirty kitchen, noisy

text:
Such a let down at the Colombo Residence, who fall so far behind in every respect to the Hilton Colombo Hotel on Sir Chittampalam A Gardiner.  

The main person behind the desk was a chap called Dinindra, the most appalling, obnoxious, least customer-orientated member of the Hilton family I have experience globally.

He was arrogant at check-in and convinced that he was totally accurate with his opinions on the booking made, despite Hilton corporate stating otherwise.

How Hilton can ignore such a blatant disrespect for their loyal customers is beyond words.  This person should NOT be a representative of Hilton, especially in a customer-facing role.

My advice would be to stay at the Hilton Colombo, where the staff are welcoming, very customer-focused, attentive and supportive of their customer needs (5* in all respects). Unfortunately there are no stars lower than 1, otherwise this is what Colombo Residence would receive!
title: Appalling Customer Service from Dinindra - New Front Desk Personnel Required

ownerResponse/text:
Dear ChrisandJulieM, 
Thank you for your feedback. We also felt very disappointed about your arrival experience. Indeed, we had received an amendment request from the travel agency concerned with the request to cancel your reservation. Upon your arrival, it therefore took some time to find your reservation, but I am happy that we have been able to secure your room despite the received cancellation. 
I apologize this impacted your experience negatively, but am also happy to hear you did appreciate the size of the room and the comfort of the bed. 
I have well taken note of your comments about the airport collection and have discussed this further for improvement. 

Kind Regards
Linda Giebing
General Manager
placeInfo/address: 200 Union Place, Colombo 00200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: go elsewhere
text:
I stay at Hiltons a lot, always happy with the staff and standards applied, except this one!! The tone of emails when trying to organise airport collection and get honours account on the booking was not to be welcome! upon arrival the staff insisted the room had been cancelled yet the system of booking it was still showing! More embarrassment. The room itself was very large, although a challenge to get hot water working and the road noise was very high. The bed was comfortable, although the wifi was not the best. Did not try the food as I did not rate my chances based on the rest of the experience.
It was that bad I am considering changing hotel chains I use
title: Unbelievable

placeInfo/address: 200 Union Place, Colombo 00200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Room 1502 is relatively newly renovated, great view, balconies are not accessible
text:
Our stay at this hotel soon turned into a comedy of errors - the staff need significant improvement and training on customer service.
From the moment we arrived, we were greeted at the door by....well no one...the door man was just standing there looking at us unload our own suitcases and when my husband opened the door to enter the hotel, the doorman decided to enter first...
We were eventually helped by some staff to load our bags onto a trolley.  Then as we approached the front desk, we were greeted by a lady with "yeah?".  I was so stunned by this greeting I thought she must have been speaking to someone else....but she repeated herself.  The staff showed no interest in welcoming us to this hotel and just wanted us moved out of the way.  
We booked the 3 bedroom apartment for 4 adults and 1 child.  I must admit the apartment was great, clean, spacious, and good amenities.  However the treatment from the staff, or lack thereof, has left a bad taste.  
I called for some washing powder for the washing machine - I had to call 2 times and also ask the front desk in person - the washing powder never came.  I called reception to make a booking at the Floor restaurant for 9 people for dinner and the booking was confirmed,  However our plans changed and when I called to cancel my booking, I was told there was no reservation to cancel...
We called reception to send us a box of tissues, they arrived when our friend who was visiting us came through the door - apparently the service staff had asked our friend if he was going to room 1502, and asked if he could take the tissues with him...
Everytime we walked passed reception, the girls there were either huddled around for a chat or looking at their phones.  The only staff member that was of any help was the house keeping (I think his name was Asanka) who cleaned our room and provided us with an oversupply of bottled water - I think he was trying to make up for the inadequate staff at the front desk,  He did everything with a smile and nothing was ever a problem.  Uncle Cubby please thank this boy from the Wickramasinghe's.
We also had a light breakfast at the cafe downstairs, after standing at the counter for 10 minutes while the waiter served everyone other than me, he looked at me and said - oh sorry I thought you were waiting for your food...I'm sorry I didnt realise I was now one of their wait staff and needed to deliver food and hot drinks to the tables for them??!!
If you are ordering drinks at the pool, please make sure you are specific about your request - I ordered a shot of Baileys on ice - what I got was a glass of baileys blended with crushed ice like a slushy.  When I asked the pool staff to remake it - he rolled his eyes right in front of me and was clearly annoyed at my request to get the drink I originally ordered and not his icey creation.
The pool is good and they also have a small kids pool which my daughter loved.  There is also a small playground as well.
The hotel is right next to food city so this is very convenient.
As I read this review I know some of this sounds petty, however for a 5 star Hilton brand and the price you pay for a 3 bedroom apartment, the service was not acceptable.
title: Terrible Service - great room

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at this hotel on Tuesday, October 8, 2024, planning to check out on the 10th but left after one night due to severe issues with the room and facilities.

While the reception area appears well-maintained, it conceals the hotel's overall neglect. We were given a lower-ground room with a lake view, but it had a strong musty smell, damp air, and visible mould on a lampshade. During a rainstorm, water seeped through the doors leading to the lake, and we had to mop up to prevent flooding.

After a tiring day of travel, we decided to report these issues the next morning. A brief walk around the hotel revealed further signs of neglect: missing tiles and loose light fixtures around the pool, broken sunbeds, and general uncleanliness in common areas.

We’d booked a 5 am safari with the hotel, so we retired early. However, at 4:30 am, we awoke to find blood stains on the sheets from bedbug bites, with bugs still crawling on the bed (photos attached). We immediately went to the front desk, but the safari driver hurriedly took us to the tour without addressing our concerns. Shaken by the experience we decided we wouldn't have been able to enjoy the safari and so returned to the hotel and chose to check out early.

Upon our return, I spoke with Angela, the hotel manager, who agreed to refund both nights through Priceline, the booking service we used. She explained that Priceline would need to contact the hotel directly to process the refund. However, nearly a month later, I’ve received confirmation that EKHO has been ignoring Priceline’s requests, refusing to approve the refund.

This experience reflects a lack of cleanliness, safety, and integrity at this hotel. I would caution others to consider these issues before booking.
title: DO NOT STAY HERE - BED BUGS AND UNCLEAN!!

text: Me and My partner stayed here for one night in order to use the Safari park we ordered lunch here on our day of arrival, the staff were welcoming and got us a welcome drink and let us to our room early. I had the club sandwich and she had the devilled chicken. This should have been enough to deter us from eating her again. We've been travelling Sri Lanka now for 2 weeks and the devilled chicken was just bones and my club sandwich was pitiful, having finished the safari late and low on options we looked for dinner elsewhere, but read the reviews here and thought perhaps it was just a bad experience, and to give it another go, this time cesar salads and a tomato soup (I also requested some bread with it) wow no chicken in the Cesar salad and dressing tasted like it had gone sour. The bread for my soup was so tough I actually took it to reception and showed him just how hard it was to tear apart. It turned me red to try to break the bread, he responded "wow I'm so sorry" i didn't even have to say what the issue was it nearly broke my teeth. On leaving I also raised the issue with the food to reception but was still handed the bill with no reduction despite neither of us eating the lettuce, soup and rock they called bread. I gave 2 stars tho because the 2 staff that greeted us were friendly and the bathroom and view was nice. AC however was dirty and the beds were 2 single beds pushed together. I'd recommend everyone look elsewhere because the food is lethal!!
title: The food might break your teeth

text: we stayed in this hotel from NOVEMBER 26th evening to 28th morning .We went for a 9 days vacation to Srilanka, we enjoyed our stay in other 5 hotels but this was the worst ever. DINING HALL....HORRIBLE smell which was not comfortable for vegetarian couple like us. On 26th night they  cancelled the buffet dinner and told us to order according to our choice without a menu card,. being vegetarians we couldnt  order except paratha ,tomato soup,lemon juice,plain rice  and  curd. We were on a HALF BOARD  booking .Still  were  charged for  a simple lemon juice at the time of check out without any prior intimation while ordering. The front desk operators are not professional at all. They didnt regret or apologise for charging extra after explaining the fact that we didnt eat anything on that day due to less vegetarian choices of food.  Instead  the front desk staff kept a long face and cancelled the bill . All these happened during check out  . We were keeping our cool while explaining our bad experiences with them. But the staff didnt bother to send people to load luggages in our car. This is a great insult for us. We didnt expect this kind of behaviour for a bill of SLR 790 from a hotel like this. Our humble opinion is if you are a vegetarian who expect good  dining hall ambience kindly dont book this hotel in future.
title: THINK BEFORE YOU CHOOSE THIS HOTEL

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your review of Backwaters. we are so sorry for the difficulties you faced on your safari. the mistake was made by your local travel agent. They informed the hotel only one day before your arrival to book the safari jeep. by this time all jeeps were booked and we had to arrange a jeep to come from another entrance that is 80km away. we have informed this to you travel agent too. also, you were short of food packs because there were more persons in your jeep than the guest staying at Backwaters. For the extra persons, the travel agent has not ordered food. 
however, we are extremely sorry for the inconvenience during your travel to Backwaters. Please come again and you will not regret it.
placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Wilpattu National Park ,, Eluwankulam 19979 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Double check your booking before you arrive and check your food parcels before leaving for the day.
text:
We (6 adults) stayed here for 2 nights, which was long enough. 
The positives:- Although the accommodation is very basic and functional it is in a wonderful setting. There are short walks around the property and areas to relax along the river bank.  It is possible to hire a kayak and take a guided boat trip. The food was very nice although unfortunately, there was not much of it.
The negatives:- We had booked and paid for a full day safari several months previously but this did not happen. We were originally given several different excuses for this but it transpired that the safari jeep and guide had not been booked by the hotel until the day we arrived. Despite being told by the manager that we would not have to compromise, we were actually only out for half the time of the other guests and this was during the hotest hours of the day when most of the animals were seeking shade. The lunch supplied for this safari was poor to say the least.  We were advised the previous day that the lunches would would be very filling.  They were barely enough to feed a child with the chickpea lunch in particular being very small . One person was not supplied with any water so food and water were shared around the 6 adults as if we were on rations. 
The second day we had a morning safari with a packed breakfast. Upon opening the breakfast pack we found only 5 very small breakfast packs, yet there were 6 of us. So again, food was shared and we were again, all left feeling rather hungry.
In summary, this could and should have been a wonderful place to stay and experience Wilpattu. Sadly, it seems the place is poorly managed with little or no consideration for the guests experience.
title: Huge potential but poorly managed

ownerResponse/text: We are sorry you did not enjoy the stay at Backwaters. we are very close to the park. it is only 4 Km from the entrance to the hotel. we do not recall any guest complaining about the food. we are an eco-friendly hotel; all we do and say can be seen on our website and social media. anyhow please feel free to visit again so we can make sure you will have a better time with us.
