placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
Well, we booked a Nelum Suite there and stayed a night on the 6th of April 19. The only positive factors we saw at the hotel was; 
1. The location is absolutely beautiful & breathtaking
2. The room is architecturally well designed 
3. The staff helped us to visit Belilena Caves & Mannakethi Ella

We really don’t feel worth for spending our money at the hotel because;
1. Although they have mentioned it is a 5 star hotel in their FB page, it is not up to the 5 star hotel standards. Room amenities are not satisfactory. (They provide dental kit if only we requested, time to time we had to request milk & sugar to make tea, noticed that the pool was not properly maintained so didn’t even bother to use it) 

2.The condition of the road that lead to the hotel was terrible!! At the very beginning we were really worried about selecting this hotel for our stay just because of the road as it was damn so broken. If you really concern about your vehicle please don't go there by your own vehicle! 

3.I don't think that the staff is helpful for Local visitors, and if you go their, just BB basis is enough as you can order a light meal at night for a cheaper price than going on HB basis. – Difference between BB & HB is more than 5000LKR (after 20% discount). We went for HB basis and we were not happy with our dinner menu as it included a soup, nasiguran with an onion sambol & ice cream with pieces of peach - they had 2 dinner menus. That dinner was not tasty and not up to 5 start hotel food standards. 

We still feel that if we went there for BB basis, we could have ordered something else for a lesser price & as of our wish. When we asked them whether we could change our stay for BB basis and order something light for dinner, (around 4:30PM) they just said Can’t! 

Should mentioned that we were Okay with their western breakfast but they only sent us the Fruit Juice (which is normally included in the Western Breakfast) only after we requested!!

We are not really happy about our stay at Palmstone Retreat because we still feel that we could have spent that money for a stay at some other place. They just focus on treating well for foreigners but not for Sri Lankans. But their Rooms, view from the room is awesome. The room rate is a bit higher than you would normally expect, and that’s because of the rating they get from the foreigners (& of course they treat them well).

Palm Stone did not live up to it's promised standards & that was our first & the last visit for the hotel for sure!!
title: Not worth spending your money for a stay at Palmstone Retreat!

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text: We visited the Palmstone Retreat for our anniversary.  White the property is modern and new, it lacks character, in fact it doesn't have a character.  For a place so remote, the hotel should be equipped with movies and books to feel at home, which it doesn't.  The location is stunning, but very remote, hence the need for things to do if one decides to stay in the property.  The staff is untrained and they accept being sub par.  They are super nice, and that does make up for it.  The food is surprisingly very good.  But I don't think we will come back.
title: Highly Disappointing

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed here for 2 nights  and it was booked through our tour operators. The idea is that you go rafting and see a cave and stay here in order to access these adventures. 
If you can't do any of these things then prepare yourself for a long boring stay. When we arrived the river was too low and all it did was rain. 
The location of this hotel is up a long and quite treacherous track. It's not signposted and so quite difficult to find. The journey up this hill will take about 45 mins. 
There is quite literally nothing here. No walks or any trips you can take or are offered from the hotel. The guests here were roaming around like caged animals. 
Don't bother coming.  Move on with your trip. 
Even the rafts at the rafting place looked old and battered. I wasn't 100% convinced by the outfit.
Oh yeh and no alcohol!!!! Brilliant.
title: Like a prison

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
We booked Palm Stone to celebrate our wedding anniversary because we read all the good reviews and were looking forward to spending our "second honeymoon" in a special place. Unfortunately it did not meet our expectations. At most I would give this property 2/10. The score of 2 is earned because of;
1 - The location is beautiful and breathtaking
2 - The room is well designed (though not very functional)

Marks were deducted because;
1 - We booked directly with the hotel because we had never stayed at this location before and wanted to make sure that the hotel could arrange a 4WD for us to access the hotel from the closest town. At this point we informed the sales representative (who insisted on calling us "dear guest" even after the initial correspondence where they could have seen our name) that we would be celebrating our anniversary and were looking for an intimate getaway. The sales person assured us that special arrangements would be made and that we could dine in our room at our "Private Dining Table", but when we checked in there were absolutely no welcome amenities. Forget rose petals and candles, there wasn't even a dining area in the room and we ended up eating at the coffee table in front of the TV. How romantic!

2. The journey up to the hotel is quite treacherous, even in a 4WD. We strongly recommend that you wait at least an hour after eating to travel up that road unless you want your lunch to make a second appearance.  

3. The cleanliness of the room is not up to standard. The sofa and the bed-end stool both were covered in food crumbs when we checked-in.

4. The staff are very pleasant, but need to be trained. Especially on things like room allocation. At the point of booking, we selected the "Araliya Suite" because it appeared to be the most secluded room, but we ended up next to a group of young boys looking for a weekend of disturbing the peace. They were in the interconnecting room and for some reason insisted on cutting across our path when heading to the river, which meant they could gawk in to our room through the picture window. They also played loud music right throughout the afternoon and we had to complain to the reception twice to get them to turn it down. 

5. Lack of privacy was a major factor for us on this trip. We were looking forward to using the plunge pool, but there are no tats or blinds that can be used to cover it so with the neighbors we had, we could not enjoy the plunge pool. 

6. The bathroom was nice and spacious but not maintained. Also the toilet tissue was sopping wet when we checked in and the hot water is only good for the first 10 minutes of your shower. 

7. The food was OK, but nothing to write home about. Naturally we asked for all meals to be served in our room, and when dinner came we were surprised to see the starter and the main accompanied by dessert ( which was ice cream). We ended up having two soups that night. one hot and one melted mess.

8. We didn't really feel that this property offed us value for money. The room rate is a bit higher than you would normally expect, and Palm Stone did not live up to it's promised standards. 

In conclusion, we had high hopes for this hotel and they were not met. Judging by the other reviews, it must be a good location in general, but it is not the ideal place to spend one's anniversary.
title: Far Below Expectations

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thanks so much for taking the time to write a review.The hotel locations is bit adventures,anyways it's nice to hear that our staff made your stay memorable.

Thanks & Regards
Palmstone Retreat
placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
We recently stayed one night at the Palm Stone Retreat and we were very disappointed. Although the Retreat appears to be a boutique sanctuary it falls very far short of the mark.

The Palmstone Retreat lies approximately 5km from the main road (there are no sign posts on the main road so we had difficulty finding the correct turning from the main road). The condition of the road to the Retreat is so bad that our driver was unable to take us. The road in and out is little more than a dirt track and, quite frankly, is  dangerous. We were informed by the staff at the Retreat that due to the amount of customer complaints about the road they are now planning to build a more substantial road but this won't be finished for a long time, I believe. 

On top of that, the hotel does not serve alcohol, although this isn't mentioned on their website. The rooms, although spacious, were dirty i.e. cobwebs and spiders in the shower and not well maintained i.e. the condensation on the windows obscured any view of the river the room may have had and made the room feel damp. 

The only positive part of the one night stay is that the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful but regardless, the Palmstone Retreat was a low point of our trip to Sri Lanka and we would not recommend it.
title: Very Disappointed

placeInfo/address: 322 Udugama Ampitiya Rd, Ampitiya 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don't book your room in old wing.
text:
Subject: Complaint Regarding Stay on 23rd January 2025

I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding my recent stay at your hotel on the night of 23rd January 2025. The experience was far from satisfactory and did not meet the standards expected from a property of your reputation.

1. Room Issues:

Upon check-in, we were assigned Room 3011 in the old wing. Unfortunately, the bathroom flush was not working, and the basin was choked. Despite reporting these issues, it took two maintenance staff half an hour to inspect and inform the reception about a room change. After 12 hours of travel, this ordeal at 11:00 PM was extremely inconvenient and disruptive.

2. Breakfast Service:

The breakfast experience on the morning of 24th January 2025 was equally disappointing. The restaurant had only 10-15 guests, yet none of the staff was willing to attend to us. The unprofessional attitude was shocking, and we had to call the restaurant manager to ensure we received service. It was evident that the staff prioritized serving foreign guests, displaying blatant disregard for others.

3. Lack of Management Response:

Despite continuous complaints, the hotel manager never approached us to address the situation. The front desk staff and another individual repeatedly apologized without offering any meaningful resolution.

4. Positive Experience:

One staff member, Rayandu (apologies if the name is misspelled), at your restaurant, stood out for her exceptional service. As vegetarians, she went above and beyond to ensure we had suitable dining options.

5. Feedback to Travel Agent:

We had booked our stay through a travel agent, and based on this disappointing experience, we will be informing them to never recommend your hotel to anyone in the future.

Overall Feedback:

Poor room maintenance

Unprofessional and biased restaurant staff

Lack of effective management intervention

Not worth the price

This experience has left me deeply disappointed, and I feel it is necessary to bring these issues to your attention so they can be addressed. I expect a formal response and an explanation regarding the above concerns.

Sincerely,
Nishith Mehta
title: Poor room maintenance,  Unprofessional and biased restaurant staff, Lack of effective management intervention.

placeInfo/address: 322 Udugama Ampitiya Rd, Ampitiya 20000 Sri Lanka
text: We had some change of plans and decided as it was Christmas eve to splurge out at £350 for one night at the Golden Crown Hotel. I do not usually go for large chain hotels as I think the personal touches can be lost and it ends up feeling too co-corporate, however we thought we would give it a go. First impressions were lovely - there was a warm welcome by the concierge team, and the Christmas tree was beautiful. From there on, it all went down hill. The room was OK - marks on the wall, mini bar not stocked or working, noise of TVs from other rooms but we were not planning on staying in the room that much, so why grumble - it was just for one night. We arrived to the pool - great views and very comfy loungers; we were very happy. We asked for a drink and prices were fairly reasonable given where we were, which was a nice surprise. 1 hour later a drink arrives that was incorrect, but not an issue and was changed. We then ordered some food and the wrong food came out and was also an hour after we ordered - the staff were polite but trying to get us to eat the food we were being served. As a vegetarian, I am not going to eat a Caesar salad I did not order. We were then told we could not have the salad as they did not have the ingredients. My partners food arrived but with no cutlery for half hour and trying to find someone, the food went cold. We decided to leave the idea of food and retreat back to the room to get ready and try the dinner instead, after all, it is Christmas eve. The buffet was a huge carnage with people running everywhere but the quality of the buffet food was good. there was no room to sit inside so we were ushered outside, and met with bird poo all over our table. The waiter did come and remove it but would not replace the table cloth, so we were left with lots of smears around our cutlery. The next morning we tried to get bags collected and there was a delay and reception put the phone down on me several times when I was trying to explain what we required. I tried to get some money changed and the rate was much higher than other hotels we had changed money so we did not bother. I did raise these concerns to the manager, and was met with an apology. Apology was appreciated but I will never come back to this hotel or this chain again. Looks are deceiving and they have lost touch with the personal touches and services, relying on those who can afford to stay there to just pay the money - this hotel definitely has tourists in their eye sight to over charge and take advantage of.  We have stayed in Sri Lanka for 21 nights, and this was the most expensive hotel and worst by a long way. Choose the smaller boutique hotels and save your money whilst getting better services.
title: TERRIBLE Experience - Exploiting naïve Tourists with what Luxury should be

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: 322 Udugama Ampitiya Rd, Ampitiya 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid this hotel. I would say they are more concerned with all the weddings they have there
text:
Whilst on a tour of Sri Lanka my friend and I  stayed for 2 nights at this hotel. 
We found the food to be extremely disappointing. Whilst the display looked inviting actually trying to eat the food proved to be quite a challenge. Almost without exception the food was either cold and then put onto cold plates or had been left under the lights and completely dried out. 
I wasn’t prepared to complain but the restaurant manager came and asked us if everything was okay. We told him of our concerns and he brought out the sous chef. The main chef was on holiday. 
He and I walked around the buffet and I pointed out the issues I had. He was in total agreement. 
I also explained that the boiled eggs at breakfast were cooked until virtually black inside. The next morning without ordering 2 boiled eggs arrived on the table and they were virtually raw. 
On  the first night my friend and I went to bed at 21.30 hr as we had had a long tiring day travelling. The guests in the next door room were having a party / rave and had their room door open. The noise was unbearable. My friend phoned reception and asked them to address the issue. A lovely young man came up and asked them to close their door. Obviously the noise was then concentrated in our room. 
I phoned reception and was told it would be passed to the duty manager. Some time later we heard a knock at the door of the room next door and subsequently the music was turned down. Some time later the duty manager spoke to my friend on the phone and said we could recontact him if there were further problems. 
The people then moved to the room on the other side of ours and began again. We decided not to recontact the reception and it stopped at 23.30 hours. 
On mentioning this on checking out the receptionist just shrugged her shoulders.
Customer service does not appear to be a priority at their hotel for sure
title: Disappointing stay

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Firstly, let me apologize if you were inconvenienced during your stay with us. I have been corresponding with your Travel Agent on this incident. 

Housekeeping staff do enter guest rooms for cleaning and turndown service. As mentioned to your Agent, no staff member had entered the room the night of your arrival. If the Agent had informed us that no one is to enter the room for any reason, we would have notified the relevant departments. We however, need to enter and check if any mini bar etc. has been used before the departure of the guest. 

As you mentioned, the money was placed in your backpack, which was not stored in the in-room safe. An in-room safe is provided in all rooms for guests to store their valuables. This is practiced by all reputed hotels in the world and our staff educate the guests on arrival and also have mentioned this on the key card pouch that the hotel cannot be liable for any losses, if not stored in the safe. 

We however hope that you have enjoyed our facilities during the short time you spent with us and hope that you will return. 

The Golden Crown Team.
placeInfo/address: 322 Udugama Ampitiya Rd, Ampitiya 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
During our visit to Sri Lanka, we stayed at The Golden Crown Hotel for just one night on August 2nd. Unfortunately, our experience was marred by a serious issue. After checking in around 6:30 pm, we settled into our room and left to explore the hotel. Later that night, before going to bed, I realized that $200 was missing from my wallet. Initially, I thought I might have misplaced it, so I gave the remaining money to my husband, who counted it and stored it in his wallet, which he then placed in his backpack instead of the room’s safe.

The next morning, after spending about an hour at the pool, my husband checked the money again and found that we were now missing another $100. It became clear that someone had entered our room during our absence and taken the money. We immediately reported the incident to the receptionist. Despite not requesting any cleaning services, when hotel management reviewed the security footage, it showed a cleaner entering our room after we had left for the pool, staying for more than a minute, and leaving without cleaning anything. When questioned, the cleaner claimed he was checking for an electricity issue, which we had never reported.

I was shocked to learn that hotel staff are allowed to enter guests' rooms without their request. The general manager’s explanation that it is standard policy for cleaners to check rooms did little to alleviate our concerns. We were deeply disappointed by the handling of this situation.

While I don't want this incident to tarnish the hotel’s overall reputation, I strongly advise future guests to be vigilant about their belongings and use the in-room safe at all times. Unfortunately, it seems that both the cleaning staff and upper management cannot be fully trusted at this hotel.
title: I strongly advise future guests to be vigilant about their belongings and use the in-room safe at all times.

placeInfo/address: 322 Udugama Ampitiya Rd, Ampitiya 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel is modern, has comfortable big rooms, a well-appointed gym, and a lovely spa. But I had such an appalling encounter at the restaurant that I would never return and could not in good faith advise anyone, especially a woman, to stay here. I can only think that the positive reviews on this site are from hotel employees themselves.

My booking included the breakfast buffet and when I went to eat on my first morning at the hotel, I was told I could not enter dressed as I was (shorts and a sleeveless shirt). There was no written dress code anywhere in the materials provided by the hotel and I was not informed of any dress code at the time of check in. I asked the hostess what the rules are so I could go change accordingly -- but she and another employee named Ajith just kept repeating that I was showing "too much skin." During this ten minute encounter, a man also in shorts walked past me and none of the staff said anything to him, making me believe that I was singled out for being a woman. I repeatedly asked the restaurant staff what the guidelines actually are for the breakfast buffet and they could not tell me, yet they would not let me enter (despite allowing similarly dressed guests to enter freely). After returning to my room to change into a long dress and jacket, I was allowed to enter, albeit with many dirty looks from the staff. Upon entering, it was clear that men and women alike dressed in shorts or sleeveless tops were allowed to enter, only I was not.

As I tried repeatedly to explain to the staff during this encounter, having rules and a dress code is of course absolutely understandable -- but this should be communicated to guests in advance so they can act accordingly and it should be applied fairly to all guests across the board.

It was an extremely upsetting and unsettling encounter and certainly made me feel as though I was being treated differently than other guests, despite paying for my room and board the same as they did. I would never return to such an establishment and would advise others, particularly women, to avoid it as well.
title: Horrible customer service

Thank You!

ownerResponse/text:
Hi,
This is the first complaint we received of a similar nature (except for the same content shared by your team).

We would like to convey our gratitude for choosing The Golden Crown Hotel as your favorable holiday destination. As the prominent five-star Hotel in Kandy, we always strive to deliver the best level of service with proper standards. Despite the incident you mentioned here that we don't allow you to take food from the buffet to your rooms, considering the mentioned situation, I personally involved myself and allowed you to bring foods from the buffet. For all Guests that step into the hotel, we have introduced the same standard that they are not allowed to take food from the buffet to their rooms in order to maintain hotel standards, and that's why we are having a separate a la carte menu be offered. If you felt unprofessional with regards to this incident, I'm sorry for the inconvenience caused, and the required implementations will be taken to enhance our service standards.

Regarding the corkage charges, the restaurant has accurately confirmed (referring to CCTV footage) the number of bottles that you brought to the restaurant, and there are no additional charges imposed on you. As the best five-star Hotel in Kandy, we are maintaining our standards by treating guests in a standard way where we cannot break rules for one set of guests.

We are sorry for the inconvenience caused, and we will take the required measures to avoid these issues. and looking forward to welcoming you back at The Golden Crown Hotel, assuring you of a truly magical experience.

Thank You!

Warm Regards!

text:
We checking 14 pax group with 1 foreigner. Half board. We had a worst experience compare to other hotels in Kandy. Zero customer friendly unprofessional management. 

1. Customer is not informed the hotel policies before checkin or pay. For example: they will charge you for makeup reasons like if you hangout with your friends around the pool area with soft drink, without pre informing at the premises they will charge you cocage 5000/= LKR when you are checking out . Make sure the call or email and make sure where are the places you can hangout with friend from Maleesha who is the responsible person for this. 

2. They charge you cocage 5000/= per wine bottle if you drink near the restaurant area which is insane, because the bottle price also less than their cocage charge. 

3. One of our friend sick during the stay, he couldn’t make to the dinner buffet, we asked the restaurant to serve a bawl of soup and a piece of bread to her room, then the manager of the restaurant Mr. Ruzzel and Mr.Ravi said they are charging for the service which is out of humanity. No hotel will do that to a human.

4. The restaurant is under staff, used planted are not removed from the table even we asked them to do (images are attached) 

5. Make sure to double check the bill when you checkout, they will charge you for unused services. 

6. Two team members was in the room number 4020, there was a renovation on room 4021 and loud noise and disturbances. Hotel should not arrange rooms for guest near renovation area, they even know what is mean by hospitality. Hotel should hire educated staff.

7. There are only 5 channels available in the television, and no proper view to enjoy from the balcony. 

8. Unprofessional customer handling , worst worst hotel experience.
title: Unprofessional and inhumanity management

placeInfo/address: Habarana 50150 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Get bathrooms refurbished
text:
I booked with hotel directly via their website over a month before stay.
I received confirmation and some auto-messages before arrival.
When I arrived to the hotel, then my reservation could not be found.
I presented email and printed copy and hotel still pretended that they could not find it. First they mentioned that they are full booked, then offered me the same room in almost double the price.
Finally, after over an hour of forth and back, they offered us a room, but still could not decide at what price.
As it was almost 9pm, I had no choice, but take it.
Finally, I was charged with the initial amount, but points for stay have never been credited.

Hotel is old, bathroom is so-so and pool was probably not cleaned for looong time.
Shower was leaking from shower to all of bathroom - floor was tilted in wrong way (construction error).
Swimming pool gave us skin irritation for several days - we could see that water was not transparent. Unfortunately we realized only during the following day and we could not see it previous evening.
Internet connection is either good or unusable - without any reason.
Restaurant is very good, though.
I cannot believe that this is top 3 rated hotel in area.
title: Cannot believe the other hotels, if this is the best in Habarana

text: Отель уже староват. В номере всего одна европейская розетка, и то не около кровати! Сервис плохой. Бассейн грязноватый, матрасы на лежаках в пятнах. Питание очень скудное и простое. Кроме риса и фруктов есть практически нечего. Остальное либо совсем невкусно, либо очень острое! Территория отеля большая, но не очень ухоженная. Оставила в номере стабилизатор для телефона на зарядке. Вечером приезжаю, а он сломан! Неправильно закрыт, весь скручен, перекручен. Я так понимаю, что уборщику в номере было очень интересно, что это за "зверь". Подхожу на ресепш, и жду главного менеджера, для решения вопрос. Выходит дама плотного телосложения. Я рассказываю ей ситуацию, плачу, а она мне очень нагло, надменно и с улыбкой отвечает: "а как вы докажете, что это не вы сломали?" Долго разговаривать с этой женщиной я не стала. Она просто смеялась мне в лицо и говорила: "Докажите". Ничего не попытавшись выяснить и сделать для меня. Никому не рекомендую отель с таким отношениям к отдыхающим. Так из номера может пропасть и сломаться, что угодно.
title: Испортили вещь!

text:
A place in Sri Lanka that once held a special place in my heart has left me thoroughly disappointed following a recent visit. During a work trip, I had an important meeting scheduled from 11 am to 12:30 pm. To ensure a smooth day, I requested a late checkout, which the front desk kindly approved.

However, my meeting was constantly interrupted by calls from the office. Despite confirming my late checkout and prior notifications, representatives from customer relations kept calling to discuss my departure time. This unexpected level of disruption, especially from a company I've been loyal to, has left me disheartened. I had hoped for better treatment, given my loyalty.

If this disappointing standard of guest service continues, I'll have to explore other options for my future visits.
title: A Once-Favorite Spot Fails to Meet Expectations

Dear Value Guest
Greetings from Habarana Village by Cinnamon,

Thank you for your great review, and please know how much it means to us here at Habarana Village. We go out of our way to offer our visitors with the greatest service possible, and it always brightens our day when a client appreciates it.

placeInfo/address: Habarana 50150 Sri Lanka
text:
The setting is magnificent (garden, trees and forest on the edge of a lake) and some of the bungalows overlook this landscape.
The rooms are pleasant, depending on the category 
The real disappointment is the atmosphere and the food.
The atmosphere is that of an 'all-inclusive resort' where an international clientele mingles morning, noon and night over characterless “all-you-can-eat” buffets in a restaurant laid out like a 'giant canteen'.
Although I've travelled a lot, and I am familiar and ok with usual international buffets, I've never seen such a repulsive mega-gigantic buffet, with all kinds of international or "simili-local" cuisine adapted to a more or less wealthy tourist clientele. 
For me it's a disgrace on two counts:
- firstly, it's really indecent to offer such an infinite choice, even for a varied and well-to-do clientele, in a fairly poor country where the waiters must be embarrassed by such waste! We spend almost more time browsing the buffet than we do eating. I can't imagine the mountains of rubbish after each meal. Nobody needs that !!!
- Secondly, by focusing on mega-quantity, they forget about quality. You can mix just about anything and everything (fruit, curry, pizza, pasta, pancakes, meat, starches, vegetables, spices, eggs, imitation cheeses, 1001 desserts, 1001 appetisers...) and in the end you end up with a plate that's full but tasteless, as none of these meals are cooked properly or with talent. I really missed the good, more intimate hotel restaurants where a chef would offer you a limited but elaborate and tasty menu. And despite this, people crowd around the dishes as if they were going to run out of something! Horrible. 
You feel like a pig being force-fed for lunch and dinner. So, only for those who like to eat without thinking and feel they're getting quantity instead of quality for their money. But some types of tourists like it (especially Russians, Chinese and Americans).
For normal tourists, this type of catering is shameful and is everything I'm running away from.
title: All-you can eat Touristic resort

roomTip: Lake view rooms
text:
This is a review of how Habarana Village discriminate and mistreat the local Sri Lankan guests in a pathetic way....!!!
During the holidays in the last few months, we were booked and staying in different hotel chains. During the last weekend ( 12th -13th Sep 2020) we booked at Habarana Village expecting to have a relaxing peaceful weekend. One of our main purpose of bookings to support the local hospitality industry that has been badly affected by the current local Corona Pandemic and on top of that due to foreigners who don’t visit Sri Lanka for so many months. 
When we arrived at the hotel, the reception was deserted and there was only one person on the desk to do the check-in functions. There was no proper welcome process and after some time we were just directed to our rooms. We had to go and find our rooms on our own. That was one of my relatives’ 4th visit to the hotel but there was no recognition at all.
Then we went to have our meals at the hotel restaurant. To our utter shock, the food serving waiters were serving food to us treating as if we were a set of beggars waiting in line to beg for a free meal. The food was not nicely served to the plates, instead just throwing the items all over the plate on top of the served food. 
After we sat down to eat, halfway through one of us requested a hand wash finger bowl of water from a waiter on duty. The person snapped saying that the sink and tap is available and we have to go to the sink if we need to wash hands. This was said at a moment that we could see other tables were provided with hand wash finger bowls with water.  I have noted some other guests experienced the same as us and complaining to the staff and the management. 
Totally disgusted by the treatments received by us since the arrival to Habarana Village, we didn't have any other option but to stay at the hotel experiencing the mistreatment by the staff as we have had already fully paid in advance.
We have stayed at many Sri Lankan and foreign country hotel chains and out of all this was our worst and disgusting experience ever....!!!!
We were really disappointed staying at  Habarana Village because it's a total waste of our hard-earned money to get so much discrimination treatment as guests at this place.
During our stay, we didn’t experience any positive side other than the nice and calm surroundings. 
Also, we are not expecting any, meaningless apology messages because all of you have cheated on the valuable guest by mistreating the guest so much, and it's beyond repair....!!!!!
title: discriminate and mistreat the local Sri Lankan guests

placeInfo/address: Habarana 50150 Sri Lanka
text:
Usually a star class hotel provides a star class buffet. ¬¬Full board charges and service were all same for both local and foreign travelers. 
Recent pandemic caused blockage of foreign travelers from visiting hotels and paved the path for hotel management to make money only from local tourists. Only path for hotels to pay wages for staff and avoid hotels from being closed was to make money from locals with attractive offers. So they started advertising same packages offered to foreigners at very eye catching discounted rates. 
It’s highly misleading and “Habarana Village” provided us with a great example on why it’s a scam. Here are few quotes from employees when inquired about certain incidents which took place during our stay.
“Sir, the management has decided to minimize the items of buffet due to the pandemic(corona)”
“madam, shall I offer you more curry along with the piece of fish?”
“Sir, grill has been limited only for fish”
“We have two flavors of ice cream”
“Sir, if you don’t have a functioning AC facility in your room I shall send the repairing guy.” (it took nearly an hour at 10pm after dinner to get a room to lay down. They started pumping GAS to AC at 10.05PM)
There are absolutely ZERO options for vegetarians except for hoppers and pittu. No Paneer – No cashew or mushrooms. NOTHING!
You should visit Habarana Village if you are expecting to see or get served by a staff member who keeps a grilled pork loin to himself and gives you slight pieces of Pork to you like he is cutting his own body. It’s like they are on a mission to save more food in freezers or visitors for dining them. Haha (I know about the quarantine rules about them being served by staff – BUT they serve you like you can’t eat)  
You can hear plenty of excuses from staff members on why certain things are not provided or some foods are not available (they will tell it’s due to COVID but it’s a huge damn lie). They clearly have minimized most of their items from usual package and offering a third class service offering. Sometimes we could see them being speechless about certain things. It clearly indicated that top management has given them strict order to minimize service to make profit. 
With the prevailing situation it’s unclear whether when Sri lanka be open to foreign travelers. These hotels are trying hard to catch up until they reach here BUT I highly doubt of them losing their star level with third class service offering. 
If you are advertising again please advertise as “BUFFET WITH LIMITED OPTIONS and EXPECT EXCUSES”. 
If this is how locals are treated in a time like this, we are highly disappointed! I have been engaged in hospitality industry for about half a decade and I could sense how management has advised to cut off certain things. I have never left a review on trip advisor BUT this was a must. 

Only plus point were,
scenery and maintenance of garden was good
lifetylist made sure we get requested water bottles just within two mins upon calling

 (and staff members were helpless when it came to inquiring about limited buffet)
title: Service NOT as ADVERTISED! LIMITED BUFFET with POOR Vegetarian options , Poor Room service

roomTip: say no to Room No 409-416 & 101-108, they are behind  Staff Accom & Delivery Road u l Hv  noisy  night,
text:
The arrival welcome wasn't good, Security were not informed of our booking since the Front office didn’t had our Booking.
* From the car park we were forced to bring in our won Baggage no help was offered, even though the Hotel was only 30 % occupied. . 
* 1st Night bed turn down wasn't done and completely ignored 
* We were on time for breakfast on 28th Feb, the Coconut water had been available but the jar was empty, we ask 3 personal (Action Egg Chef/ A waiter and a Dining Room Supervisor) but no one was interested to serve us Coconut water which is very Common in Sri Lanka, when we made the complain the ( Sous Chef/ F&B Manager ) both said that they were unaware of our request. Which shows that the communication of such simple request is not filter down to the relevant personal. So we booked the second 28th Feb only Room Only
* When requested for Tea from a dining room supervisor offers us Made up TEA ??? WHY would I go to a 4-star Hotel to be served a Made up Tea, instead I should go to a road side boutique for such a Service. 
*The toilet Shower floor was dirty and when made a request to clean the same, the Housekeeping supervisor said that IT is clean and the white stains are from the Wax they have applied to the floor, but for our surprise it is not all over the floor and except near the Gully area, (Plz refer the photos)
* The Shower control is not working when you shower water coning from both drip tap and from the shower so the water presser was very low, this was brought to the Front Office Manager s Notice but nothing was done.  
* Our room only had one Veranda Chair and made a request to the reception to have one, but it was never done so we couldn't sit out for a chat that night.( would you think this is call service this should have noticed when the Housekeeping is releasing room to Front Office staff but they even failed to do so once the guest himself point out the mistake they totally ignored 3 opportunities to correct them self )  
*Over all the attitude of the staff from top to bottom (Management to lower level) and facility for Sri Lankan s were bad, 
*The Hotel ill-treat the Local guest, the hotel only had 77 guest, and it’s around 33% Occupancy, and still they failed to provide some basic facility, 
*When I made the complain we were offered Free Take away sandwich for safari, Evening Snakes, even offer to bring in our friend s to the hotel for a corkage free drink, (we refused all of them as we were badly treated before our Complaint)  
*But on the first day when I request to bring in a Friend from outside we were strongly declined for the same, and were forced to purchase from the bar.
* The stray Dogs and cats were all over strolling around, when inquirer from a Staff member said the Managing Directors Sister is a Dog Activist and hence the management is not taking any action. And this shows that the Management is least concern about the safety of paying gust, The Dogs were seen near the main Dining hall pestering guest for Food. And in the public areas as well.       
* we wanted to see the Manager and was informed the Manager is not in and will meet Us next day,  but he was not bother to meet us , and was Ignorant not to Call us even though they had our Phone numbers  on Arrival ( Local No) neither he has try to contact us on E mail, further more he has not taken interest to write to us through the review which we had done on Bookings.com as we made this booking through Booking .com, He did not had the bone to face the truth or don’t care attitude, this whole situation could have avoided if he had communicated with us while we were there. 

Our short holiday was ruined and suggest that guest should be cautious when booking this property or any Cinnamon property in Sri Lanka, If the management is not have the time to reply to its guest concerns.. We made a post on the properties Face Book Page and it was removed by the management, so Please do not believe the Face book of the property as they only accommodate good reviews in its FB Page. 
Only good thing at the  property was the Pool, and the Security Staff who was greeting Guest every time you drive past ... ( Plz refer the Photos)
title: Terrible... they Have even removed my Review from their Face Book Page

text:
We spent two nights at this lodge in January 2019. After reading the TripAdvisor reviews, my expectations were in line with what to expect.
First let me mention that the lodge grounds are beautiful! A very serene atmosphere. The breakfast and dinner food buffet is great! Location is excellent!!
Now to some of the areas that might require improvement:
1. We had three rooms - all had a terrible moldy stench - in order to overcome the terrible smell we kept the A/C, ceiling fan and bathroom exhaust fan running on full speed the entire stay,
2. Instead of one king size bed we had two single beds - the mattresses were very old and poor quality - you sank in the mattress.
3. The room is a nice size! the bathroom is a bit crowded in comparison to the room size
4. They are stingy on amenities - I had to repeatedly request additional shampoo and shower gel as well as extra towels. 
5. I think that they made a mistake by not placing the lodges viewing the lake!
6. Spa prices are extremely high - even higher than what I pay in a western country where the cost of living is much higher - very regrettable!
In summary, I cannot recommend these accommodations! The most important thing is that you can get a good nights sleep, this was not possible due to the smell and mattresses.
title: Not a 5 star Lodge

placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
What can I say.... Booked with Mercury, took a while to get the tickets confirmed but all done and sorted. Did a private transfer from the airport to the hotel and arrived about 8am where they sorted a room for us. Got some sleep for a few hours as all inclusive was from noon. 
Great location although the beach has been washed away. Pool attendants, Sarath, are great and pool bar staff, Dinal, very friendly with both giving great service. Room attendant, Udayagna, left towel crafted animals which was a quality touch. 
Music in the bar is woeful and is an area that needs improving, play local music not attempts at old English songs that just sound badly dubbed. 
Food was great for the first 5 days then it went rapidly down hill with the menu having inconsistency such as Mexican rice with no Mexican food or no meat available because it needed to have more cooked!
I raised issues with the Manager of Food and Beverage called Nirshana and was very pleasantly surprised that he took all of our concerns onboard and not only fixed them but excelled in carrying out improvements along with inviting us to the Japanese restaurant one night and having a great keema mata made another. Fantastic leader and he is the main reason why this is not a one star review. 
The main problem really was the construction work going on with no notice! Lorries rolling in and delivering huge stones with JCB and crane laying them. Huge booms like bombs and dust all over! Went on for over a week so zero peace and quiet. I spoke to Ashan and Chamodi about the issues but all they wanted to do was give me a suite or something else to appease, I accepted a bottle of wine and my laundry done for free to assist with the inconvenience. They failed to grasp the fact they did not communicate this to anyone not even their own staff. They purely blamed the government but it is not the governments responsibility to inform Hotel guests about building work going on. It is the hotels responsibility to inform our travel company who can inform us as per the ABTA code of conduct for major works. The minister for tourism had visited many weeks before so they knew this was going to happen. 
Absolutely essential they improve in this area as this is key to good customer satisfaction. 
Overall this could be a great place and equal to 5 stars but they need to run a series of improvements to get back to where they should be. 
Recommendations are listen to the guests and don't treat them as commodities but as people, yes it's important to balance cost benefit and customer satisfaction but in the right way such as 10 point NPS.
title: Needs improving and communication is woeful!

placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
Trip started well but sadly Hotel is let down badly by Management and their poor communication.
It is true that gardens became a building site in second week and this overshadowed the excellent Service in the main. There was no warning of the arrival of the JCB’s and Trucks from Management and this was, in my opinion, a serious dereliction of duty.
The resultant dust caused an exacerbation of my asthma symptoms and this absolutely could have been avoided. When I pointed this out to Customer Relations and Management they didn’t seem interested or even willing to offer a satisfactory apology.
I was just glad I wasn’t hospitalised given the conditions, it was a close call.
There was no area cordoned off and trucks were in danger of causing trees to fall over area with sunbathers, it defied belief, the level of incompetence knows no bounds.
Hotel also Managed to lose our room
key (comment from Reception was “let us know if you have lost any valuables”) and spoil our Anniversary Meal (poor experience in A-La-Carte Restaurant), Customer Relations offered very little in compensation, they begrudgingly acknowledged problems but received no proper apology. Management communication on the topic was non-existent, will be pursuing proper compensation through Mercury Travel.
title: Serious Health Warning

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Jean,

Thank you for your feedback and for sharing your concerns regarding the recent disturbances at our hotel. We understand the frustration caused by the erosion of the beach area due to adverse weather conditions.

We want to assure you that we are actively working to address the situation in collaboration with the Sri Lankan Government's Coastal Conservation Department. The measures being implemented aim to protect not only our hotel but also the entire beach area in Katutura. These efforts include reinforcing coastal defenses to mitigate the effects of erosion and safeguard local establishments facing similar challenges.

As discussed during our meeting, we sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused. It's important to note that the erosion resulting from adverse weather conditions is a natural disaster beyond our control. Nevertheless, we take your feedback seriously and are committed to minimizing disruptions in the future.

Your loyalty to our hotel is deeply appreciated

Warm regards,
The Hotel Managment
placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don’t book this hotel if you don’t want HGVs and JCBs ruining your peaceful holiday
text:
Can you imagine relaxing on your sun lounger when suddenly a constant stream of heavy trucks, JCBs, diggers, diesel fumes, crashing boulders and plumes of dust appear ALL DAY from 7.45 until  8 pm? Just under your balcony waking you up in the morning? The trucks are unloading massive boulders because the sea has encroached on their land. There is NO BEACH. This is not a beach hotel.
The noise and the dust is terrible. It was so bad that the restaurants lowered their plastic blinds to prevent the plumes of dusts entering their building. Huge deafening crashes throughout the day as the trucks unload. Even drove past us while we were eating in the restaurant in the evening ! The noise!! The fumes!

Complained 4 days ago at reception- nothing was done. Emailed- ignored again. Met with management- said they’d get back to us. They didn’t. Eventually spoke to Ashan de Silva and Dharani Sivam. They did not accept ANY responsibility and offered no solution. Could not explain why they had ignored our repeated complaints. They claimed no one else complained. We know of many other guests who are outraged at the disruption and really upset by the constant noise.
They have been ignored too.  Dharni Sivan told us to complain to the Sri Lankan Government! Have you ever heard such nonsense? 

So our honest advice would be not to book this hotel. If something goes wrong the management will not put matters right. Do you want to risk that on your holiday? We stayed here nearly two decades ago and loved it. 

Such a shame that the management now are so unprofessional -  because the pool staff and the waiting on staff are excellent.
title: Ruined holiday !: Constant JCBs, trucks, diesel fumes, boulders crashing ALL DAY

placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Find another hotel away from the railway tracks and has a beach.
text:
This beach hotel does not have a beach. The train speeds by and usually the horn goes and starts around 6am. The main restaurant is like a canteen and the other 2 small restaurants you have to pay extra for. This is not a 5* hotel, perhaps a 3*.
Booked through Mercury who are happy to sell this as a beach hotel.
title: No beach.

placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Om 6u handdoeken leggen of geen parasol ter beschikking, geef je fooi maakt het niets uit dan zien ze je niet meer staan , all- in niet goed
text: Direct aan strand, spijtige zaak want het is weggespoeld. 1 glas rode of witte wijn bij maaltijd , 2de glas betalen rosé direct betalen . Speciale avond betalen , thema restaurant betalen, snacks betalen bv : frietjes 15,55 euro voor een portie . Buffet eentonig elke dag kip en vis en gebakken rijst . Showcooking was bami , lekker maar zeer pittig , we hadden prachtig weer en een goed bed . Wat we aten was oké . Tenslotte vakantie maak je zelf . Maar deze all-in is geen all- in en zeker geen 5 sterren waard . Onze kamerjongen chanaka was TOP . En onze uitstap met ruchi tours was ook weer af net zoals 2 jaar geleden. Dit hotel is geen aanrader
title: Geen 5 sterren waard

placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
Отель хороший,тянет на 5 звезд.крутой чел на ресепе при заселении требует заплатить ему хорошую сумму за номер.были в 205 номере.в одну прекрасную ночь проснулись от непонятных звуков,выглянул в окно и увидел полуголого индуса который как потом стало изв��стно забрался в соседний номер и украл у людей драгоценности пока они спали.уровень охраны 0.
Четыре полувялых охранника на большую территорию которых никогда нет.только после происшествия стали переодически для вида ходить.Для отеля 5 звезд иметь такую службу безопасности просто позор.Люди платят за отдых и безопасность,а их обворовывают прям в отеле и бонусом еще сотрудники клянчат деньги за оплаченный тобою номер.попрашайки и торгаши стоят прямо у маленького заборчика и караулят пока ты пойдешь на пляж.Даже гуляя по территории орут и предлагают экскурсии,одежду и т.д.готовы даже на оплату в рублях на какую-то московскую личность))))весь прикол в том,что охарнники с ними общаются как друзья(шутят,веселятся,братаются).крутая служба безопасности еще раз)))
Это все роняет уровень и статус отеля.
Почитал отзывы и увидел что в 2016году был точно такой же случай с воровством.
Кстати как потом узнал от пострадавших отель свою вину отрицает,никакой лояльности не применил.говорят надо все с себя снимать и в сейф убирать.А то что посторонний ползает по территории всем пофигу.
вообщем как в хостел заезжаешь только 5звездочный и за большую сумму денег)
title: Не советую

placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text: Начну с хорошего! Природа в Шри-Ланке изумительная! Океан красивейший! Главное не торопиться. В отеле красивая, продуманная, ухоженная, большая, территория. Планировка отеля с умом. Расположение номеров, максимально дистанцируют. Вид на море у большинства номеров. Бассейн огонь! И бар там есть и массаж и глубокий бассейн и волейбол и кольцо и лягушатник и даже мелкий заход. Лежаки и полотенца на территории бесплатны. Большинство персонала трудятся на 110%. В столовой имеются "контролеры", которые заряжают уставших официантов. Еда, всегда есть что поесть. Есть дни рыбы мяса и т.д. Ресторан при отеле (японский вроде) очень вкусно кормят, но за деньги. Дешёвый трансфер от отеля. Пляж... если сравнивать с Мальдивами то конечно скудный, но для купания в море самое то. Волны огонь! Главное рассчитать силы. Погода огонь! Анимация 3 штуки закольцованные как я понял. Фаер шоу, музыка типа битлз и элвис, и ещё какие-то по бодрее что-то играют. В общем для пенсии или спокойствия. Местные коктели(ром панч, куба либра) и пиво норм. Убирались в номере отлично(првда денег мы тоже норм давали). Теперь о минусах! 1) Работник ресепшена при заселении берет с вас 20$ за заселение в любой номер. 2) Сотрудники бассейна, рано утром занимают лежаки заготовленными книжками шляпами и книгами. Препятствуя людям которые приехали занимать лежаки на которых никого нет.  Видимо для тех кто или заплатил или просто по дружбе. И лежат эти предметы весь день и хорошо если кто-то пришел.3) Еда островатая... 4) Разводилы во всех местах! Начиная от отеля до границы с Индией! Ключевые фразы: "Where are you from","ты откуда","смотри крабик", "конечно помогу","Здраствуйте","У меня есть друг в России" и.т.д. в таком ключе. Все их добро сводиться к разводу на экскурсии или на кидок всего что у вас есть. Все там против вас! Мы для них белые и богатые, а они бедные и несчастные. Что даёт им делать то что недопустимо! Подводя к главной теме которая испортила весь отдых!!!!! 5)!!!Это как нас в номере 206 обнесли пока мы спали! Какой-то чел залез к нам на болкон 2ого этажа и ночью пока мы с женой спали. Украл мое обручальное кольцо, крест с цепочкой, деньги которые были не в сейфе. Коротко: Очень крепко спал так как разница времени. Жена будет в (00:45 примерно по их по нашему +2,5) и говорит, что на балконе шум, до этого там вороны клевали ммдемс который там оставили, я полу проснувшийся полу нет ничего не понимаю. Иду к балкону надевая шорты. Момент что в этот день свет за моим балконом и в проходе номеров не горел! Открываю занавеску и за секунду меня видит вор и прыгает с 2ого этажа и скрывается в темноте... Моё состояние не передать... Этот пассажир выкатил наш чемодан на балкон из номера и там искал хз что ещё.  Шурша пакетиком который мы купили на экскурсии приправ )))) От этого и проснулась жена. Мы позвонили на ресепшен. Я был с другом и его позвал, он был в шоке. Люди с ресепшена что-то записали и сказали что полиция утром приедет. Утром никто не приехал и мы сами поехали в полицию. Там нас выслушали или сделали вид. Потом полицейский с нами и работниками отеля приехал в отель. Мы попили смузи )) и ещё раз все рассказали... непонятно зачем? И только после нашей просьбы полицейские прошли в наш номер. И там они ничего не увидели. В камеры которые стоят в мёртвой зоне! Как раз под нашим балконом и проходом за территорию отеля ничего невидно. Мы пробовали доказать работникам отеля как вор мог убежать и даже показали так что-бы камеры не видели. Но работники отеля нам так и не помогли. Ссылаясь, что полиция всё проверила! Точнее тот дядька, который пил смузи и делал вид важного. И постоянно работники отеля и генералиссимус говорили, что кольцо которое ты снял должен класть в сейф даже если спишь рядом с ним. Вы серьёзно? А чемодан как туда положить? Спали мы потом с баррикадами на всякий. Фото и камер и проход выложу. По итогу я бы хотел предостеречь всех! От таки-же ситуаций. Всегда всё держите в сейфе! И будьте на чеку! Даже в 5 звёздочном отеле вы не застрахованы от такого. Это ещё хорошо что моя жена говорила на английским! Так бы работники отеля просто смеялись в лицо, как делали нам на слова что нас могли и убить! Кто знает кто залез к нам и какие мысли у него были. Я бы с радостью переиграл эту ситуацию... но что было то было. Будьте бдительны даже на отдыхе. Всем х��рошего отдыха! Спасибо за понимание. Может кому то пригодиться мой отзыв.
title: Как может быть на Royal Palms Beach Hotel Sri Lanka

text:

The grounds are nit tge cleanest....the pool is full of cracked tiles  (everywhere)  pool time to 10am -6 pm which is silly  tge drinks are nit good tge pool bar seats are loose...tge food was OK...the room balcony door had dodgy locks ..but sri lanka is safe. placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text: We were staying at this hotel for only 3 nights of our 2 week holiday in Sri Lanka and I think it was probably the worst hotel we stayed in. First of all the wifi does not work well at all. It works for a bit at times, but then disconnects itself and when you try to reconnect it takes about 40 minutes to connect. There is also a loud train that drives by right next to the hotel which woke us up several times throughout the nights which I understand is not the hotels fault, but just something to keep in mind if you’re considering staying here. The first day we had dinner in the buffet and we ate some chicken that was a bit pink but didn’t think much of it because sometimes you see pink near the bone, but the next day my dad was throwing up badly and I had never seen him sick like that before. My mum and I both had gotten diarrhoea and it just completely ruined the visit.  Then in the middle of the night we found a mouse eating our chocolate bar. The next day we were laying by the pool and the sun beds have handles that stick out the end of the beds which my mum tripped over and fell. The people next to us were very friendly and helped her out but it is not a good design, I am now writing this review 2 weeks later and her hands are still sensitive to put pressure on. Other than that, the workers are very friendly and they were always so kind to us. The pool was also very nice and big - probably the best part of the hotel in my opinion.
title: Raw chicken made us sick for the whole stay

placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Avoid talking to the strangers on the beach (non hotel staff).

If you are travelling with a guest with special needs or disability. Reconsider the hotel
text:
Unfortunately I have to say that this hotel needs a good refurbishment and not sure how it has maintained a 5 star status.

The family stayed here for 5 days throug 31 Dec 2021.

The main reason that I have given 3 stars is due to the amazing service by the waiting staff... Special mention to Dhanushka and Sanjeewa who look after the buffet restaurant meals.

It's a good hotel, in a great location.. Just requires some maintenance and better management. 
The NYE dance and arrangement was fantastic. 

Just some notes on what you can do to improve:

1) management - The manager (Thushara) at the restaurant is extremely abrupt in the way he speaks to guests and is very disrespectful in the manner which he speaks to the other staff in front of guests. No one deserves to be spoken to like that.

2) Food: The food has been very good. However, on the 1st of January (today) the buffet had left over food from lunch or previous day. Some of the starters, deserts and mainly the Pineapple curry was bad. I returned this to the waiting staff.

3) Cleanliness: Restaurant needs better flooring.  Always sticky and slippery. Specially the buffet area and the dessert area. 

4) Not abilities friendly: One person in my family has a disability and finds it hard to use the stairs. There is no easy was to get to the restaurant. No lift or ramp for a wheelchair / walking stick. You are forced to take the long route around the pool. 

No lighting and walking in darkness on an uneven surface and it's a much longer route. 
No shelter from the rain. 
Not good enough as it makes the persons life much harder.

In the rooms - There is only a bathtub with a half glass. The person with the disability is unable to use the showers. They simply cannot get into a bathtub and the half glass hinders any support that can be provided. 

5) Rooms: Rooms were having a damp smell and dusty.  Guessing this was due to no guests as a result of covid. However was good after the first room clean. The kettle in the room had a hole and was leaking, directly to the powerboard in the cupboard. 

6) Room toilets: Old plumbing that does no work well and is noisy when used. Needs maintenance desperately. And a reminder that the bathtub as the only option for a shower is inconvenient and does not help my family with disability or older guests. 

7) Animals on premises: There are stray dogs and cats on premises. The security runs behind them with a cane to hit them... Re think how you treat animals,. There are kids that feed the animals, only to see them getting chased and beaten??
title: Good hotel that desperately needs a refurbished and better management

placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text: I have been staying here since 5th April till 12th. Hotel is very beautiful by the sea. Amazing location with gardening. However, the food that I was given below average of compared to even local street foods. My lunch and dinner were given with previous day left over stuff few times. Disgusting responses by the F&B team for inquiries. Serious service quality improvements are required for guest in-room Dinning.
title: Beautiful hotel with Poor F&B

placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
I was staying in the hotel for over two weeks. Because we wanted to see most of the tourist attractions (all of them are far from the hotel but we knew that beforehand) we only treated the hotel as an accommodation. Hotel was ok, staff was very friendly although we were leaving a large tips. What we have noticed it's a lot of very poorly, infected cats around the dining area and pool. And we are aware that due to the religion they can not be look after but so many of them being sick and in the hotel premises is appealing. I have few photos of them but they are heartbreaking. Second thing is I left the winter coat in the hotel. I was in a hurry. It;s not a big deal- I've paid for that coat about 120 Euroes a week before that holiday and because I travel often (I've been in Sri Lanka twice since my visit) I could easly pick it up. I've realised that I left coat in the hotel during the transfer jurney from the hotel to the airport and the person- as my understanding is representative of the hotel promised it will get deliver to me as it's hotels fault that the person who came at the same time we were leaving haven't realised the missing item was left behind. Hotel response was that they found it but they have no car to arrange that 10 min. transport (as that far we were at the time from the hotel). I exchanged several messages with that person- hotel representative responsible to get us safe to the airport who was assuring me I'll receive coat back. I never did, instead I received several inappropriate messages from the same person which had nothing to do with the coat. As I mentioned before I could pick up coat easly after as I was in Sri Lanka twice since but noone responded to any of the email I've sent. I thought maybe I have the wrong email address but Tui confirmed its correct. It's a shame as I travel very often- visited over 40 countries; stayed in over 1000 hotels and I've never experienced such an ignorance and incompetence.
I almost forgot in order to reserve sunbed you have to get up at 5am unless you pay the staff to do it for you. Staff reserve them as soon as they start work so they can make extra money- for the 5 star hotels it's not only inappropriate but 
unprofessional too.
title: I definitely won't be staying in Royal Palms Beach Hotel again

placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text: Travelled with Mercury Travel for an all inclusive week. Arrived around 3 pm only to be told that we were too late for lunch but if we wanted something to eat, we would have to pay for it.  When we went to dinner we were told that you were only entitled to one small glass of wine - any more and you would have to pay £6 per glass.  Only one of the three restaurants is included in the “all inclusive” deal and that provided very poor quality food. Complained to the management but all they would offer was a food and drink upgrade if we paid $8 each per day. All inclusive it isn’t and shame on the hotel. To add insult to injury, the sandy beach is covered in oil!
title: All inclusive - I don’t think so

placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
All inclusive holiday Royal Palm Beach Kalutara
The first tour part of our holiday was excellent organised by Ceylon Roots hotel standards generally very good and itinerary excellent unfortunately the same could not be said for the Royal Palm Beach this was never a four and a half star hotel probably three plus and the all inclusive package is better described as all exclusive on arrival we were given a reception advising us what was included in our all inclusive package which in effect was virtually nothing other than local drinks and only one glass of one per person at dinner if a tomato juice was
required that was chargeable if you wanted to play pool or snooker chargeable of if you wanted to eat in the Japanese Restuarant or the Cabana all chargeable a mini bar was in the room again all chargeable on complaining to the Management we were upgraded certainly to a better room which could be described as four star we were also allowed a further two glasses of wine at dinner without charge, during one of our dinners we ordered our second glass of wine which duly arrived only to be taken away immediately by the waiter who informed us this was the chargeable variety which meant our general wine was low quality
title: All exclusive

placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
are here in royal palms for a 2 night stay. They say the property is 5 star...but i dont think it's a five star stay. Blankets were torn ...hair dryers had stains on it...floorings had sands stuck on it...room service took an hour to come by...rooms smelled very bad....bathroom latches were not working in one of the rooms...resort was very dark...coming to food part...there was no veg menu on the platter all non veg food plus best part was they did not have a tag as to what is veg and what is non veg...we have to ask someone whether this good is veg or non veg...one more thing...there was a hair found in our food and manager was laughing when we showed him...
Overall the place was not worth a visit.
title: Terrible

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued customer,
First of all let us tank you for selecting The kings Domain for your stay in Sigirita.

placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa,Sigiriya, Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
I had high expectations for Seerock based on the glowing reviews, but unfortunately, it turned out to be the worst hotel I’ve ever stayed in—despite booking a room with a jacuzzi.

The issues began even before we checked in. When we called ahead to confirm if there was accommodation for our private driver (a common courtesy in Sri Lanka), the staff assured us there was. However, upon arrival, we discovered this was not the case. Our driver had to find his own accommodation last minute, which could have been avoided if they had been honest from the start.

The room itself was disappointing. The towels were stained, and the toiletries looked old and unpresentable. While I want to believe the towels were clean despite the stains, it left the impression that the hotel prioritizes cost-cutting over delivering a quality guest experience.

The most frustrating issue was the lack of hot water. After a long day, we were too exhausted to address it and resorted to cold showers. When we raised this with the duty manager the next day, another guest overheard and echoed the same complaint. The manager explained their water heating system is solar-powered and offered to turn on a backup generator, but the hot water remained inconsistent throughout our stay.

To be fair, the service staff were respectful and prompt, which we appreciated. However, this didn’t make up for the lack of basic amenities or the feeling that guest comfort is not the hotel’s priority.

Overall, I cannot recommend Seerock. Between the misleading communication, subpar room standards, and functional shortcomings, this was a deeply disappointing experience.
title: No hot water and dirty towels

text:
The room with the jacuzzi is great. It’s the only good thing about the hotel other than the staff. The room is actually a luxurious room but the water pressure was not that good. Also the jacuzzi wasn’t working really well. It leaked on our first night.

Pool had no view at all and the showers and the water feature was not working at all. Several pool tiles were also broken and there were many frogs inside the pool. Also it was not cleaned properly. There was no place to take nice pictures even. They’ve ample place but not maintained properly. Landscaping is nil. Also horrible wifi 

Food was the worst we’ve ever tried at any hotel. Don’t get fooled by the positive comments regarding the food. I’m pretty sure they’ve not tried star hotels before. The menu was horrible. There was actually nothing to choose from. Menu needs to change and also only the local food was okay. Other than that pastas was horrible. I had a spaghetti bolognese and it was not a bolognese at all. They just served me noodles with beef and tomato slices 🤦🏾‍♂️ 

The worst thing is we booked the hotel on full board through another app with a discount. The management refused to serve us English breakfast because we booked it on a discount. It was not mentioned anywhere at all. Also it’s very poor to treat different customers in a different way. 

The only silver lining is Shehara who tried her best to give us an enjoyable vacation but this was a disastrous vacation. 

Again what I have to say is don’t be fooled by the pictures or positive comments
title: Don’t get fooled by the positive comments. Horrible food and experience

text:
Beautiful large rooms with jacuzzi that we couldn’t use as the water pressure was terribly slow. It would take 1 hour to fill the bath.
Staff super kind but they stole my iPad and $125 from the suitcase. I put all the valuable things in the safe (thank God) but left out the iPad and money that were in my suitcase (not on a desk or whatever). The staff opened my suitcase and did the job. There were 2 male cleaners who were cleaning the rooms. Just saying.
I emailed the manager 2 days later when I found out the items were missing and they couldn’t do anything about. They said that 2 days later was a long time after the departure. Really? I am on holiday and busy discovering places, I don’t have time to use my iPad every day.

Upon check out, the manager asked me to pay additional 2000Rupes for the driver’s accommodation which of course I refused to pay. Shocking. My driver had to step in and argue with the manager as this was going nowhere. Even the driver promised not to bring any tourist in that place by the way he was treated.

Worst hotel ever.

There are plenty hotels in the area.
Don’t get fooled by the price.
You’ve been warned.
title: Don’t get fooled. Go elsewhere.

text: Comfortable well appointed rooms , but that’s it. Despite several emails they had not adhered to our request for a triple room. There was no pool attendant and the shower and water feature at the pool did not work. There was no way to communicate with the staff from the room. No phone. placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa,Sigiriya, Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
I'm a frequent traveler and I was tempted to try out this hotel as I came across one of their offers. I called the hotel and checked their availability and placed a temporary booking. Then I confirmed the offer and made the payment and requested them to send the booking confirmation. 

I had been trying for 3 days to get a booking confirmation from them!!! But still had NO success. I travel a quite a lot and sending a booking confirmation is a matter of few minutes usually. I was surprised why it is taking them days to send a simple booking confirmation. I have made more than 10 calls over the past 3 days to ask for the booking. Also, to my surprise I found that the last few calls made to the landline were intentionally picked up and cancelled. (This is a FIRST in many of my travels).

Also, I had the feeling that the first female agent who picked up the reservation was clueless. She was not good in her English, so I spoke to her in Sinhalese. Whenever I inquired about the booking she will reply saying it will be sent shortly. But it never came in the first 3 days. What a waste of time!

Finally on the fourth day another reservation executive picks up the call and sends me a booking for a different set of days. I tried to call and ask them to correct it. But the hotel never picked up any of their phones.

So i finally decided to cancel the booking. 
I'm sure they have made a Blunder somewhere!!!
hence this reaction! 
I have seen hotels make mistakes before but the quality hotels always try to make amends and will usually try to check with the customer and correct it. This is a good sign of the lack of quality and lack of training of the staff. If the staff is this negligent and rude even prior to your arrival, I'm glad I didn't go there to find out!
title: Terrible Customer Service / Guest Handling / Not reliable

placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa,Sigiriya, Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
For some context, as part of our India and Sri Lanka trip we had stayed at Leela Palace, The Oberoi and Anantara Peace Haven Tangalle all of which were actually cheaper than this hotel (we paid about 59,000LKR per night) but miles ahead in terms of service, amenities and luxury. It’s really surprising reading all these positive reviews when this is a hotel that charges 5 star prices but is 3 star at best. 

Entry to the hotel is via a bumpy and dusty dirt road. 

The power kept cutting in and out during our stay. 

The menu is a lucky dip because it’s only after you order that they tell you things are not available. 

Some staff, although friendly, don’t have adequate English skills which at a hotel charging such prices that is supposed to cater for international guests is not appropriate. It should not take 3 different staff members and 10 minutes of gesturing to communicate a request for some toast. 

The place is full of mosquitoes which means unless you douse yourself in bug spray each night you can’t actually enjoy the lounge or dinner at the restaurant. One night we had the door open for about 30 seconds and that was enough for me to wake up with several large mosquito bites (see photos) despite having the mosquito net over the bed! 

We were very clear with our complaints to the manager and he did make some changes such as adding incense to the dining area to reduce the mosquitoes but that meant you’re eating with smoke coming over your food!

We told him we really don’t see how the hotel has the audacity to charge 59,000lkr per night especially when we only saw two other couples during our 3 day stay and a couple of weeks later the rate was around 29,000lkr per night. 

He said that because we booked via hotels.com he couldn’t do anything which isn’t true since we have friends who own hotels. 

He did credit our food bill for our stay which was about 17,000lkr. 

We have stayed at many places throughout the world ranging from B&Bs to high end hotels but never have we felt so ripped off in terms of value!

Yes the service is good but service is good everywhere in Sri Lanka so it’s nothin unique to this hotel. 

We do agree that the food is very delicious compared to other places but even their prices (cheap for western standards) are out of proportion to the other 5 star hotels we stayed at.

We would have given this a really high rating had the rate been about 30,000lkr because it definitely did not deliver on its price tag. If you can book for about this price then definitely stay here but dont get ripped off and pay anymore.
title: Extremely poor value

placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa,Sigiriya, Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid this hotel because of the awful service and bad food
text:
The hotel is situated in a remote area, in the middle of an artificial swamp. The location is very nice considering there are many wild birds and monkeys around in the trees.

We had a superior deluxe room which include a jacuzzi tub in the room. The room is very big with a very comfortable bed, and a high and interesting roof. It has acces to two patios one in the front and one in the back, both of patios had chairs and one of them had a table. There is no free minibar.

To go from your room to the restaurant / reception you need a lantern which was also provided in the room.

After we took a bath in the jacuzzi, we ended up without hot water, so we had to wash ourselves with almost cold water.

We had dinner at the restaurant, and we had to wait more than one hour for a club sandwich and a burger. The food was not fantastic but the service was terrible, considering that other clients that got to dinner after us, were served sooner even though they also had similar food (burger and pasta). We then had to wait almost another hour for the bill; we received two bills, one in USD for food and one in SRK (rupees) for the beverages. We wanted to pay both bills in local currencies but the final bill was not received and we had to go the bar and ask again for the bill so we can pay it. 

We thought this was an isolated case but it proves we were wrong when at next morning breakfast the service was the same.

For breakfast there is a menu with only two or three menus for breakfast out of which you have to chose one. So we ordered two portion of fresh fruits, 2 glasses of fresh juice, tea, jam, butter and bread. 

When the waiter came he decided we can both have only one portion of jam, butter and bread. The fruit plate had very few pieces of fruits (a banana cut in half ? wtf ? a bite of pineaple, a bite of watermelon and a bite of papaya).
We felt like we were two people having a one person breakfast, and the breakfast and the service was so bad it just made us feel like we received the breakfast for free, though we had a DELUXE SUPERIOR ROOM with BREAKFAST INCLUDED.

We do not recommend at all this place because of the service and the very bad food.
title: AWFUL service, nice location, nice room
