placeInfo/address: 35 PBA Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Honestly we're lost for words to describe how bad this hotel was. We weren't expecting luxury, but we at least thought it would be a solid 4/5 star hotel. It was the complete opposite!

The bedroom was filthy and dusty, we were moved twice but all three rooms were dirty and they then had no other availability (it looked like tour guides had bulk bought a lot of the rooms, obviously at some good rate for them). The bathroom was unsurprisingly disgusting too, with literal piles of dust in some corners with a selection of insects, incredibly mouldy silicone, etc etc. We had to stay here one night, and then were out as soon as we could be!

We had booked dinner with our stay, but that was equally terrible to the extent we ended up just going out to eat somewhere local. The restaurant area was all outdoors and the food was shameful and barely edible. As the food was all outdoors there were insects crawling all over the place, just incredibly off-putting and unhygienic.

Not a place any of us would ever want to come back to!
title: Would give this hotel 0/5 if possible, absolutely terrible experience!

text:
I’m extremely disappointed with the cake I ordered from Mahaweli Reach Hotel – Asiri Hospital Kandy outlet. The strawberries on top were moldy, which is completely unacceptable—especially from a brand with such a strong reputation in Sri Lanka.

This cake was a gift for someone very special, and I was honestly embarrassed when she pointed out the spoiled fruit. I placed the order 4 days in advance, trusting in their quality and standards.

After I raised a complaint, the staff member I spoke to tried to defend the brand by giving false explanations, insisting that it wasn’t their fault. She wasn’t unprofessional in her manner, but she clearly gave misleading information to protect the hotel's name—without understanding how their own online ordering system works or even acknowledging the timing of my purchase. None of what she said aligned with the facts. It felt like they were just trying to push the blame onto me rather than taking any responsibility.

So please be cautious if you're buying food from this hotel. In my experience, they do not genuinely consider the customer's side—they only defend their position, no matter what happens to you.

I do not recommend this place to anyone.
title: I do not recommend this place to anyone

The hotel is extremely unhygienic, and the food is poorly cooked. The buffet timings are inconvenient; for example, breakfast ends at 9 a.m., which is problematic if we wake up late and miss it. Dinner also ends too early, and the buffet area floor is not clean.

We found many insects in the food, especially around the juice section.

The condition of the rooms is very bad. The furniture is worn out, the televisions are outdated, and the windows are difficult to open.

The bathroom has many sharp corners and edges, which can be dangerous. The drawers in the closets fall out when opened.

The service is terrible. When you order food, it arrives cold, and phone responses are slow.

The reception staff is unprofessional. They deceived us when we requested a better room. They fulfilled our request but later charged us an additional $200 per night without informing us beforehand.

I strongly discourage you from visiting this hotel. The management is neither respectful nor friendly, and they only care about taking your money without providing proper service. Please do not visit this hotel.

text:
Our 2 days stay experience is average as there are many issues which a five star should not have.
Our check in with welcome drink and cool towel was good but reception decor was looking cheap with plastic flowers. The room was huge but there are no charging points or adapter available to charge phones etc. which is not expected in 5 star hotel. Bathroom was small and The bathtub in bathroom was unnecessary as it was small and not convenient to take shower which again not expected from 5 star property.Room has unwanted big wall mirrors but tiny TV which again not expected from 5 star property.The spa couldn’t be experienced as there was only therapist who busy throughout. The bar area was not ergonomically located and had uncomfortable big furniture which was not polished at all made the hotel look old.The only saving grace is restaurant which has huge variety in dinner and breakfast buffet with great staff Ms Anjali,Mr Kevin,Ms Nadeesha,Mr Indika who took good care of us and that’s why 2 stars.
Overall, hotel property is beautiful with great view of lake and pool but other aspects show that hotel is outdated and require renovation and restructuring to be considered as 5 star hotel
title: Not a five star hotel but staff is good

We had a very bad experience during our stay at Mahaweli Reach Hotel during our Sri Lanka tour in March 2024. Once we returned after finishing the breakfast to the room we saw all our luggage was kept outside in the lobby and the beds linen was removed and our personal items in the room (DSLR camera, Ladies purse bag) was handled. We refused to accept the gift and asked them to investigate this issue as this is a major lapse in their system. 
The service is also not upto the mark, the previous night we had requested for water at 8:30pm which was never delivered.
Please avoid staying at this property.

text: I cannot recommend this hotel. In a 4 day stay (we left a day early) the hotel hosted 3 all day weddings.  Hotel huests were shunted to a depressing first floor viewless room for mediocre buffet meals while wedding guests had priority of all the public spaces including the bar and poolside dining room .  The grounds, on each day, were full of workers either constructing or taking down marquees and wedding decorations and we were advised we could order room service if we didnt like what was on offer. Music went on all evening as we lurked in our bedroom, unable to even hear the television.  This was not what we envisaged when we were seduced by the photos and promises of the web site.  We leave here tomorrow and cant wait.  My advice as a travel professional....book the Mahwali Reach at your own risk.

placeInfo/address: 35 PBA Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
This is not a five star hotel as advertised, 2 star at best. I’m not sure of why the other reviews are so high. We stayed here for 2 nights and honestly couldn’t wait to leave! 
Cons:
- as mentioned earlier, it’s not a five star hotel. We had chosen since it’s advertised as five star.  In this same trip I have stayed at the Fullerton (Singapore), followed by Cinnamon Grand (Colombo), Jetwing Galle and Jetwing Yala. So I’m comparing based on rates. The room rate was cheaper- should have known!
- Rooms are old and dated- after we had checked out we found that only the 2nd and 3rd floors were renovated. So don’t stay on the first floor rooms- ours was old dated, mold everywhere in the shower, just looked unclean. Rugs had a terrible smell, unclean with stains. 
- Bedding: grey, felt wet and there was dirt- hair and lint under the covers that I had to remove before sleeping. We didn’t complain only because we were tired from our trip, it was late and just wanted to get to bed. 
- Other clientele ( from two of the most populous countries) - I get it that this is expected of any hotel and it’s not the hotel’s fault. Our experience was so bad that I have to mention that these tourists were in large groups, were rude at staff, obnoxious, loud (literally yelling wherever they were), kids running around uncontrolled by their parents and lacked any etiquette during the meal times. Basically they owned the place, you couldn’t get to your food at the buffet, as they would be having their group conversations at the buffet and some would pick foods with their hands. Avoid if this bothers you about other clientele. 
- Food was mediocre, basic at best, staff couldn’t keep up with requests. Always long queue at the buffet and as mentioned with the large groups it’s a battle. One of the nights we dined outside at a nearby (walking distance) restaurant called Flower Drum- went there on recommendation by our driver and it was great- authentic Chinese food at very reasonable prices. 
Pros:
- Staff- they do their best, they are attentive and friendly, we found only a handful  understand  and able to speak. 
- the surrounds (lake) and pool - great and is the only thing I enjoyed of this hotel.
title: 2 Star at best

text:
Im struggling to find any real positives of the hotel apart from the average pool onsite . The rooms are old, dirty and worn out . The bath tub doubles as a shower area with arguably the worst shower head position . The king size bed is essentially two beds joined together - so effectively the middle is a no go zone . 

However,  the worst part of the hotel is the substandard food on offer . Breakfast is a joke. The cooking stations might as well not exist as there is hardly any service given when your in front (this maybe partly due to the number of rude Indian families that frequent the hotel). The hopper station quality was so bad that I was shocked when I was served which essentially is a raw hopper (see pics) . Dinner wasn’t any better and for our second night stay - we ate outside due to the poor quality of food offer . 

Unfortunately I can’t see much of a change taking place unless the hotel is completely refurbished, management overhauled and new staff hired .
title: Go elsewhere

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Kalkudah 10120 Sri Lanka
text:
I am writing to express my profound dissatisfaction with our recent stay at Amaya Beach Resort in Passikuda, Sri Lanka.

From the moment we arrived, we were taken aback by the hotel’s appearance. The property looked cheap, and the reception area was sparse and scattered. Although the front desk reception was warm and helpful, and we did receive a property tour, our experience quickly deteriorated.

We were placed in a room far from the main reception area, down a dark and dingy corridor that felt very unsafe. The security presence on the property was minimal, and we did not feel secure. The room itself was very basic, lacking the amenities one would expect from a five-star hotel. There were no bedroom slippers, gowns, or other basic comforts. The beds were rock hard and extremely uncomfortable, with not even a carpet on the floor. The couch was dirty and literally falling apart, making the room feel more like a dormitory than a supposed five-star hotel. Additionally, the bathroom blinds did not work.

The main dining area was chaotic, with basic meals and no order in terms of serving and setting. The dining area was clearly unequipped to handle the busy season, and my children were uncomfortable as they were pushed around by adults in the chaos. The residents of the hotel were extremely rowdy, with doors banging, people shouting through the night, and loud club-style music playing. We could even hear furniture being moved, which made for an unsavoury experience.

When we alerted the reception about these issues, they said it was out of their control and only offered to move us to a room closer to reception in the middle of the night, while my children were already trying to fall asleep. We were deeply unhappy with the hotel, its facilities, and the type of guests it attracts. Consequently, we packed up and left the very next morning.

This experience was far from what we expected, and we are extremely disappointed. We hope that these observations and suggestions will help improve the experience for future guests.
title: Profoundly Disappointing Stay at Amaya Beach Resort

text:
Сегодня ночью в 1:00 я  пошла к администрации отеля, чтобы попросить сделать музыку потише. Администратор ничего не сделал, соврал, что закончится через 20 минут. Не закончилось, я пошла за стойку к диджею сама, потому что никто ничего не мог сделать. Ко мне подбежали пьяные и ужасные мужчины и начали на меня кричать, а персонал отеля просто стоял и смотрел!!! Я такого ужасного отношения никогда в жизни не встречала. Никогда не посещайте этот отель с детьми и в праздники. Вы встретите ужасных гостей отеля, ужасный сервис, ужасную шумоизоляцию, ужасную администрацию, которая ничего не может. 

Last night at 1:00 I went to the hotel administration to ask to turn down the music. The administrator did nothing, lied that it would end in 20 minutes. It didn't end, I went to the DJ stand myself, because no one could do anything. Drunk and horrible men ran up to me and started yelling at me, and the hotel staff just stood and watched!!! I have never seen such a horrible attitude in my life. Never visit this hotel with children and on holidays. You will meet horrible hotel guests, horrible service, horrible soundproofing, horrible administration that can't do anything.
title: Позорные русские и амебная администрация

text:
Начну с плюсов: 
Стильно построен, красивый 

Минусы
Очень слабый интернет, днем на пляже в принципе видео сложно грузятся, работать также не получается.  Если решите поработать с ноутбуком днем, вряд ли получится.

Покупая вино в баре на пляже, мы получили пару бокалов красного сухого вина, 30 градусной температуры. Очень необычно. 
3. Бассейн - реальная глубина от 50 см до 1 метра. То есть это просто широкая ванная для детей.
4. Самый главный минус отеля это отсутствие развлечений.
Аниматоров нет. Собрать команду для волейбола сложно.
Водные виды спорта в реальности отсутствуют.  
Йоги нет. 
Го овьтесь к тому что ваши развлечения это книги, работа, и загорание. 

Вишенка на торте - до пляжа где можно купаться в океане 600 метров. И проходишь через общественный пляж.

roomTip: Go elsewhere if you want a relaxing, cared-for experience.
text:
We are a family of 3 and we should have stayed 4 nights at Amaya Beach. We checked out after 2 and went to Uga Bay which is 3 times the price but a 10 times better experience. I’m very surprised to see so many people calling this place “luxury” or “high end”, it’s really not. The reality does not match their website descriptions or photos. I just found the whole place quite depressing.

First, the positives - our room was excellent. Spacious, loads of room for luggage and storage, effective AC and a nice balcony.

Housekeeping is very efficient and friendly, as are the reception staff. Sadly, we felt that the communal areas, bar staff and some of the food really lets the hotel down. 

Our biggest issue is that we wanted to spend most of our time during this part of our holiday (a 2 week tour of Sri Lanka) in the pool and/or the sea/beach. Both of these areas at Amaya are frankly a disgrace. The pool is filthy, it has a greasy, grimy ring around the whole of the edge and there are living insects (water fleas?) in it. If the proper chlorine levels are applied and cleanliness standards adhered to, there should be no living creatures in a swimming pool! 

The beach has clearly been man made using sand bags made of plastic, which are now eroding away into the ocean, causing devastating pollution of the hotel’s own making. The lack of any attempt or effort to clean the swimming pool and sort out the plastic sandbags on the beach speaks to the general feeling of a lack of care from staff. 

Crows are clearly present all along this part of the coast, however there were far more here than at Uga Bay and would hazard a guess that it’s because they actually clear away dirty plates and glasses there quickly, unlike here! Crows are extremely clever birds and have obviously learned that they can have a feast at Amaya Beach. As someone has said, they are constantly drinking from the pool water and leaving droppings everywhere. 

The service in the bar area is woeful. Dirty glasses and dishes sat for a long time whilst staff watched cricket on tv. See photo attached of dirty glasses that were left in the hotel grounds overnight and for the whole of the next day - several staff walked past these many times. Staff at the bar were unfriendly and lazy. Reactive, never proactive - the onus is on the customer for everything, even getting their own bill. Had to go to bar every time you want something. To have a 10% service charge added to each bill here is an insult.

You have to beg for towels and when we first arrived he said there are “none left”… “you wait 20 mins”. There is a full time pool attendant who not once got sun lounger cushions out - all guests lay on hard rattan sun loungers that were falling apart. We got some cushions from a filthy looking pile by side of hotel - the pool guy came over and said these were old and that if we waited 2 hours the new ones would be ready…well of course they never materialised. Why is the onus on the paying customer to return towels? There were two staff by the towel bin doing literally nothing but kick a ball around.

Dining experience is not great (hot, very busy) and food quality overall is poor. All meat dishes have bones in them - the lamb curry last night even contained liver. Limited choice and some foods incorrectly labelled eg pasta puttanesca was a creamy pasta. Salad and fruit offerings at breakfast were clearly leftovers from night before. The exception was the egg bar at breakfast- the eggs and omelettes were very good. 

I feel bad for the lovely staff who put effort into their jobs here - they are being let down by poor management who quite frankly should be addressing the issues I’ve highlighted. Our tour operator told the management team of our plans to leave early, however when we checked out the following day the reception staff had no idea - they had not been told. The fact that family is checking out early because they are not happy tells you all you need to know about management’s attitude to customer service.
title: All the positives are sadly outweighed by the negatives

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Kalkudah 10120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Enjoying the beach is in your bucket list, you will be extremely disappointed. Small area only but local occupied the whole beach.
text:
My first negative review after many years, but I have to tell the truth.
We reached the hotel midday 13th April after 8 hours of journey & absolutely no welcome at all, we thought they might offer some welcome drinks & some towel but nothing came we went to the bar and ordered some juices. Entire staff under trained and absolutely no respect/response to the customers because their not trained at all, the restaurant cannot accommodate large number of guests so you may have to wait until someone finishes to get a seat because so many walking customers and they get the preference as they know the staff and tables were not clean, table mats are dirty too. We book two rooms the executive suit 2112 but outside, garden lights not working, fridge not working we stayed 3 nights but they didn’t attend to it. 
Breakfast & dinner buffet is good but not 4star for sure maximum 3 star. I suggest the executive chef to do food tasting before they put to buffet.
Hopper making guy takes long time to make an egg hopper again untrained staff. 
If you want to order hopper or omelette you may have to stand and wait for long time. 
This hotel situated next to the biggest public beach in eastern province and the whole beach is packed every day with locals and it’s so dirty too. Beach in front of this hotel is beautiful but you can’t bath because full of Corel’s the only area you can bath completely Conquered by the local people be careful with your belongings. 
New year day 14th April, we thought they will keep some sweets like kavum, kokis, aasmi, aluwa for breakfast but nothing at all. first time in my life in a hotel that they didn’t serve new year goodies to the guest on new year day.
Staff will always staring at you if you order anything maybe staff not happy. 
Only room service staff and some staff members at the bar is going a good job. Rooms are spacious But basic amenities are not their toothbrushes, toothpaste, bathrobes, slippers etc..
Towels are pretty old, if you’re going to pool/beach you need to go to the pool attendant and beg for towel then you must return and mark the book otherwise you may have to pay for the towels.
Entire staff including the top management need to learn the hospitality industry & check how others properties in your chain handling the new year day and beyond. I asked for a glass of water at breakfast on 14th April from few nobody gave then I went to take a juice then no glasses 🥲.
Good bye Amaya hotels, we will never ever visit your properties again.
title: Extremely Disappointed, very poor food quality & hospitality.

After investigating the issue, it appears that there was an inconsistency in the booking registration process on the Booking.com platform, which resulted in us not receiving your reservation via Booking.com. We acknowledge the frustration and disappointment this situation may have caused. Regrettably, we are unable to address this matter directly, as it must be resolved with Booking.com. We recommend reaching out to Booking.com directly to seek assistance, as they are the sole entity equipped to help you in this regard.

We appreciate your understanding and patience in this matter. If there is anything specific you would like us to address or assist you with, please feel free to reach out. Once again, we apologize for any inconvenience, and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future for a more seamless and enjoyable experience.

Management - Amaya Resorts & Spas
placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Kalkudah 10120 Sri Lanka
text:
The worst Hotel in Sri -Lanka!

We had our worst experience today(11.12.2023). Our family booked 02 rooms in this property through Booking.com, and we had prepaid. However when we showed at the property they were clue less about our booking. Even when we showed our booking reference they were not able to trace our booking.
I can understand, if this is was booked through any other site, can be an excuse. But how come Booking.com mislead, as per resort, booking has been taken over by another agent.  
Am the guest, when I book through booking.com, I don’t care with whom they have partnered. It’s totally irrelevant to me. I book and I paid, it’s simple theory. 
We arrived to the property 13:30hrs, and they kept us waiting 2hours in the lobby with poor decision making management. Simply Front office has no experience at all they were all busy on there phones.  
The front office manager roaming around with no clue, very disappointed to see there professionalism.  Finally we lost our money for stay which we didn’t use. 
How to handle the issue, you could have give us the rooms, and for sure you will receive booking request through the agent day after.

Note that, word of mouth is very power tool. I would use it at every inch. 
Once again you are the worst hotel in Sri Lanka. Scammers!!!!!
title: Worst Front office Staff

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Kalkudah 10120 Sri Lanka
text: On our school reunion trip to Sri Lanka, we went with a group of 25 people and stayed at Amaya Beach - Pasikudah for two nights.  The hotel itself is amazing, award worthy architechture, the rooms are very spacious, right on the beach with a big, clean well maintained pool (max. depth is slightly less than 2 metres and there is a public beach next door which is not deep which we were able to use.  But the good things end there.  The food service at the restaurant is below average, there is no service, we literealy have to ask for everything like napkins, water etc. We have booked a beach barbecue party which they reuined beyond words because the food was below average.  This dinner was supposed to be our highlight of the week long trip.  We have complained to the restaurant manager but it looks like its fallen on deaf ears.  We also stayed at Amaya Hills-Kandy and Amaya Lake-Dumbulla, they were doing an excellent job in every department and its puzziling to me that Amaya Beach-Pasikudah can get away with bad service while being a part this chain. Would not recommend if anyone is going to use the restaurant but otherwise its a good hotel.
title: Horrible food but great resort

roomTip: Don't keep lot of hope on food. Location very good
text:
We stayed a night on full board basis. We booked before 1 month. We came to celebrate a kid's birthday and we made several phone calls many times over that month to inform about it and they promised that they are going to decorate the room. They said that it is their usual practice. Even the same day before and after coming we requested it. But nobody even cared to do it or apologize for not doing it. Utter disappointment😢😢😢. Child was very sad.
When we checked in, we did not even get a welcome drink. We were very tired after the long journey. Had been to many hotels before , but this was the first time we got a welcome like this.
Food was also not that tasty. Less variety. Same desserts within same day in different meals.
They also allowed people to get in the pool with normal clothes. No body wash before. Just regular cloths and head covering.
Location is good. Beach is very good.
title: Very poor service

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Kalkudah 10120 Sri Lanka
text: Rien à dire sur le confort des chambres et la propreté en général. En revanche les pratiques envers les touristes sont plus que limites : paiement en avance dès l'arrivée, buffet composé à l'économie (par exemple que des pastèques et des poires pas mûres pendant 3 jours, pas de mangues, de bananes ou d'ananas... café soluble...), bouteilles d'eau vendues seulement en petit format pour un prix délirant, prix affichés sur les carte du bar/snack bar sans les taxes du pays... Bref, le sentiment  d'être un peu un pigeon... Dommage.
title: Bien trop cher pour l'expérience vécue!

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Kalkudah 10120 Sri Lanka
text:
On va passer rapidement sur les points positifs qui sont, selon moi, le minimum attendu compte tenu du prix de la nuit: propreté de la chambre, qualité de la literie, accueil chaleureux du personnel…
Concernant les points négatifs ils sont malheureusement assez nombreux : propreté de la plage, nombreux coraux rendant la baignade difficile, propreté de l’eau de la piscine à revoir, faible profondeur de la piscine, qualité des buffets pas à la hauteur du prix demandé: nous avons eu les mêmes fruits pendant 3 jours (pastèque, papaye et poire) et quand on demande d’autres fruits locaux comme la mangue, ananas on nous répond que ce n’est pas possible, jus de fruits du petit déjeuner de très mauvaise qualité (en fait c’est plus du Tropico… coco 😄). Bref un spot intéressant pour une nuit mais ne vaut pas le détour. Très cher par rapport au autres spots visités et rien à découvrir à proximité.
title: Low value for money
